properties.Name: Other Blackbird
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child, and an old man, blind and dependent
properties.House_Comm: Fair cabin, no stable, no root house. Promises to build a root house this year.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, harrow, rake, spring wagon, only
properties.Remarks: Lives at home except in winter, when he must go near the creek for water. Works very wll. He and his wife were both working in the garden when we called at their house. They came in while we were there and when we left, they immediately went back to the

properties.Name: Ben Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch. Fence posts surrounding the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; mother; brother, Felix, 21 years old
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing. Put up hay elsewhere.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house and log house. Building a barn.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house and a log house. Building a barn.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This land is really very hard to plow and work. It is heavy and remains wet late in the spring. Ben does not need very much discouragement to keep him from working. He seems to have had the means, someway, to get along with the very little work, living o

properties.Name: Edward Big Medicine
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. alfalfa, 42 wheat, 20 A. wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses
properties.House_desc: Good 3-room log haouse, fair log stable, chicken house, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Good 3-room log haouse, fair log stable, chicken house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, mower, rake, spring wagon, wagon
properties.Remarks: This boy lives with his father, Big Medicine, who has been Chief of Police at the Agency for many years. His home seems to be a sort of stopping place and harbor for everybody who comes this way, and they feed a great many visitors, as is always the case

properties.Name: Yellow Face
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with an adjacent log building. Two other log buildings stand to the left of the house and a fence surrounds the perimeter.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 10 range horses, 2 or 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 log houses, root cellar, stable.
properties.Implement_: Mower, plow, hay-rake.
properties.Remarks: I visited this place twice, but did not find anyone at home. They just happened to be away temporarily, they usually live in the same place and they keep their place much better than most of the Indians. It is clean and neat about the yard and the house

properties.Name: William Dust
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a couple windows, a chimney, and a porch.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheatm 5 A. oats, 30 A. hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 6 range horses, 1 race horse, 2 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New frame house and root house. No barn.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, disc, plow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks:
This manâ€™s house is rather remote from any-other Indian place. Usually Indians do not like to live by themselves and the fact that he built this new house several miles from the nearest Indian residence, promises well. 

He has not been living there ve

properties.Name: Pretty Coyote
properties.Linked_Acc: Manuel Mountain Bull, David Bull Mountain
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and door. A couple tents stand to the back right along with a log building. A man, Pretty Coyote, and his children stand infront of the house with a horse.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only, and David Bull Mountain, stepson, and wife.
properties.Location_D: On Pryor Creek, 4 miles above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 30 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa, mixed hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 race horses 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Industry: None
properties.Remarks: When I called at this house in the middle part of the day in the middle part of the summer, I found Pretty Coyote and his stepson, who lives with him, sitting in the house. Pretty Coyote made no pretense of working. He said he had his crops raised by a r

properties.Name: Prairie Gros Ventre
properties.Linked_Acc: John Gros Ventre, Dan Old Bull
properties.Remarks: Prairie Gros Ventre is the father of John, whose report see. He lives with his son in the same house and they do not maintain any separate farm, but the old man works with his son so far as he is able. There is no special separate report to make in his c

properties.Name: One Star
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. Two women sit in front of the house with a kitchen pit in front of them. To the right of the house there is a wagon.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley above Lodge Grass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 4 A. oats, 30 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 5 saddle  horses, 15 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, well kept, fair furniture; shed stable; root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, well kept, fair furniture; shed stable; root house.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, disc, cultivator, mower, rake, 2 buckrakes, stacker, interested in binder, wagon, spring wagon

properties.House_desc: Poor log house not on his land

properties.Name: Louis Bompard
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. To the right is a shed and an outhouse. In front of the house is an automobile, dog, two individuals, and a child on a bike.
properties.Crop_Desc: Winter wheat 25 A., oats 10 A. Alfalfa 3 Acres wild hay about 40 A. rest in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: About 3 work horses, 2 saddle horses and some 10 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old house indifferently kept. Old stable ready to fall down. Has root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Old house indifferently kept. Old stable ready to fall down. Has root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit for farming and hay-making. Wagon, automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from river, has no well.
properties.Gen_Cond: Fair. They work spasmodically. Yesterday he and his son were in the garden and hardly had time to talk to us. Many other days, they are not found a home. They are visiting or in town.
properties.Remarks: After long persuasion the farmer goe them to put in this winter wheat which looks very well and promises to make a big crop. Louis take pride in showing a big variety of vegetable and all the unusual vegetables that he can hear about. It is not a great e

properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. beans, 3 A. oats, 3 A. mixed hay

properties.House_Comm: Cheap temporary house, poor stable, root house
properties.Implement_: Fair haying outfit, wagons, etc.
properties.Remarks: This young man had not done much work and was more or less dissipated. He went to the army. Soon after his return he married a young widow from the Fort Berthold Reservation, who is comparatively 1/2 or 3/4 white. They are now living regularly out on the

properties.Name: Ball
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Three individuals standing to the right side of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Lives with married daugther and husband (Henry Big Day). They work on the farm. Also with their grandchild, but not from the daughter I don't think.
properties.Location_D: Central Big Horn Valley near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some land leased elsewhere.
properties.Stock_Desc: 11 saddle and range horses, combined
properties.House_Comm: Good house, well kept. Indifferent stable.
properties.Implement_: Hay tools, wagons, plow, drills, wagon. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: No well. Haul water from neighbors or from river. Stock go to river for water.
properties.Gen_Cond: Buildings, fences and farm in fair conditions. Fences need repairs.
properties.Industry: Only fair. Could work much better.
properties.Remarks: Ball says that he does not play pool. This was one merit. He and his son-in-law work together, and to some extent own the equipment together. This house is almost as well kept as that of Mr. Ties His Knees. The furniture and rugs are good. There are too

properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child; father-in-law, and wife; widowed daughter
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Think he could work if he would try.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa, 6 A. mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, one saddle horse, one race horse, no cattle.

properties.Remarks:
Isaac makes a very poor effort at farming. I told him I could not see what was going to keep him from starving to death. He has not ample crop to feed his family. 

He is indolent and indifferent. Perhaps if he gets good and hungry for one winter and sur

properties.Name: Bird Hat
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with trees along the right side.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; father, Bell Rock, an old man; son, Sampson, and wife.
properties.Health_Com: Not able to work much. Son, Sampson, all right.
properties.Crop_Desc: 32 A. wheat, 30 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 4 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle, but says he has 2 race horses.
properties.House_desc: fair log house, stable. No root house but promises to build one.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, stable. No root house but promises to build one.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon

properties.Name: Round Rock
properties.Location_D: 4 miles south of Hardin in Big Horn Valley.

properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse, 1 saddle horse.
properties.House_desc: None
properties.House_Comm: None.
properties.Implement_: Plow, cultivator, harness

properties.Name: Shobe Daylight
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, and an extension on the  back. To the left of the house stand another frame building.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 brothers and their wives, some children
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley 4 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 36 A. alfalfa; 40 A. wild hay; 30 A. wheat, yielded 500 bushels
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 8 saddle horses, 28 unbroke range horses, 1 race horse, 1 champion outlaw, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, poorly kept and furnished; no stable or other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, poorly kept and furnished; no stable or other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, 2 discs, 2 mowers, rake, 2 buckrakes, stacker, drill, wagon, spring wagon

properties.Name: Medicine Rock Above
properties.Photo_Desc: There is a frame house and a log house in the photo. In between both houses is a tent. In front of the frame hosue stands a man, likely Medicine Rock Above.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, grown son and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Access to indifferent Mission School. One boy of school age.
properties.Crop_Desc: 70 A. alfalfam 30 A. hay, no wheat or oats, some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 range horses, uncertain number of cattle on the range.

properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log house used for storeroom, no root cellar, no stable.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit for planting and harvesting, except binder and disc, including wagon and spring wagon. Automobile belonging to some of the family.

properties.Name: Old Rabbit
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors and a chimney. A man, Old Rabbit, stands out front next to fence posts.
properties.Family_Des: None, but daughter and her husband, Jacob Big Hair, live with him.
properties.School_Des: Easy access to public school and Catholic day school.
properties.Location_D: St. Xavier in Big Horn Valley
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 acres alfalfa. No wheat or oats, most of other land idle.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 10 saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm implements and hay tools. Has no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Fair, but no farming is being done this spring.
properties.Remarks: Old Rabbit has no wife. His son-in-law has been living with him. They seem not to agree very well as to the crops. This year they are not putting in any grain, they have been working their teams on the road. They are building a new house and barn from th

properties.Name: Passes
properties.Photo_Desc: Log ouse with two windows, two chimney's, and covered front porch. A family, likely Passes, stands to the side of the house. A tent stands to the back left of the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: 6 A. wheat, 4 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, a few acres of mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 18 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Very good house, small stable, root house, toilet.
properties.House_Comm: Very good house, small stable, root house, toilet
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This house is quite well furnished and was in very good condition. I have been surprised to find as many Indian houses quite clean and well kept as I have found. Their effort in that line is very commendable. His family lives at home all the time and do

properties.Name: Arthur Bravo
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house
properties.House_desc: Poor frame house.
properties.House_Comm: Poor frame house
properties.Remarks: I visited this man's place two or three times, but never found him at home. He seldom lives at home. He works a little with Jack Covers Up, a neighbor, and I think Jack feeds him most of the time. He makes very little use of his own land. He, so far, has

properties.Name: McKinley Backbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition, two windows, two doors, and a chimney. A small portion of another building is seen to the left of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children, father-in-law, wife, and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Lodgegrass Public School, 4 miles. 2 children attending
properties.Crop_Desc: 55 A. weat, 10 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, rake, plow, biner, drill, harrow, disc.
properties.Remarks: McKinley is one of the best Indians on the Reservation in the matter of industry and honesty. He was not at home when I called there but I saw him helping another Indian make hay at some distance. He has inadequate hay land on his own place and helps his

properties.Name: Henry Big Day
properties.Education_: He attended reservation boarding school and his wife the Catolic school. Both talk English well.
properties.Location_D: Central part of Big Horn Valley
properties.Remarks: See Report of "Ball". Henry Big Day is reputed to be fairly industrious. He has not a place of his own but lives with his father-in-law and works with him. I urged upon him the importance of going into their own home and starting a farm of their own.

properties.Name: Two Leggings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door.  Two men, one likely Two Leggins, stand out front and another individual stands in the door way.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 5  children and an old lady relative
properties.Health_Com: Good for his age, but not able to work much.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Two Leggin Bridge
properties.Crop_Desc: 60 A. wild hay, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old frame house in poor condition; fair stable; root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, plow, riding plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Two leggings is one of the old men, a sort of sub-chief. He is making a very good effort considering his age. He does not do much farming, but he puts up most of his hay by himself with the help of the women and children. His house is very much in need o

properties.Name: Otto Bear Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch, two windows, and a chimney. Two individuals stand out front, likely Otto  Bear Cloud and his wife. A wagon stands to the left of the house and an automobile is in the front.
properties.Education_: Sherman Institute. Wife went to Haskell.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school by conveyance.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some wheat on rented land, in partnership. Very little else.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, no saddle horese, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair 3-room house, no stable. House is very poorly kept.
properties.House_Comm: Fair 3-room house, no stable. House is very poorly kept.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, rake, wagon. No mower, no stacker, no disc or drill or binder, but has one Ford.
properties.Remarks: Otto seems to have had a fair reputation as a laborer when he worked for someone else. He certainly shows no evidence of industry in connection with his own farm. They have managed to live with the help of tribal income and some work. The place where he

properties.Name: Daniel L. Frost
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with gathering area to the right. Poor quality photo due to vegetation.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wild hay, potatoes
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses
properties.House_desc: Small house
properties.House_Comm: Small house
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow
properties.Remarks: Daniel attended school at Haskell Institute. His father lived right at Pryor village and worked about the store. He was not running any farm of his own; hence, the boys did not have a regular place to get work when they came back from school. Daniel has

properties.Name: Foolish Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with extension. A tent standing in the front with fence posting visible. A man, Foolish Man, and his wife stand out front.
properties.Education_: Short time in old Day School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 4 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, harrow, rake, 2 plows, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or distant creek. Very inconvenient.
properties.Remarks: This farm is not very promising. He can seldom get any water for irrigation. He has no convenient water for domestic use. In winter, none at all, and as to go down near the creek. He probably could do better by irrigating early before the water was in de

properties.Name: Henry Shinbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a family, Henry Shinbone's, and a wagon out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 step children, both married and living separately mostly. Mother-in-law an old woman lives with them.
properties.Education_: Reservation school 8 years. Carlisle 5 years. Wife one year in Mission.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, near mouth of Reno Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: wheat 25 A. Oats 35 A. Hopes to increase acreage this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses. 15 range horses. One yearling heifer
properties.House_desc: Very good log house, large rooms. Poor stable. Fence, fair.
properties.House_Comm: Very good log house, large rooms. Poor stable. Fence, fair.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, mower, rake, sweep rake, grain drill, 2 wagons, buggy, 3 sets double harness
properties.Industry: Farms quite well. Considerable room for improvement.
properties.Remarks: This man lives on the allotment of his married daughter, where there is a good house, and there is more land to cultivate than on his own allotment. While he lives alone largely he does work in partnership with is son-in-law so that it is quite difficult

properties.Name: William Dust
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a couple windows, a chimney, and a porch.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheatm 5 A. oats, 30 A. hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 6 range horses, 1 race horse, 2 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New frame house and root house. No barn.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, disc, plow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks:
This manâ€™s house is rather remote from any-other Indian place. Usually Indians do not like to live by themselves and the fact that he built this new house several miles from the nearest Indian residence, promises well. 

He has not been living there ve

properties.Name: Old Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two doors and a chimney. A family, likely Old Whiteman's, stands out front. Some implements are scattered behind the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 5 A. oats, 60 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 50 unbroke range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 mowers, rake, 2 bullrakes, stacker, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This man is not famous as a hard worker and good farm member. He does stay at his own home very well, but hired most of his work done, either by shares of crops, or with money. He had a white family at the place when I was there, putting up his hay. He,

properties.Name: Yellow Face
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with an adjacent log building. Two other log buildings stand to the left of the house and a fence surrounds the perimeter.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 10 range horses, 2 or 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 log houses, root cellar, stable.
properties.Implement_: Mower, plow, hay-rake.
properties.Remarks: I visited this place twice, but did not find anyone at home. They just happened to be away temporarily, they usually live in the same place and they keep their place much better than most of the Indians. It is clean and neat about the yard and the house

properties.Name: Bird Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a tent standing in the distance behind. A wagon is pictured to the left of the house as well as to the right. Four individuals stand outside of the  house.
properties.Education_: He and wife have no education.
properties.School_Des: One mile to Baptist Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 6 miles above St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, little oats and a little alfalfa. Should have 100 A. wild hay, but did not irrigate it. Grasshoppers did considerable damage.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 10 range horses. All seem to be in his corral as there appeared to be about 40 up in the corral.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: plow, harrow, mower, rake, interest in binder, drill
properties.Remarks:
This land is particularly adapted to the native wild hay, but just for want of the industry to irrigate it, he had very little, I think not more than 10 ten. 

His house is a moderate log house, very indifferently furnished and kept. He had his implement

properties.Name: Small
properties.Linked_Acc: Big Hail, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with door. A tent stands to the left of the cabin. To the right of the house is a few implements, a wagon, and a man, likely Small, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one child. Big Hail and wife, and Campbell Big Hail and wife and children live with him.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, no alfalfa, no wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.Implement_: None at all, but borrows from his neighbors.
properties.Remarks: He admits that he likes to work and considering that he has no implements, he is doing very well. If he can irrigate as much as he claims, he certainly should have more hay. He is using the ground for pasture mostly. He was not at home when I visited his

properties.Name: James Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Large tents and a clothing line, with no houses pictured. To the right of the tents is an automobile and a wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children attending public and mission schools
properties.Education_: Carlisle and Reservation. Wife went to reservation schools.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Mission school and public school
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley near St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 15 range horses, 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nothing. Lives in a tent.
properties.House_Comm: Nothing. Lives in a tent.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm implements. No grain drill, no harrow, 2 wagons, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: This boy was trained to farm in Carlyle school and under the outing system with some German farmers in Pennsylvania. He talks English very well. He knows how work ought to be done, but he lacks the inclination to do it. He has as good a tract of land as

properties.Name: Bird Above
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch and fence surrounding the property. To the right of the house there is a windmill and a small shed. Further to the right there is a small tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son married. Son Eric works with them. -- find out in Eric's file that he's married and definitely living with them
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 wheat, 40 acres oats. 10 acres hay land and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. Some saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only
properties.Implement_: plows, mowers, rake wagons. fair outfit
properties.Water_Desc: From the creek or neighbors well. They have a well but not good.
properties.Gen_Cond: Indifferent. They have an old automobile but there is some hope in that respect because it looks like it was past repair.
properties.Remarks: Bird Above has had two grown sons living with him. One of them recently married to a Shosoni girl and is not on the Shoshoni Reservation. They are making a fair start at farming this year, and I feel hopeful that there may be an improvement. They bought

properties.Name: James Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Large tents and a clothing line, with no houses pictured. To the right of the tents is an automobile and a wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children attending public and mission schools
properties.Education_: Carlisle and Reservation. Wife went to reservation schools.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Mission school and public school

properties.House_desc: Nothing. Lives in a tent.

properties.Name: Plays
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, two windows, and a chimney. To the back left stands a tent.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 15 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat; threshed about 500 bu. Of wheat; some oats, poor; 10 A. hay. Partly rented land with others.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, binder, disc, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Plays does very well in farming. He probably visits too much, as I was at his place 2 or 3 times and did not find him at home. However, he does considerable farming and is not among the worst, industrially, by considerable. 

His little girl attend publi

properties.Name: Plenty Coups
properties.Photo_Desc: Two story log house with porch extensions on two sides. Multiple windows and a chimney. Fence posts surround the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife only. Wife's sister and George Bull Tail, a young man, sometimes stay with them to help.
properties.Crop_Desc: 13 A. wheat, 7 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 80 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses, 6 saddle horses, estimated 200 range horses, 3 race horses, 25 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good 6-room house, stable, sheds, implement sheds, corral, cellar, etc.
properties.House_Comm: Good 6-room house, stable, sheds, implement sheds, corral, cellar, etc.
properties.Implement_: Quite a complete outfit of farm and haying tools.
properties.Remarks: This place has the appearance of a real farm. Plenty Coos is the head chief of the Crow tribe and sets a very good example. Even at his age, he goes out on the farm and works. He said, the boys were to start cutting hay "tomorrow." I called his attention

properties.Name: Small
properties.Linked_Acc: Big Hail, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with door. A tent stands to the left of the cabin. To the right of the house is a few implements, a wagon, and a man, likely Small, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one child. Big Hail and wife, and Campbell Big Hail and wife and children live with him.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, no alfalfa, no wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.

properties.Name: Greybull
properties.Photo_Desc: Two log structure with a ladder resting on one.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, son-in-law and wife and 2 children
properties.Education_: None. Son-in-law went to Mission School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 16 A. wheat, 4 A. oats, 4 A. alfalfa, 3 . Mixed hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 5 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 cabins, stable, indifferently furnished and kept
properties.House_Comm: 2 cabins, stable, indifferently furnished and kept
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
When I called at this place, Greybull was mowing oats to save what he could before the grasshoppers got them all. They had already cut off all the heads. What should have been a very good crop of oats, will make him a very small crop of hay. 

His son, I

properties.Name: William Big Day
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension. Two individuals, likely William Big Day and wife, are pictured on the porch. Behind the house  is a log building.
properties.Crop_Desc: 9 A. wheat, 8 A. oats, 8 A. alfalfa, 5 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 2 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice new house, well furnished amd well kept; old house in fair condition. Occupied by brothre-in-law; logs for stable.
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit for farming and harvesting, including binder, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Industry: Above average
properties.Remarks: This man reports that he had an automobile, but found it too expensive, so traded it for 2 mares, which could be used for farming purposes, also for raising good colts. This man and wife are young people who both talk good English. There is one that almo

properties.Name: Austin Lion Shows
properties.Education_: Mission School. Wife went to Fort Shaw and Public School.
properties.School_Des: Son at Rapid City. Others in Public Schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 4 saddle horses, no range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small, indifferent cabin, not used, on inherited land.
properties.House_Comm: Small, indifferent cabin, not used, on inherited land
properties.Implement_: One plow only
properties.Remarks: Austin has not been attempting to farm for several years past. He and his wife separated for a time and he went out and worked for wages, a good part of the time at the Agency. He is a very good worker when working under a boss. It is doubtful whether he

properties.Name: Fights Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with large addition to the left. Fence surrounding the house and addition.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Daniel Blackbird and wife and 3 children living with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 60 unbroken range horses, one race horse. Thinks he has a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, plow, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile

properties.Name: Foolish Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with extension. A tent standing in the front with fence posting visible. A man, Foolish Man, and his wife stand out front.
properties.Education_: Short time in old Day School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 4 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.

properties.Name: George Lande
properties.Family_Des: Self and wife. Just recently married.
properties.Crop_Desc: Corn, alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 15 range ponies, 18 cattle.
properties.House_desc: House, shed, corrals
properties.House_Comm: House, shed, corrals
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, harrow, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon

properties.Name: Old Elk
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows log cabin with two individuals, likely Old Elk and wife, standing out front. The second photo shows a new frame house with a screen porch addition. Fence posts stand around the perimeter.
properties.Location_D: Uppr Big Horn Valley near Headgate
properties.Crop_Desc: wild grass.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses and 5 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: One cabin and small stable in fair condition, no root house.
properties.House_Comm: One cabin and small stable in fair condition, no root house.
properties.Implement_: Farm wagon and spring wagon, but needs no plow because he does not farm.

properties.Name: Knows the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a screened in proch and side door. The second photo shows two men and a child in front of the house. The child is climbing up on the horse and there is part of a wagon shown to the left.
properties.Location_D: Fort Smith Bench, near Lime Kiln Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: Found none.
properties.Stock_Desc: 23 horses, 16 cattle
properties.House_desc: 1 good frame house
properties.House_Comm: 1 good frame house
properties.Implement_: Wagon, mower, rake, plow, harrow
properties.Remarks: This man is said to be unable to work very much. He was not at home when I visited his place, but I have been there before. He lives a long distance from any Indian neighbors, has a little spring along the foot of the mountains. He has a good little hous

properties.Name: Ben Gardner
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with small log building in the background
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school and mission school
properties.Location_D: Wife's inherited land in Big Horn Valley, 2 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: Few acres of wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small log house, small stable and root house.
properties.House_Comm: Smal log house, small stable and root house.
properties.Implement_: Disc, plow, drill, binder, mower, wagon, spring wagon, automobile
properties.Remarks: We believe that it would be better to have a well than to support an automobile. Ben Gardner is a mixed blood. He received a Policy Patent. He evidently disposed of the land and bought the Ford and it is not recorded just how he gets the gasoline. He is

properties.Name: Bear Claw
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa, 20 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 50 range horses, 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: House, barn, both fair frame buildings.
properties.House_Comm: House, barn, both fair frame buildings
properties.Implement_: wagon, plow, mower, rake, stacker, buckrake, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Bear Claw himself lives in Lodgegrass, where he owns a fair cottage. He has not been able to work his land himself for some time. It has been rented out on a crop rental basis, under his general direction. 

He is an exception among the Indians in that h

properties.Name: Door
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch on the back.
properties.Education_: None. Wife spent short time in reservation and mission school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 acres alfalfa. 37 acres wheat. Puts in some oats, the rest in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Good house moderately furnished. Root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good house moderately furnished. Root house.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of implements including, hay tools spring wagon and binder
properties.Water_Desc: Get water from very good well
properties.Industry: Is above average. Makes about 80 tons of hay. Has no automobile. Does not use peyote or engage in any gambling games.
properties.Remarks: Door is a sort of sub-chief, and sets a very good example to his people. He is usually at work. Could keep his farm in better condition but he does very well considering he is farming right on the very ground where the battle of the Sioux took place only

properties.Name: Bread
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with an extension. A wooden fence behind the house to the left. Fence posts around the home with three individuals standing out front.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 12 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 3 range horses, 1 race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, old cabins and sheds, fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, old cabins and shed, fair stable.
properties.Implement_: mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These are just 2 old people with one small foster child, about 5 years old. They live alone, they stay at their own place, and they do not entertain sundry relatives. While their house was one large room, it was neat and clean. It was really better than

properties.Name: Clifford Takes Horse
properties.Alt_Name: Cilfford Takes the Horse; Clifford T. Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension. A shed and wagon in the back right behind the house. To the left laundry is hanging to dry.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 5 children. 2 in public school.
properties.Education_: Reservation school and Haskell. Wife in same schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat With Plays on another place alfalfa and timothy about 60 acres, rest in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 head work horses, 6 saddle horses 6 head of cattle
properties.House_desc: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has converted old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has convered old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Has a fair outfit. 2 plows, mower and rake, wagons and spring wagons. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From river. Had a well but it was not good.
properties.Industry: Works very well most of the time. Has new house but it needs painting.
properties.Remarks: Clifford seems to be trying to do fairly well. His land is not well drained and he has been unable to get a stand of alfalfa on it. It is rather hard adobe land difficult to work. He is putting in some winter wheat on dry land, with a friend. His house i

properties.Name: Thomas Stewart #1
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame hoouse with multiple windows, a side door, and chiimney. There is a barn to be back left of the house and a clothing line infront of it. A wagon is parked infront of the house.
properties.Education_: Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. what, 28 A. oats, 17 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, no saddle horses, 5 range horses, 8 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, stable, root house, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, stable, root house, chicken house
properties.Implement_: binder, plow, mower, disc, drill, rake, buckrake, stacker, harrow, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These people live at home very well. They do not have many people about them regularly. The house is moderately well furnished, rather indifferently kept. They are leaders in the peyote religion, and especially the woman, who became quite earnest in her

properties.Name: Rides a Pretty Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with many trees surrounding it. Three people, likely Rides a Pretty Horse's family, outside the house.
properties.Family_Des: Himsel and wife, and foster child
properties.Health_Com: Good except he is almost blind
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 10 unbroke range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, in a beautiful grove, small stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, in a beautiful grove, small stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, plow, drill, disc, harrow, wagon, rake, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man has a very comfortable home. He takes pride in the way it is furnished and located and he has set out trees that now form a pleasant grove. He lives there all the time and harbors no loafers and star boarders. Neither does he spend much time vis

properties.Name: Rides a Pretty Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with many trees surrounding it. Three people, likely Rides a Pretty Horse's family, outside the house.
properties.Family_Des: Himsel and wife, and foster child
properties.Health_Com: Good except he is almost blind

properties.House_desc: Fair log house, in a beautiful grove, small stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, in a beautiful grove, small stable, root cellar

properties.Name: Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with another building in the background. To the right of the house there is a wagon against a post.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. alfalfa, 16 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, balance in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse, 1 saddle horse, 10 unbroken range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log cabin, stable, implement shed, corral, fair fences
properties.House_Comm: Fair log cabin, stable, implement shed, corral, fair fences
properties.Implement_: Has limited equipment of implements
properties.Water_Desc: Creek, which is good at this place.
properties.Remarks: This party lives around with other Indians a good deal of the time. Big Hail works with him some on his farm, but does not live with him. He lives mostly with Alex The Crane. He was not at home when I was at his camp, but I met him on the road. I think h

properties.Name: Leo Hugs
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, two windows, and a front door. A family stands outside the house and there is a log shed in the background.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 25 A. oats, 100 A. mixed hay land, some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 40 range horses, 50 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, bullrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Leo and his wife are regarded as among the best of our Indians. They live on their own place all the time except as it may be necessary to camp nearer the school in a little cabin through the severe part of the winter in order for their children to be in

properties.Name: Ball
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Three individuals standing to the right side of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Lives with married daugther and husband (Henry Big Day). They work on the farm. Also with their grandchild, but not from the daughter I don't think.
properties.Location_D: Central Big Horn Valley near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some land leased elsewhere.
properties.Stock_Desc: 11 saddle and range horses, combined
properties.House_Comm: Good house, well kept. Indifferent stable.
properties.Implement_: Hay tools, wagons, plow, drills, wagon. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: No well. Haul water from neighbors or from river. Stock go to river for water.
properties.Gen_Cond: Buildings, fences and farm in fair conditions. Fences need repairs.
properties.Industry: Only fair. Could work much better.
properties.Remarks: Ball says that he does not play pool. This was one merit. He and his son-in-law work together, and to some extent own the equipment together. This house is almost as well kept as that of Mr. Ties His Knees. The furniture and rugs are good. There are too

properties.Name: Ball
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Three individuals standing to the right side of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Lives with married daugther and husband (Henry Big Day). They work on the farm. Also with their grandchild, but not from the daughter I don't think.

properties.House_Comm: Good house, well kept. Indifferent stable.
properties.Implement_: Hay tools, wagons, plow, drills, wagon. No automobile.

properties.Name: Yellowtail
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension on its side. Behind the house stands a log building, a pile of hay, and a smaller building.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn River, 3 1/2 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: See the report of his son, Carson Yellow Tail, as they work togther and their equipment is owned and used in common at present.
properties.Remarks: His son is in High School and his daughter is in Public School. His son, Carson, plans to move on to his own allotment near Wyola as soon as possible. He has a crop at present on his own land and also up at that place when I called at their farm. This pl

properties.Name: Henry Pretty On Top
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extensions.
properties.Education_: Reservation school and Haskell. Wife went to Mission School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 80 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 12 A. alfalfa, 30 A. hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 16 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, used for storeroom; fair frame house. No stable.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, used for storeroom; fair frame house. No stable.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit for farming and harvesting.
properties.Remarks: Henry was not at home when we visited his place. He had gone to another district to get a cow that he has traded for. I later saw him on the road and noticed that he had acquired a very good Holstein cow, which should be very valuable to him in producing

properties.Name: Herbert Old Bear
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house.
properties.School_Des: Public school with prospect of new school nearby
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley 9 miles above agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 acres hay land, 70 acres wheat, 10 or 12 acres in oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses and 4 saddle horses
properties.House_desc: One rather indifferent frame house of one room. Live in tents mostly.
properties.House_Comm: One rather indifferent frame house of one room. Live in tents mostly.
properties.Implement_: Together with brother and brother-in-law, they have a fair outfit of implements, plows, mower, harrow, wagon, buckrake, spring wagon, etc.
properties.Remarks: They cannot see the work that is to be done in the way of improvement and are disposed to never clean a ditch or repair fences or buildings until it is actually necessary. They put up some 20 ton of hay, generally have some grain to thresh. At this same

properties.Name: Walks Over Ice
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with chimney, three windows, and a front door. Six individuals, the four sitting in front of  the house likely Walks Over Ice's family, stand out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children, father-in-law, Along the Hillside, lives with him. He is an old man.
properties.Education_: Attended Mission Boarding School. Wife had no school-ing.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Lodgegrass Public School. One child attending Bacon, Oklaoma.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn River, one mile below Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 55 A. wheat, 25 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work  horses, 8 saddle horses, 20 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, root house, stable. Plans to build new house presently.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, bullrake, stacker, cultivator, drill. Fair outfit. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Very good worker. Does not play pool or use peyote.
properties.Remarks: We found this man and his wife both working in the garden, hoeing and weeding. He has a good sized garden with a good variety of stuff planted. They had arranged for a loan to build them a new house, but the funds were exhausted before the purchases were

properties.Name: Joe Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with one withdow, a chimney, and an extension. A man, Joe Not Afraid, and woman, wife, stand in from of the house with a dog next to them. To the left of the house is a clothing line.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children; also his father and grandmother -- also his brother George most of the time
properties.School_Des: 2 1/2 miles to Lodgegrass School, 2 children attending
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2.5 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 65 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 7 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
These people live on inherited land to which they are part heirs. When we arrived his place, he was at work in the garden and was taking an interest in protecting his potatoes from the potato bugs, which are quite bad.

They live at home very regularly,

properties.Name: Joe Mountain Pocket
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with one window and fence posts to its left.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, Mountain Pocket Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat; 6 A. oats; 40 A. hay, estimated at 40 tons
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 5 range horses, 5 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.House_Comm: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, mower, rake, harrow, stacker, 2 bullrakes, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Joe has the one merit that he usually stays at his own home., Outside of that, there is nothing much to say. He does very little work. He has kept a Mexican around him, giving him about half the crop for doing the work. He has a very good place and a hou

properties.Name: Plays
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, two windows, and a chimney. To the back left stands a tent.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 15 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat; threshed about 500 bu. Of wheat; some oats, poor; 10 A. hay. Partly rented land with others.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, binder, disc, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Plays does very well in farming. He probably visits too much, as I was at his place 2 or 3 times and did not find him at home. However, he does considerable farming and is not among the worst, industrially, by considerable. 

His little girl attend publi

properties.Name: George Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Crop_Desc: George is not farming for himself independently. He is working with his brother, Joe Not Afraid, on whom a report has been written. They have some grain and meadow on George's place, but handle it jointly. He probably has not implements of his own.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, never occupied
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, never occupied
properties.Water_Desc: None convenient. Must be brought from neighbor's spring.
properties.Remarks: George is a young man who has not yet established for himself. He lives mostly with his brother and works with him. The fact that he wanted to build a house on his place indicated that he hopes to live there soon. He has no other  building  and he has ve

properties.Name: Glen Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a couple buildings in the background.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 32 A., 345 Bu
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Very good log house, store house, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Very good log house, store house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Plow, grain drill, harrow, wagon, mower, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Glen is a very well behaved young man. I know of no bad habits or particular disposition to loaf or gamble, but he has not quite settled down to regular farming. He does his work on his little place very well, then lives a good deal of the time with his

properties.Name: Falls Down Old
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with man, Falls Down Old, standing out front.
properties.School_Des: Public school accessible. Boy attends public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 8 acres wheat. 6 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 10 saddle and range horses
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, poorly kept, poor stable.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, poorly kept, poor stable
properties.Implement_: One riding plow and disc., wagon and buggy
properties.Remarks: On this place there is some good land for dry farming, but only very little of it in cultivation. They are doing but little. The man has no wife and he and his two boys have lived there alone for several years. One of the boys was recently married and is

properties.Name: Old Crane
properties.Linked_Acc: Bear Crane, Oscar Crane, Roy Crane
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with a garden and a woman and man, likely Old Crane, out front. Behind the hosue is a wagon being pulled by two horses.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; father, Bear Crane; brother, Oscar, wife and children; his son, Roy, wife and children.
properties.Education_: None. Younger men went to Reservation School and Public School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 80 A. alfalfa, 18 A. wheat, 20 A. oats,
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 13 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: A fair log house, stable, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: A fair log house, stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, 2 spring wagons
properties.Remarks:
This farm is a rather productive one. It produces 2 or 3 good crops of alfalfa every year and some years has had as much as 200 ton of hay. There are 3 able bodied men besides the old grandfather, who is not able to work. 

There are the 3 women living i

properties.Name: Fights Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with large addition to the left. Fence surrounding the house and addition.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Daniel Blackbird and wife and 3 children living with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 60 unbroken range horses, one race horse. Thinks he has a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, plow, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: It is reported that he works very well. He was not at home when I called at his place. Said to be out hunting for horses. His wife was in the garden at work. He said that he did not expect to go anywhere for the Fourth of July, except one day, as he want

properties.Name: Knows
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a three seasons porch. A log building is seen to the right of the house. A wagon stand to the right with another in the center. A dog is eating grass. The second photo shows a work team with three men and a hay baler.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, father, widowed daughter and 2 children
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, above St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. voluntary wheat, 140 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, buckracke, stacker, mower, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This family stay on their place regularly. It is a beautiful piece of land. Every acre can be cultivated and irrigated. It is mostly in wild hay, which is usually a very good crop with little expense connected with producing it. It is probably better for

properties.Linked_Acc: Bear Crane, Oscar Crane, Roy Crane

properties.Name: Turns Back Plenty
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tree grove surrounding it. To the left of the house is a clothing line and there is a fence surrounding the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children, 2 in public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 14 A. alfalfa, 7 A. mixed hay. Remainder in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 7 saddle horses, few range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, fairly furnished; poor stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and haying tools
properties.Remarks: Turns Back Plenty is employed by the Government as linerider and has been for some time. He devotes practically all his time to this work, through the summer, and considerable time to it through the winter. He furnished his own horse and provisions while

properties.Name: Knows the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a screened in proch and side door. The second photo shows two men and a child in front of the house. The child is climbing up on the horse and there is part of a wagon shown to the left.
properties.Location_D: Fort Smith Bench, near Lime Kiln Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: Found none.
properties.Stock_Desc: 23 horses, 16 cattle
properties.House_desc: 1 good frame house
properties.House_Comm: 1 good frame house
properties.Implement_: Wagon, mower, rake, plow, harrow
properties.Remarks: This man is said to be unable to work very much. He was not at home when I visited his place, but I have been there before. He lives a long distance from any Indian neighbors, has a little spring along the foot of the mountains. He has a good little hous

properties.Name: Edward Iron
properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 17 horses
properties.House_desc: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.House_Comm: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.Implement_: 2 wagons, buggy, mower, rake, stacker, sweeprake, plow, sulky plow, binder
properties.Remarks: This man is giving promise of doing very well. His own land seems not to be suitable for farming purposes. He is attempting to use some of his wife's land, which is better located. He is just now building a good house and with a more permanent home, he s

properties.Name: Richard Wallace

properties.Education_: Carlisle and reservation. Wife had no education.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Catholic Mission Day School.
properties.Location_D: One on Lodgegrass Creek and one on East Soap Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. wild hay. Remainder is grazing land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses, 8 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 100 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new houses on each place. Good barns, granary, chicken houses, root houses, implement sheds, etc.
properties.House_Comm: Good new houses on each place. Good barns, granary, chicken houses, root houses, implement sheds, etc.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit of farming and harvesting implements including Dodge car.
properties.Water_Desc: Well on one place and good spring at other.

properties.Name: Emory Pease
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension on the back. Fence is visible in the  background.
properties.Crop_Desc: Mixed hay, 80 A.; balance is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 10 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, some 20 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair framed house, carral, shed under construction
properties.House_Comm: Fair framed house, carral, shed under construction

properties.Remarks: This place is located well for producing hay. He usually has about 125 tons, most of which he sells. Being in the midst of the range, it is a favorite feeding place. He had quite a start of cattle recently, but owed too much on them and most them. There

properties.Name: John Whiteman

properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 children. One in Public School.
properties.Education_: He went to reservation school. Wife went to mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 100 A. wild hay land, balance in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Very good small frame house, granary, poor stable. Promises to build well house.
properties.House_Comm: Very good small frame house, granary, poor stable. Promises to build well house.

properties.Name: Top of the Moccasin
properties.Photo_Desc: Both a log and frame house, with the frame side appearing as a recent addition. To the right of the house is another building.
properties.Education_: Little education at Mission. Wife went to Mission.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, above St. Ann's Mission
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa, 35 A.; wheat, 80 A.; oats, 25 A. Some pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 8 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Rock and frame house, poor shed, root house. Needs stable.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, wagon, spring wagon, no stacker.
properties.Industry: Very good.
properties.Remarks: Has no automobile. He is reported as being a very good farmer, working regularly and seldom leaving home to camp with any Indian community. His house is not very well kept, very meager furniture, and the house is not clean. He has no stable and at this t

properties.Name: Mortimer Plenty Hawk
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with three windows, two chimney's, and a door. There is a family standing out in front of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 5 miles south of Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 25 A. native hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 10 range horses, 30 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and log barn.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and log barn.
properties.Implement_: 2 wagons, 2 riding plows, binder, 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, drill disc
properties.Remarks: This man and his brother should do considerably more work than they do. They live on their mother's allotment. Mortimer should have a house of his own and on his own land, and he desires such house when he can afford it. They do better than many of the y

properties.Name: Simon Old Crow
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three windows, two chimney, and a door. A family, likely Simon Old Crow's, stands out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children. White Woman and wife live there and part of the time Ben Hillside and wife stay there.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Mission schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 24 A. wheat, 11 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa, 8 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work  horses, 6 saddle horses, 40 unbroke range horses, 2 stallions, 10 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, fair stable, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, fair stable, root house.
properties.Implement_: Stacker, buckrake, 2 mowers, 2 rakes, 2 plows, harrow, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon, drill, binder
properties.Remarks:
Simon is reputed to be one of the best of the young farmers. He has some very good farm land and is making fair use of it. He stays at home, even when some celebration is on. 

I found one room in his house nearly full of wheat, indicating the need of a

properties.Name: Percy Blackhair
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windowd, a chimney, and door. To the back right stands a log shed. Fence posts surround the house.
properties.Family_Des: Himself and wife. No one living with them.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley few miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 acres alfalfa 19 wheat. 16 oats. 20 A. hay land rest is pasture and road right of way river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses. 2 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.House_Comm: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, wagons, fair outfit for his farming and harvesting
properties.Water_Desc: Hauled from river. Stock water from slough. Attempted to get a well but failed after going quite deep.
properties.Industry: He knows how to work very well and does fairly well but could and should do considerably better. His land is not the best being cut by sloughs and with a tendency to become alkalois for want of drainage. They live to themselves without any of their relat
properties.Remarks: He knows how to work very well and does fairly well but could and should do considerably better. His land is not the best being cut by sloughs and with a tendency to become alkalois for want of drainage. They live to themselves without any of their relat

properties.Name: One Star
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. Two women sit in front of the house with a kitchen pit in front of them. To the right of the house there is a wagon.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley above Lodge Grass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 4 A. oats, 30 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 5 saddle  horses, 15 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, well kept, fair furniture; shed stable; root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, well kept, fair furniture; shed stable; root house.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, disc, cultivator, mower, rake, 2 buckrakes, stacker, interested in binder, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: One Star is somewhat of the old type of Indian. He does not take to modern ways very readily. He has a nice new house and it is better kept than most of the houses of the younger women. He does some farming but is disposed to get outside labor to do the

properties.Name: Joe Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with one withdow, a chimney, and an extension. A man, Joe Not Afraid, and woman, wife, stand in from of the house with a dog next to them. To the left of the house is a clothing line.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children; also his father and grandmother -- also his brother George most of the time
properties.School_Des: 2 1/2 miles to Lodgegrass School, 2 children attending
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2.5 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 65 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 7 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
These people live on inherited land to which they are part heirs. When we arrived his place, he was at work in the garden and was taking an interest in protecting his potatoes from the potato bugs, which are quite bad.

They live at home very regularly,

properties.Name: Blake Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with work bench to the front right.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children, one in Mission School
properties.Education_: Reservation boarding school. Wife went to Reservation Boarding School and Mission school.
properties.School_Des: Arranges for children to stay near Mission Day School with grandfather.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 8 A. oats., alfalfa 5 A. Balance is pasture and wild grass along creek.
properties.Stock_Desc: See report of Packs a Hat, with whom he farms and handles the equipment in common. 15 cattle.
properties.House_desc: On his own lnd a good small frame house and granary.
properties.House_Comm: On his own land a good small frame house and granary.
properties.Implement_: See Packs the Hat report.
properties.Remarks: This young man is regarded as one of our best Indian workers and young business men. He attends to business, handles the two farms in conjunction with his foster father. He has a good little house on his own, where he lives part of the time. Well kept an

properties.Name: Packs the Hat
properties.Photo_Desc: First picture shows a frame house with two chimney's and a window. Two men, one likely Packs the Hat, stand infront of the house. The second picture shows a frame barn, a fence, and another buidling to the right side of the barn.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son with his wife and two children.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. of alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay. Remainder is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 10 saddle horses, 100 unbroken range horses, about 23 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, corrals, cow sheds, granary, wood-house, good fences
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, corrals, cow sheds, granary, wood-house, good fences
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of haying tools.
properties.Remarks: This man lives somewhat to himself. It is not usually profitable for him to raise grain, as it is too far for him to haul it to market. There is always a good market for hay, as it is a favorite feeding locality, adjacent to the range, where there is goo

properties.Name: Knows His Coups
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimney, two windows, and two doors. To the right stands a tent and an automobile. To the left is a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Son in State Asylum. Foster child.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Though he is old and was in bed sick when I visited him.
properties.Location_D: On Little Horn 5 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 80 of mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: One team of work horses. 2 saddle horses. Possibly 20 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Plow and rake. Usually puts up his hay in conjunction with his neighbors and funishes part of the implements.
properties.Water_Desc: From river and from some springs
properties.Gen_Cond: Only fair. He is an old man not able to do full time work. Does very well for his age. He seems to take some pride in the fact that he is running his own place largely with one man who works with him and they live off their to themselves which is much be
properties.Remarks: Ben Looks Back, subject of another report works with him on this place in a spry of joint community affair.

properties.Name: Three Foretops
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two chimney, a couple windows, and front door. Two individuals, likely Three Foretops and  his wife, stand out front. To the side of the house is a clothing line.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Reservation School.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 1 mile above Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheatm 10 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 7 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 1 race horse, said to be a good one.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, fairly kept. Stable, corral, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, fairly kept. Stable, corral, root house.
properties.Implement_: Drill, 2 plows, mower, rake, harrow, disc, binder, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: The conditions are only fair. They live at home most of the time and have this year some very good crop. He should have enough wheat to support the family for the winter. He says that he is getting too old to work and has to go slow, but he does consider

properties.Name: George Hill
properties.Crop_Desc: Principally wheat and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 2 saddle horses, one pig.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house and barn located on Farm Station land.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house and barn located on Farm Station land.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, plow
properties.Remarks: George Hill has been an employee as laborer and interpreter at the Farm Station for many years. He is a very useful man. He has a house and garden on the Farm Station site, where he makes a good garden. He should keep a cow and some chickens, at least, t

properties.Name: Francis Stewart
properties.Status: Both - wife Fee Patent, him trust
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, o saddle horse, 2 unbroke range horses
properties.House_desc: Frame house in fair condition, log stable.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house in fair condition, log stable
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This young man lives on his mother's allotment and ordinarily in the house with his father. His father, Joe Stewart, is now employed as a laborer at the Agency and Francis pretends to run the place. He has good land under irrigation. It is very much negl

properties.Name: Yellowmule
properties.Photo_Desc: N/A
properties.Location_D: Upper Little Horn Valley 8 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 12 acres oats 17 alfalfa wild hay land about 20 acres. Some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 head work horses. 8 saddle horses, 40 range horses. 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small frame house. Good log house. Fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Plows, harrow, mower, racles buck rake, stacler, disc. Fair outfit. No automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Makes about 60 tons of hay, very good.
properties.Industry: Yellow Mule and his son Levi, who lives and works with him are rather above the average in their farm activity.
properties.Remarks: In answer to the inquiry in reference to irrigation he claims that he is being charged for water maintenance on rather a large part of his land which I verified recently, and by the record. He says that so far he has no ditches that distribute that water

properties.Name: Walter Jack Rabbit
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney, multiple windows, and a porch extention. Two individuals are in coverstation behind the house.
properties.Education_: In reservation school and Haskell. Wife in reservation school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 wheat. 10 oats. Very little  hay but helps others to get hay for his own use.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 2 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house. Fair stable. Fair cabin.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit for general farm work, including wagon, spring wagon. No automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Is very good. He farms fairly well. Says he does not play pool or rummy. His house is quite well furnished and fairly well kept.
properties.Remarks: Little Nest and his wife, old people make their home with him. Hair and his wife, old people live in the cabin at his place. They do not farm separately at all. Little Nest helps Walter with his work and they live somewhat in common. Hail and his wife do

properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with add on

properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 6 unbroken range horses. May have a few cattle on range.
properties.House_desc: Cheap temporary house, poor stable, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Cheap temporary house, poor stable, root house
properties.Implement_: Fair haying outfit, wagons, etc.
