properties.Name: Bird Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a three season porch and three people standing in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son, Paul Hill with wife and child, Father-in-Law, Snot in the Hand and a very old man.
properties.School_Des: Indifferent mission school in one of his buildings.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some land leased. Wild grass 10 acres. Alfalfa 70 A. Oats 15.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses. 6 saddle horses, 25 range horses, 25 cows.
properties.House_desc: Good house 4 rooms and large porch well kept. Fair stable, good cabins
properties.House_Comm: Good house 4 rooms and large porch well kept. Fair stable, good cabins
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit of farm implements and hay tools owned in part by Michael Bull Chief. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From creek or ditch. No well.
properties.Industry: Above the average.
properties.Remarks: Bird Horse is regarded as one of the best farmers. His place is in good order and he makes a lot of hay and does considerable farming and has some dry farm land idle. His wife is among the best housekeepers. She has four rooms all in good order and fairl

properties.Name: Levi Yellowmule
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three windows, a chimney, and a front door. To the back of the house is laundry hanging on a line. To the right of the  house is a log shed and another frame building. Two individuals  stand outfront next to a wagon.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school. Boy attends public school.
properties.Remarks: Note. Regard this report in connection with the report on Yellow Mule, his father. They work together, Levi really being in charge, his father helping him very well. They live off some distance from other Indian families, and are quite comfortably fixed,

properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of haying tools.
properties.Remarks: This man lives somewhat to himself. It is not usually profitable for him to raise grain, as it is too far for him to haul it to market. There is always a good market for hay, as it is a favorite feeding locality, adjacent to the range, where there is goo

properties.Name: Ben Spotted Horse
properties.Crop_Desc: Mostly pasture. 20 A. wheat, 9 A. oats, 8 A. alfalfa, some mixed hay and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work orses, 8 saddle horses, 20 unbroken range horses, 10 cattle
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, frame stable indifferently kept.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, frame stable indifferently kept.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, mower, rake, drill, wagon, spring wagon, only moderate equipment
properties.Remarks: It is difficult to report where Ben lives. Most of the time he lives in a spring wagon, going from place to place. He has a very good farm which would make him a good living if he stayed home and tended to it himself. It is generally rented or else he em

properties.Name: Ben Pease
properties.Location_D: Adjacent to Lodgegrass and on Rotten Grass Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 65 A. timothy, 10 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 frame hourses, frame barn
properties.House_Comm: 2 frame houses, frame barn
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, 3 buckrakes, stacker, rake, automobile
properties.Remarks: Ben Pease has a place just on the bench near Lodgegrass, which is all under irrigation and could be made to support a family if carefully handled. He also has some excellent hay land, well located for sale to feeders, on Rotten Grass Creek. He has a hous

properties.Name: Fights Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with large addition to the left. Fence surrounding the house and addition.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Daniel Blackbird and wife and 3 children living with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 60 unbroken range horses, one race horse. Thinks he has a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, plow, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: It is reported that he works very well. He was not at home when I called at his place. Said to be out hunting for horses. His wife was in the garden at work. He said that he did not expect to go anywhere for the Fourth of July, except one day, as he want

properties.Name: Joseph Martinez
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and addition. A ladder rests on the house. To the front of the house is a frame building. Behind the  home is another frame building with multiple implements around it.
properties.Status: Fee Pat. Living on inherited land to which he has Pat. in Fee
properties.Education_: Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn, 2 miles below Wyola and also up Lodgegrass Creek.
properties.Acres: He has quite a large area, mostly pasture, very little irrigated. 120 A. cultivated.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 50 A. wild hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 12 work horses, some saddle horses, and probably some range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, stable, storeroom, etc.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, stable, storeroom, etc.
properties.Implement_: Good complete outfit
properties.Remarks: I repeatedly failed to see Joe at home, although he works very well, but it seems to be just a chance that he was always away when I was by his place. Jose is one Patent in Fee Indian who has retained most of his land. I understand it is encumbered, but

properties.Name: Knows His Coups
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimney, two windows, and two doors. To the right stands a tent and an automobile. To the left is a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Son in State Asylum. Foster child.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Though he is old and was in bed sick when I visited him.
properties.Location_D: On Little Horn 5 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 80 of mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: One team of work horses. 2 saddle horses. Possibly 20 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Plow and rake. Usually puts up his hay in conjunction with his neighbors and funishes part of the implements.
properties.Water_Desc: From river and from some springs
properties.Gen_Cond: Only fair. He is an old man not able to do full time work. Does very well for his age. He seems to take some pride in the fact that he is running his own place largely with one man who works with him and they live off their to themselves which is much be
properties.Remarks: Ben Looks Back, subject of another report works with him on this place in a spry of joint community affair.

properties.Name: Frank Blackhair
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with log extension. A family, Frank Blackhair's, stands out front.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife went to Reservation School and Haskell.
properties.School_Des: None convenient. Sends family to Lodgegrass Public School.
properties.Location_D: Little Owl Creek, on wife's land
properties.Crop_Desc: 31 A. wheat, no oats, 10 A. mixed hay, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no range horses or race horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, good stable. Planning to build root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, good stable. Planning to build root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Stacker, sweeprake, plow, disc, mower, rake, wagon
properties.Remarks: This family lives rather remote from the main Indian settlements. He formerly lived about the town of Lodgegrass, working for wages, part of the time. He has now moved onto his wife's land, which is very good mostly, and he has a good prospect for crops.

properties.Name: Big Sheep
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 50 A. poor wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, one saddle horse, 3 range orses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, no stable.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, no stable
properties.Implement_: wagon, mower, rake, plow, harrow, disc
properties.Remarks: Big Sheep is a very poor farmer. He has some land rented, but has declined to rent other land that we could as well be having an income from and he is not using. His mixed hay had not been irrigated and he will get a very small yield where he might have

properties.Name: Eli Blackhawk
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with frame barn to the left. Further left stand a canvas tent and wagon.
properties.Education_: Went to reservation school. Wife to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley adjacent to Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 70 A. wheat put in by renter. 60 A. alfalfa, rest in pasture. Considerable family holdings, rented for farming and grazing.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 team work horses. 3 or 4 saddle horses. 20 or 25 range horses. 3 or 4 cattle
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house fairly furnished, stable, poor root house. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house fairly furnished, stable, poor root house. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and hay tools. Has big automobile which seems to be always in running order
properties.Industry: He has a large quanitity of good land, but farms it mostly by proxy, having his crops put in on crop rental and his hay put up on shares, though he does do some work in haying, but not nearly what he should do.
properties.Remarks: His house is fairly well kept, and moderately well furnished. His wife seems quite capable. They put up some 250 tons of hay on the land that he handles and he has rented other land that would make as much or more. The prospect for crops at this time are

properties.Name: Knows His Coups
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimney, two windows, and two doors. To the right stands a tent and an automobile. To the left is a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Son in State Asylum. Foster child.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Though he is old and was in bed sick when I visited him.
properties.Location_D: On Little Horn 5 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 80 of mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: One team of work horses. 2 saddle horses. Possibly 20 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Plow and rake. Usually puts up his hay in conjunction with his neighbors and funishes part of the implements.
properties.Water_Desc: From river and from some springs
properties.Gen_Cond: Only fair. He is an old man not able to do full time work. Does very well for his age. He seems to take some pride in the fact that he is running his own place largely with one man who works with him and they live off their to themselves which is much be
properties.Remarks: Ben Looks Back, subject of another report works with him on this place in a spry of joint community affair.

properties.Name: Bread
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with an extension. A wooden fence behind the house to the left. Fence posts around the home with three individuals standing out front.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 12 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 3 range horses, 1 race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, old cabins and sheds, fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, old cabins and shed, fair stable.
properties.Implement_: mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These are just 2 old people with one small foster child, about 5 years old. They live alone, they stay at their own place, and they do not entertain sundry relatives. While their house was one large room, it was neat and clean. It was really better than

properties.Name: Joe Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with one withdow, a chimney, and an extension. A man, Joe Not Afraid, and woman, wife, stand in from of the house with a dog next to them. To the left of the house is a clothing line.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children; also his father and grandmother -- also his brother George most of the time
properties.School_Des: 2 1/2 miles to Lodgegrass School, 2 children attending
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2.5 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 65 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 7 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
These people live on inherited land to which they are part heirs. When we arrived his place, he was at work in the garden and was taking an interest in protecting his potatoes from the potato bugs, which are quite bad.

They live at home very regularly,

properties.Name: Bear Claw
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa, 20 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 50 range horses, 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: House, barn, both fair frame buildings.
properties.House_Comm: House, barn, both fair frame buildings
properties.Implement_: wagon, plow, mower, rake, stacker, buckrake, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Bear Claw himself lives in Lodgegrass, where he owns a fair cottage. He has not been able to work his land himself for some time. It has been rented out on a crop rental basis, under his general direction. 

He is an exception among the Indians in that h

properties.Name: Passes
properties.Photo_Desc: Log ouse with two windows, two chimney's, and covered front porch. A family, likely Passes, stands to the side of the house. A tent stands to the back left of the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: 6 A. wheat, 4 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, a few acres of mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 18 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Very good house, small stable, root house, toilet.
properties.House_Comm: Very good house, small stable, root house, toilet
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This house is quite well furnished and was in very good condition. I have been surprised to find as many Indian houses quite clean and well kept as I have found. Their effort in that line is very commendable. His family lives at home all the time and do

properties.Name: Arthur Bravo
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house
properties.House_desc: Poor frame house.
properties.House_Comm: Poor frame house
properties.Remarks: I visited this man's place two or three times, but never found him at home. He seldom lives at home. He works a little with Jack Covers Up, a neighbor, and I think Jack feeds him most of the time. He makes very little use of his own land. He, so far, has

properties.Name: Jack Covers Up
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimneys and a porch addition. Two men stand to the left of the house while another man stand by a wagon and horse.
properties.Family_Des: His son Frank and wife, daughter, and brother Two Whistles, an old man
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 7 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa, 30 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 25 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house only.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house only
properties.Implement_: 2 mower, rake, stacker, buckrake, plow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
The house is very meagerly furnished, but fairly well kept. It shows that the woman is trying to keep the house clean and in order with what she has. They have some very good land under ditch, but some of the land is low and tends to seepage. 

I visited

properties.Name: Harry Wallace
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 2 children; mother; uncle, Lee Blue Bead
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3 miles above Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa, 30 A.. Native hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 13 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 15 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good house, poor barn
properties.House_Comm: Good house, poor barn
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, wagon, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, harrow, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
The farm is in only fair condition. I was near there on 2 or 3 occasions and they were not at home. The memorandum in this case as prepared by the Farmer, as I failed to find his party on any of my trips. 

He does not work much. He has an excellent oppo

properties.Name: Harry Wallace
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 2 children; mother; uncle, Lee Blue Bead

properties.Name: Aegidious Gun Shows
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with two doors, a chimney, and garage. A team of horses and two wagons stand to the right of the house.
properties.Education_: He and wife attended Mission school
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. oats, no wheat, 25 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, no saddle horses, 3 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor leg house, one room; no stable; no root house; nothing else. He wants a new house.
properties.House_Comm: He wants a new house
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
This young man has apparently not gotten settled. He has a good place adjoining one of the best farms on the reservation, run by a white man. The example should be beneficial.

He can get water for a good part of his land. It would produce almost any cro

properties.Name: White Hip
properties.Linked_Acc: Augustine Gray Bull, John a Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: The first picture shows a frame house with an extension. Behind the house is another building, likely a shed. A man is walking towards the camera and to his left there is an automobile. The second picture shows multiple tents with  agroup of individuals
properties.Education_: She went to Reservation School, and Fort Shaw. He had no schooling.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass creek, near St. Ann's Mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa, 40 A.; Mixed hay, 40 A.; 65 A. wheat; oats, 10 A.;
properties.Stock_Desc: 80 work horses, 20 saddle horses, 50 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house of 3 rooms. Old log house used for  granary. Log stable, root house, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit, including wagons, sstacker, spring wagon, etc. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: White Hip was in the field mowing when I called at his house and I could not get across the creek. He is reported to be a very good farmer, remaining at home and attending to his business better than the average. Just now he was living in camp, which is

properties.Name: John Gros Ventre
properties.Linked_Acc: Dan Old Bull, Prairie Gros Ventre
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, side door, and a screened in porch addition.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife went to Reservation School and Haskell.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, near St. Ann's Mission
properties.Crop_Desc: 44 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay. Pasture 160 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 6 unbroken range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.House_Comm: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.Implement_: Plows, disc, harrow, mower, rake, stacker, binder, wagons, etc. Very fair equipment. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man we found cutting alfalfa. A very superior crop. He hardly had time to talk to us when we saw him in the field. We visited the house, but his wife was not at home. His place is better equipped and better kept than the average. His old father live

properties.Name: Top of the Moccasin
properties.Photo_Desc: Both a log and frame house, with the frame side appearing as a recent addition. To the right of the house is another building.
properties.Education_: Little education at Mission. Wife went to Mission.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, above St. Ann's Mission
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa, 35 A.; wheat, 80 A.; oats, 25 A. Some pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 8 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Rock and frame house, poor shed, root house. Needs stable.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, wagon, spring wagon, no stacker.
properties.Industry: Very good.
properties.Remarks: Has no automobile. He is reported as being a very good farmer, working regularly and seldom leaving home to camp with any Indian community. His house is not very well kept, very meager furniture, and the house is not clean. He has no stable and at this t

properties.Name: Iron Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with porch addition and chimney. To the right of the house stands a teepee.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 40 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, small stable, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, small stable, root house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man was not at home when I visited his place. He had gone to the mountains to hunt for a few days. His crops were up, however, and his place looked in very good condition. He has a good farm and now has a number of selections for new allotments adjo

properties.Name: Shows as He Goes
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a couple windows, a chimney, and an extension. Two individuals, likely Shows as He Goes and wife, stand out front.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, no alfalfa, 6 big stacks of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, clean and well kept; tool shed; chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, clean and well kept; tool shed; chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, spring wagon, wagon
properties.Remarks: I arrived at this house early in the morning, probably about 8:30. The house was in perfect order. Everything was clean. The furniture is meager, but well kept. Everything was in order in the kitchen and the woman had finished her morning work and was si

properties.Name: Prairie Gros Ventre
properties.Linked_Acc: John Gros Ventre, Dan Old Bull
properties.Remarks: Prairie Gros Ventre is the father of John, whose report see. He lives with his son in the same house and they do not maintain any separate farm, but the old man works with his son so far as he is able. There is no special separate report to make in his c

properties.Name: Fights Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with large addition to the left. Fence surrounding the house and addition.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Daniel Blackbird and wife and 3 children living with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 60 unbroken range horses, one race horse. Thinks he has a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, plow, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: It is reported that he works very well. He was not at home when I called at his place. Said to be out hunting for horses. His wife was in the garden at work. He said that he did not expect to go anywhere for the Fourth of July, except one day, as he want

properties.Name: Augustine Grey Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Two attend Mission School.
properties.Stock_Desc: This man farms in partnership with White Hip, whose report see. Their crops, stock, and implemments arehandled and owned in common, though they live in separate houses.
properties.House_desc: Good log house.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house
properties.Remarks: Augustine, the brother of White Hip, is reputed to be a very good farmer, attending closely to his business. They have some hay to sell and they have some prospect for a crop of grain. // John Grey Bull is another brother of Augustine Gray Bull, but he d

properties.Name: Josephine Bostwick
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with one window, a chimney, and a screened porch. To the right of the house stands a shed, an outouse, and a hourse. To the left of the house is another building.
properties.Crop_Desc: 47 A. oats, 37 A. hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: A fair outfit of work stock and saddle horses necessary for his farm activities. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: A fair log house, well furnished and kept. Also a good house in Lodgegrass.
properties.House_Comm: A fair log house, well furnished and kept. Also a good house in Lodgegrass.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of haying and farming tools.
properties.Remarks: This family hardly belongs in a report of Indian families. Mrs. Bostwick was reared as a white girl, her father having been a thrifty, early pioneer on the Yellowstone, where he married her mother some 50 or more years ago. She never lived as an Indian.

properties.Name: George Hill
properties.Crop_Desc: Principally wheat and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 2 saddle horses, one pig.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house and barn located on Farm Station land.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house and barn located on Farm Station land.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, plow
properties.Remarks: George Hill has been an employee as laborer and interpreter at the Farm Station for many years. He is a very useful man. He has a house and garden on the Farm Station site, where he makes a good garden. He should keep a cow and some chickens, at least, t

properties.Name: Jack Covers Up
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimneys and a porch addition. Two men stand to the left of the house while another man stand by a wagon and horse.
properties.Family_Des: His son Frank and wife, daughter, and brother Two Whistles, an old man
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 7 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa, 30 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 25 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house only.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house only
properties.Implement_: 2 mower, rake, stacker, buckrake, plow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
The house is very meagerly furnished, but fairly well kept. It shows that the woman is trying to keep the house clean and in order with what she has. They have some very good land under ditch, but some of the land is low and tends to seepage. 

I visited

properties.Name: Three Foretops
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two chimney, a couple windows, and front door. Two individuals, likely Three Foretops and  his wife, stand out front. To the side of the house is a clothing line.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Reservation School.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 1 mile above Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheatm 10 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 7 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 1 race horse, said to be a good one.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, fairly kept. Stable, corral, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, fairly kept. Stable, corral, root house.
properties.Implement_: Drill, 2 plows, mower, rake, harrow, disc, binder, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: The conditions are only fair. They live at home most of the time and have this year some very good crop. He should have enough wheat to support the family for the winter. He says that he is getting too old to work and has to go slow, but he does consider

properties.Name: White Arm
properties.Photo_Desc: N/A
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. oats, 75 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 frame houses, frame barn, implement shed, chicken coop, toliet, fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, buckrake, stacker, plow.
properties.Remarks: His farm adjoins the town of Lodgegrass. White Arm has been a policeman for many years and devotes a part of almost everyday to that work. He is not physically able to handle the farm alone. It has been farmed on crop rental basis or leased. He is rather

properties.Name: Glen Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a couple buildings in the background.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 32 A., 345 Bu
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Very good log house, store house, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Very good log house, store house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Plow, grain drill, harrow, wagon, mower, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Glen is a very well behaved young man. I know of no bad habits or particular disposition to loaf or gamble, but he has not quite settled down to regular farming. He does his work on his little place very well, then lives a good deal of the time with his

properties.Name: Hartford Blackeagle
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Education_: Self and wife went to Reservation Schools
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2.5 miles below Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. weat, 8 A. mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 3 range horses,  1 race horse.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, fairly furnished and kept. No other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, fairly furnished and kept. No other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, buckrake, wagon, buggy, no automobile
properties.Remarks: Hartford lives on some inherited land that belongs to members of his family. It is a very fair farm and probably better suited to his farm activities than his own allotment, except that he is not justified in expending his own money time [sic] in making

properties.Name: Gros Ventre #2
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with small porch addition.
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school at Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, few range horses
properties.House_desc: Very good 2-room house and small frame stable. Limited furniture.
properties.House_Comm: Very good 2-room house and small frame stable. Limited furniture.
properties.Implement_: Apparently very few implements
properties.Remarks: I failed to meet this man so far. I went to or near his house several times and always learned that he was not at home. I went to his house and looked around the place in his absence. I know the man very well. He is no good. Very seldom stays at home. He

properties.Name: Herbert Old Bear
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house.
properties.School_Des: Public school with prospect of new school nearby
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley 9 miles above agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 acres hay land, 70 acres wheat, 10 or 12 acres in oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses and 4 saddle horses
properties.House_desc: One rather indifferent frame house of one room. Live in tents mostly.
properties.House_Comm: One rather indifferent frame house of one room. Live in tents mostly.
properties.Implement_: Together with brother and brother-in-law, they have a fair outfit of implements, plows, mower, harrow, wagon, buckrake, spring wagon, etc.
properties.Remarks: They cannot see the work that is to be done in the way of improvement and are disposed to never clean a ditch or repair fences or buildings until it is actually necessary. They put up some 20 ton of hay, generally have some grain to thresh. At this same

properties.Name: Plays
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, two windows, and a chimney. To the back left stands a tent.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 15 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat; threshed about 500 bu. Of wheat; some oats, poor; 10 A. hay. Partly rented land with others.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, binder, disc, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Plays does very well in farming. He probably visits too much, as I was at his place 2 or 3 times and did not find him at home. However, he does considerable farming and is not among the worst, industrially, by considerable. 

His little girl attend publi

properties.Name: Mortimer Plenty Hawk
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with three windows, two chimney's, and a door. There is a family standing out in front of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 5 miles south of Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 25 A. native hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 10 range horses, 30 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and log barn.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and log barn.
properties.Implement_: 2 wagons, 2 riding plows, binder, 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, drill disc
properties.Remarks: This man and his brother should do considerably more work than they do. They live on their mother's allotment. Mortimer should have a house of his own and on his own land, and he desires such house when he can afford it. They do better than many of the y

properties.Name: Hartford Comes From Above
properties.Photo_Desc: Stone house with buildings behind the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. mixed hay, rest in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good stone house, no stable
properties.House_Comm: Good stone house, no stable
properties.Implement_: Harrow, disc, plow, mower, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile. Wore out one and learned that he couldn't afford it.
properties.Remarks: Hartford received his Patent in Fee some 3 years ago. He borrowed money and bought cattle, which appeared to be a very good business deal at the time. He confronted an expensive winter and failed to make proper provision for his cattle and lost some of t

properties.Name: Bread
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with an extension. A wooden fence behind the house to the left. Fence posts around the home with three individuals standing out front.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 12 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 3 range horses, 1 race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, old cabins and sheds, fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, old cabins and shed, fair stable.
properties.Implement_: mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These are just 2 old people with one small foster child, about 5 years old. They live alone, they stay at their own place, and they do not entertain sundry relatives. While their house was one large room, it was neat and clean. It was really better than

properties.Name: Ned Old Bear
properties.Alt_Name: Young Old Bear; Edward Old Bear
properties.Education_: Went to reservation boarding school for a short time.
properties.School_Des: Public school. Prospect of new school house nearby.
properties.Gen_Cond: See the report of Herbert Old Bear.
properties.Remarks: He has an automobile but evidently it is out of commission and is not consuming any gas. Ned's wife is receiving a pension of some $50.00 a month because of a relative's death in the recent war. This of course prevents very much farming as $50.00 a month

properties.Name: Whiteman Runs Him
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with door and chimeny. Two individuals, likely Whiteman Runs Him and wife, stand infront of the house. A clothes line and anotherr building are seen to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, and Reuben Spotted, who works with him.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 6 miles above Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, no oats, 6 A. alfalfa, 25 A. hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 20 range horses, 40 cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 log houses, fair log stable.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 mowers, 2 rakes, stacker, bullrake, harrow, disc, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Whiteman Runs Him is an old time Indian. He was one of the scouts with the 7th cavalry at the time of the battle of the Little Big Horn. When there is some dress parade among the Indians, he is fixed up in his Indian garb and might be taken for the remna

properties.Name: Clifford White Shirt
properties.Family_Des: Wife, daughter, son and wife, and one child.
properties.Education_: None. Son went to Reservation School.
properties.Health_Com: Health broken by use of peyote
properties.Crop_Desc: 36 A. wheat, 22 A. oats, 25 A. native hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 4 range horses
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, plow, disc, rake, riding plow
properties.Remarks: Clifford White Shirt has a very good place, with enough under irrigation to make them an independent living. His son and wife live with them. They have not done well with their farming. The last 2 or 3 years they have devoted a large part of their time t

properties.Name: Thomas Stewart #1
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame hoouse with multiple windows, a side door, and chiimney. There is a barn to be back left of the house and a clothing line infront of it. A wagon is parked infront of the house.
properties.Education_: Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. what, 28 A. oats, 17 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, no saddle horses, 5 range horses, 8 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, stable, root house, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, stable, root house, chicken house
properties.Implement_: binder, plow, mower, disc, drill, rake, buckrake, stacker, harrow, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These people live at home very well. They do not have many people about them regularly. The house is moderately well furnished, rather indifferently kept. They are leaders in the peyote religion, and especially the woman, who became quite earnest in her

properties.Name: Clifford Takes Horse
properties.Alt_Name: Cilfford Takes the Horse; Clifford T. Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension. A shed and wagon in the back right behind the house. To the left laundry is hanging to dry.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 5 children. 2 in public school.
properties.Education_: Reservation school and Haskell. Wife in same schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat With Plays on another place alfalfa and timothy about 60 acres, rest in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 head work horses, 6 saddle horses 6 head of cattle
properties.House_desc: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has converted old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has convered old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Has a fair outfit. 2 plows, mower and rake, wagons and spring wagons. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From river. Had a well but it was not good.
properties.Industry: Works very well most of the time. Has new house but it needs painting.
properties.Remarks: Clifford seems to be trying to do fairly well. His land is not well drained and he has been unable to get a stand of alfalfa on it. It is rather hard adobe land difficult to work. He is putting in some winter wheat on dry land, with a friend. His house i

properties.Name: Mark Real Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors, two windows, and a chimney. In the back left there is a clothes line. To the back right there is a log  shed and a abuilding under construction- possibly an arbor.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 4 children; father-in-law, Frank Bethune, and wife; Edson Fire Bear, widower, with 2 children, make their home with him.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Mission Day School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School. One child attending.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4 miles above agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, 20 A.; alfalfa, 30 A.; mixed hay, 20 A. Place cut by sloughs.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 unbroken range horses, geese, pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, grain drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Very good considering quality of land.
properties.Remarks: This man is one of the best of the young farmers. He has a very good set of buildings, corrals, fences, etc. Makes very good use of his land. It is not of the best and is out by old channels and sloughs, so that it is difficult to irrigate to advantage.

properties.Name: Joe Mountain Pocket
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with one window and fence posts to its left.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, Mountain Pocket Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat; 6 A. oats; 40 A. hay, estimated at 40 tons
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 5 range horses, 5 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.House_Comm: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, mower, rake, harrow, stacker, 2 bullrakes, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Joe has the one merit that he usually stays at his own home., Outside of that, there is nothing much to say. He does very little work. He has kept a Mexican around him, giving him about half the crop for doing the work. He has a very good place and a hou

properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 range horses and saddle horses.

properties.House_Comm: Good new frame house, cellar under it, Fair stable. House is fairly well furnished and kept.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, cultivator, wagons. Has automobile that runs sometimes.

properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4 miles above Agency

properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 15 range horses, one race house, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, log stable, cellar and storeroom
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, log stable, cellar and storeroom
properties.Implement_: Disc, plow, mower, stacker, wagon
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch and well. Pump broken at present, but the well is fair.
properties.Remarks: This young man does considerable farming. He has some land of his own and some of his mother's land. He also has worked with a relative on his farm. He has some land suitable for dry farming which has not been farmed. Part of his land is suitable only fo

properties.Name: William Bends
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, and a porch extension. To the right of the house there is a building under construction.
properties.Family_Des: wife, 4 children, and his mother. Children in public school.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife went to Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. alfalfa, 15 A. mixed hay, pasture on some inherited allotments not included in farm.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, no range horses, 26 cattle, 2 pigs.

properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, buckrake, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile.

properties.Name: Comes Up Red
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with log building behind to the right. Family standing outside the front door of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one foster child, daughter of Tom Stewart
properties.Crop_Desc: Farm land is all leased to Sugar Company. He does no farming himself. He works with Tom Stewart in making hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work teams. About 30 range horses, mostly wild. No other stock.
properties.House_desc: Good new house and fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house and fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit, but not complete. At present he does not need it.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from the river. No well.
properties.Remarks: Very poor. He promises to make a little garden, and he sometimes works with a neighbor in putting up hay, but generally he is doing nothing, unless it be on the road going to town and back. He has no automobile, and if he had it would not take him long t

properties.Name: Looks at the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in fence and two individuals, a man and woman, standing out front. A log shed stands in the background and a grazing horse is seen to the right of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley. 3 miles below agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 acres alfalfa. 26 acres wheat and oats. Some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 4 range  horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house and a good cabin. No root cellar. Stable is in good condition.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house and a good cabin. No root cellar. Stable is in good condition.
properties.Implement_: Plow, drill, disc harrow, rake, interest in binder, wagons, and spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Likes to work, but does not like to work too much. Does not use peyote and has no automobile. His house is just moderately furnished and moderately kept. Has sewing machine, bedsteads, range, fair outfit of kitchen utensils. This year his farm is being h

properties.Name: Joe Stewart
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three seasons porch, two windows, and a chimney. In the back left of the house stands other buildings/structures.
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from farm to Hardin public school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn, 2 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 3-room frame house and log barn.
properties.House_Comm: 3-room frame house and log barn.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, binder, disc, harrow, plow, cultivator, buckrake
properties.Remarks: At present, Joe Stewart is employed at the Agency as an assistant in the engineering department. He is a very good employee when working for someone else. He lives here, which gives his children a good chance to attend public school. His son, Frank, prob

properties.Name: Percy Blackhair
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windowd, a chimney, and door. To the back right stands a log shed. Fence posts surround the house.
properties.Family_Des: Himself and wife. No one living with them.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley few miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 acres alfalfa 19 wheat. 16 oats. 20 A. hay land rest is pasture and road right of way river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses. 2 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.House_Comm: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, wagons, fair outfit for his farming and harvesting
properties.Water_Desc: Hauled from river. Stock water from slough. Attempted to get a well but failed after going quite deep.
properties.Industry: He knows how to work very well and does fairly well but could and should do considerably better. His land is not the best being cut by sloughs and with a tendency to become alkalois for want of drainage. They live to themselves without any of their relat

properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses

properties.House_Comm: Good 3-room log haouse, fair log stable, chicken house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, mower, rake, spring wagon, wagon

properties.Name: Henry Shinbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a family, Henry Shinbone's, and a wagon out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 step children, both married and living separately mostly. Mother-in-law an old woman lives with them.
properties.Education_: Reservation school 8 years. Carlisle 5 years. Wife one year in Mission.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, near mouth of Reno Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: wheat 25 A. Oats 35 A. Hopes to increase acreage this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses. 15 range horses. One yearling heifer
properties.House_desc: Very good log house, large rooms. Poor stable. Fence, fair.
properties.House_Comm: Very good log house, large rooms. Poor stable. Fence, fair.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, mower, rake, sweep rake, grain drill, 2 wagons, buggy, 3 sets double harness
properties.Industry: Farms quite well. Considerable room for improvement.
properties.Remarks: This man lives on the allotment of his married daughter, where there is a good house, and there is more land to cultivate than on his own allotment. While he lives alone largely he does work in partnership with is son-in-law so that it is quite difficult

properties.Name: Thomas Medicine Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a clothes line to the left. To the right of the house there is a group of men standing in front of a wagon and other buildings.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 6 children. Son Frank and wife.
properties.Education_: Reservation school and Carlisle for 5 years. Wife was at Carlisle.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school. Few children in public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 14 A. wheat. 24 A. oats. 50 alfalfa. Rest in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: About 10 work horses, 7 saddle horses. 16 cattle in pasture. Have some hogs.
properties.House_desc: Very good frame house and stable, root house. Fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Very good frame house and stable, root house. Fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit farming and harvesting, including 2 wagons, binder, and plows, disc, mower, etc. Have automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: Hav well, not very good. Sometimes haul water from river or ditch.
properties.Industry: Very good worker.
properties.Remarks: Thomas is a Sioux Indian who was adopted into this tribe many years ago, married here and allotted here. He was given a patent in fee for his own land which was sold. His wife has recently received a patent in fee for a small quantity of inherited land w

properties.Name: Thomas Stewart #2
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, a couple windows, and a chimney. A women sits on the porch holding a baby while another child looks through the screen door.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and three children. Mother-in-law and her husband live and work with them.
properties.Education_: Some education in reservation and mission schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat about 30 A. Oats 7 A. wild hay and pasture nearly 40 some being taken up by the railroad right of way.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses. 8 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: A fair house. No stable.
properties.House_Comm: A fair house. No stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit. Plow, harrow, rake and interest in a binder.
properties.Water_Desc: From the ditch or river. No well.
properties.Industry: One of the best. He often stays at home and works when others are attending some sport event. Has no automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man farms his land and stays at home and works better than the most of them. He has 20 acres of land leased from another Indian to increase his farm activities. When I was there he had two teams working the field, one being driven by his old father-

properties.Name: Francis Stewart
properties.Status: Both - wife Fee Patent, him trust
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, o saddle horse, 2 unbroke range horses
properties.House_desc: Frame house in fair condition, log stable.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house in fair condition, log stable
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This young man lives on his mother's allotment and ordinarily in the house with his father. His father, Joe Stewart, is now employed as a laborer at the Agency and Francis pretends to run the place. He has good land under irrigation. It is very much negl

properties.Name: Edward Big Medicine
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. alfalfa, 42 wheat, 20 A. wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses
properties.House_desc: Good 3-room log haouse, fair log stable, chicken house, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Good 3-room log haouse, fair log stable, chicken house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, mower, rake, spring wagon, wagon
properties.Remarks: This boy lives with his father, Big Medicine, who has been Chief of Police at the Agency for many years. His home seems to be a sort of stopping place and harbor for everybody who comes this way, and they feed a great many visitors, as is always the case

properties.Name: Victor Three Irons
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors and multiple windows. To the left of the house is a large fram barn with another building next to it. Fence posts surround the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: wife and six children. Two in Public School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School by School wagon
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 5 miles below Agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 A. of oats, 23 A. of alfalfa, 20 A. of beets, by tenant.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, no range horses
properties.House_desc: Good frame house and barn, root cellar, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Fair farm outfit.
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or Rriver. Tried for well but failed.
properties.Industry: Fair
properties.Remarks: This man has a very good education, knows very well how to work. He has been acting as an interpreter for the Examiner of Inheritance, so has most of his ground rented. He does a little farming. He has a nice looking house and barn, recently improved by

properties.Name: Eagle
properties.Linked_Acc: Thomas Tobacco, Looks At the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house in the far left of the photo. To the right of the house stand two buildings; a barn to the far right and a frame house in the middle.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children. Of school age.
properties.Education_: None. Wife was in reservation boarding school and Carlisle one year.
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa 18 A. Wheat 10 A. Oats 10 A. balance in hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 teams. About 20 saddle horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.House_Comm: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit of farm and hay tools. Has an interest in binder. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Rather good
properties.Remarks: This house is a very nice new cottage, well painted, very well furnished and very well kept. A good frame barn sufficient to stable 3 or 4 teams and to store some feed. Living with them is Thomas Tobacco a young man who is a very good worker and whos wif

properties.Name: Tie Crooked Arm
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame home with a window, chimney, and screened in porch. Various implements are scattered throughout the yard. Two individuals, likely Tie Crooked Arm and wife, stand by the porch. Behind the house is another building anf fencing.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. 2 single brothers live with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 27 acres alfalfa. 12 A. wheat.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work teams. 10 range and saddle horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old house in indifferent condition. Poor stable and carral, root house out of repair.
properties.House_Comm: Old house in indifferent condition. Poor stable and carral, root house out of repair.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and hay making implements including hay rack, spring wagon. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: Only fair. He and his brother work a little while in the spring, but act as though they might be afraid of doing too much and getting all the work done and be at a loss as to how to pass the time away. Says he plays rummy sometimes, enough to get money e

properties.Name: Alvin Morrison
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with large shed to the left of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 8 miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheat; oats, on rented land, 30 A.; 25 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 1 race horse, 14 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor house, poor stable, root cellar, garage.
properties.Implement_: Quite a complete outfit of farming and haying tools, including an automobile
properties.Water_Desc: From the River. Should have a well.
properties.Remarks:
Alvin was not home when I called there, as he was working with his team on the irrigation ditch. He is 1/2 white, has a Patent-in-Fee for his own land, which has either been sold or mortgaged.

He lives on inherited and family land belonging to his wife'

properties.Name: Looks at the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in fence and two individuals, a man and woman, standing out front. A log shed stands in the background and a grazing horse is seen to the right of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley. 3 miles below agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 acres alfalfa. 26 acres wheat and oats. Some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 4 range  horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house and a good cabin. No root cellar. Stable is in good condition.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house and a good cabin. No root cellar. Stable is in good condition.
properties.Implement_: Plow, drill, disc harrow, rake, interest in binder, wagons, and spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Likes to work, but does not like to work too much. Does not use peyote and has no automobile. His house is just moderately furnished and moderately kept. Has sewing machine, bedsteads, range, fair outfit of kitchen utensils. This year his farm is being h

properties.Name: Fred Dawes
properties.School_Des: School wagon to public school at Hardin
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3.5 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 23 A. alfalfa, 6 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 10 range horses, 11 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small granary
properties.House_Comm: Small granary
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, riding plow, harrow, farm wagon, spring wagon, harness
properties.Remarks: Fred Dawes really has no home of his own. He lives about the White Fox family, who, I believe, is his father-in-law. They work more or less together. Fred seems to be fairly industrious. He does not stay away from any particular race meet or fandangos of

properties.Name: David Dawes
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house man, David Dawes, posing with horses and woman, wife, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children. Bushy Head and wife live with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat; oats, crop rental, 60 A., 50 A. alfalfa; 15 A. wild hay; remainder is pasture and slough
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 1 saddle horse, 5 unbroke range horses, 10 cattle.
properties.House_desc: fair frame house; shed; no root house or stable.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house; shed; no root house or stable
properties.Implement_: wagon, plow, harrow, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks:
His house is just fairly well kept, moderately furnished. It is badly in need of some inside finish, paper or otherwise. David works fairly well, lives at home practically all the time. He should do better by more diligent application to his farm.

properties.Name: Otto Bear Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch, two windows, and a chimney. Two individuals stand out front, likely Otto  Bear Cloud and his wife. A wagon stands to the left of the house and an automobile is in the front.
properties.Education_: Sherman Institute. Wife went to Haskell.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school by conveyance.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some wheat on rented land, in partnership. Very little else.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, no saddle horese, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair 3-room house, no stable. House is very poorly kept.
properties.House_Comm: Fair 3-room house, no stable. House is very poorly kept.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, rake, wagon. No mower, no stacker, no disc or drill or binder, but has one Ford.
properties.Remarks: Otto seems to have had a fair reputation as a laborer when he worked for someone else. He certainly shows no evidence of industry in connection with his own farm. They have managed to live with the help of tribal income and some work. The place where he

properties.Name: Felix Bear Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: two log structures with two wagons and an arbor out front.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife attended Fort Shaw and reservation.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley near the mouth of Soap Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: 16 A. wheat, 12 A. oats, 15 A. wild hay. The hay made only a fragment of a crop because it was not irrigated in time.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 15 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Cabin and tent near the river, odd the land.
properties.House_Comm: Cabin and tent near the river, odd the land
properties.Implement_: Plow, drill, wagon, only
properties.Remarks:
Felix is using some inherited land belonging to his wife's family. There is no house on it. He lives in a cabin near the river where it is somewhat protected from the storms. 

The land is particularly adapted to wild hay, and he should have had a big cr

properties.Name: Fred Froze
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife reservation school and Haskell for 3 years
properties.Location_D: At present camping 4 miles below agency where he is farming his wife's allotments.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat. 7 A. oats. Little wild hay.

properties.House_desc: No buildings on his wife's land. On his own land fair buildings. Land leased.

properties.Name: Round Rock
properties.Location_D: 4 miles south of Hardin in Big Horn Valley.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse, 1 saddle horse.
properties.House_desc: None
properties.House_Comm: None.
properties.Implement_: Plow, cultivator, harness
properties.Remarks: This old man is hardly deserving of a farm report, as he does not farm much. He lives alone except when he visits among his friends and relatively. When we have road work to do or other work for wages, he is one of our best men, considering his age, and

properties.Name: James Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Large tents and a clothing line, with no houses pictured. To the right of the tents is an automobile and a wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children attending public and mission schools
properties.Education_: Carlisle and Reservation. Wife went to reservation schools.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Mission school and public school
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley near St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 15 range horses, 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nothing. Lives in a tent.
properties.House_Comm: Nothing. Lives in a tent.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm implements. No grain drill, no harrow, 2 wagons, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: This boy was trained to farm in Carlyle school and under the outing system with some German farmers in Pennsylvania. He talks English very well. He knows how work ought to be done, but he lacks the inclination to do it. He has as good a tract of land as

properties.Name: Thomas Big Lake
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window, chimney, and door. Behind the house stands a few buildings and a fence.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife in Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, south of Hardin.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 7 A. alfalfa, 50 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 30 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good 2-room house, log barn.
properties.House_Comm: Good 2-room house, log barn.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, buckrake, spring wagon, outfit of harness
properties.Remarks: Thomas is one of our more industrious farming Indians. Though he lives rather near the town, he is usually at home. He puts up considerable hay and farms quite well. He usually has some hay to sell; also some wheat, and he produces a good deal of food fo

properties.Name: Two Leggings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door.  Two men, one likely Two Leggins, stand out front and another individual stands in the door way.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 5  children and an old lady relative
properties.Health_Com: Good for his age, but not able to work much.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Two Leggin Bridge
properties.Crop_Desc: 60 A. wild hay, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old frame house in poor condition; fair stable; root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, plow, riding plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Two leggings is one of the old men, a sort of sub-chief. He is making a very good effort considering his age. He does not do much farming, but he puts up most of his hay by himself with the help of the women and children. His house is very much in need o

properties.Name: Old Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two doors and a chimney. A family, likely Old Whiteman's, stands out front. Some implements are scattered behind the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 5 A. oats, 60 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 50 unbroke range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 mowers, rake, 2 bullrakes, stacker, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This man is not famous as a hard worker and good farm member. He does stay at his own home very well, but hired most of his work done, either by shares of crops, or with money. He had a white family at the place when I was there, putting up his hay. He,

properties.Name: Austin Straycalf
properties.Photo_Desc: frame house with side attachment
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Mission School. Very limited education.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 6 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. alfalfa, 30 A. wild hay, 20 A. wheat, 10 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 1 saddle horse, 10 unbroke range horses, 4 cattle.

properties.Remarks:
This man says that he is a good worker. It seems that he does fairly well on his place. However, the weeds around the buildings were very large. There may be a few more buildings that were not reported and could not be found for the weeds.

properties.Name: Thomas Medicine Horse

properties.Education_: Reservation school and Carlisle for 5 years. Wife was at Carlisle.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school. Few children in public school.
