properties.Name: John Adams
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window, chimney, and extension. To the back right of the house stands a shed or stable with an automobile to its right.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and three children, Girl 17, boys 9 and 2
properties.Education_: Self and wife attended reservation school up to about 6th grade
properties.School_Des: Live convenient to public school where their son attends.
properties.Health_Com: Daughter subject to fits, appears strong. Other members of family quite healthy.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 10 A. Oats 30 A. alfalfa 20 S. additional wheat to be sown in the spring
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 2 saddle horses; 3 or 4 range horses. No cattle. No hogs.
properties.House_desc: Fair home, being repared. Poor stable and tool shed. Root cellar in bad condition.
properties.House_Comm: Fair home, being repared. Poor stable and tool shed. Root cellar in bad condition.
properties.Implement_: Harness, 4 horses, spring wagon, mower, rake, buckrake, grain drill, binder, partnership, plow, gange.
properties.Water_Desc: Hauled from river for domestic use, sock and cleaning from slough. Needs a well.
properties.Gen_Cond: Fair for a young man with some education
properties.Industry: Does some farming but not with the application that should be given
properties.Remarks: This man and his wife are both rather above the average of intelligence. They have land better than many with some pasture along the sloughs and old river channel where it would cost nothing to keep one or two cows. They have an automobile which doubtles

properties.Name: Mark Real Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors, two windows, and a chimney. In the back left there is a clothes line. To the back right there is a log  shed and a abuilding under construction- possibly an arbor.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 4 children; father-in-law, Frank Bethune, and wife; Edson Fire Bear, widower, with 2 children, make their home with him.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Mission Day School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School. One child attending.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4 miles above agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, 20 A.; alfalfa, 30 A.; mixed hay, 20 A. Place cut by sloughs.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 unbroken range horses, geese, pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, grain drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Very good considering quality of land.
properties.Remarks: This man is one of the best of the young farmers. He has a very good set of buildings, corrals, fences, etc. Makes very good use of his land. It is not of the best and is out by old channels and sloughs, so that it is difficult to irrigate to advantage.

properties.Name: Ben Gardner
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with small log building in the background
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school and mission school
properties.Location_D: Wife's inherited land in Big Horn Valley, 2 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: Few acres of wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small log house, small stable and root house.
properties.House_Comm: Smal log house, small stable and root house.
properties.Implement_: Disc, plow, drill, binder, mower, wagon, spring wagon, automobile
properties.Remarks: We believe that it would be better to have a well than to support an automobile. Ben Gardner is a mixed blood. He received a Policy Patent. He evidently disposed of the land and bought the Ford and it is not recorded just how he gets the gasoline. He is

properties.Name: Alvin Morrison
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with large shed to the left of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 8 miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheat; oats, on rented land, 30 A.; 25 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 1 race horse, 14 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor house, poor stable, root cellar, garage.
properties.Implement_: Quite a complete outfit of farming and haying tools, including an automobile
properties.Water_Desc: From the River. Should have a well.
properties.Remarks:
Alvin was not home when I called there, as he was working with his team on the irrigation ditch. He is 1/2 white, has a Patent-in-Fee for his own land, which has either been sold or mortgaged.

He lives on inherited and family land belonging to his wife'

properties.Name: John Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with one window, a chimney, and a covered porch.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 children. One in Public School.
properties.Education_: He went to reservation school. Wife went to mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 100 A. wild hay land, balance in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Very good small frame house, granary, poor stable. Promises to build well house.
properties.House_Comm: Very good small frame house, granary, poor stable. Promises to build well house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, disc, mower, rake, wagons etc. Limited equipment
properties.Remarks: John has a very good place, but he does not live on it regularly. He has relatives in Lodgegrass who seem to insist upon his staying about them to help them with their work. He puts in too much time going back and forth. He raises some crop, his house is

properties.Name: Eagle
properties.Linked_Acc: Thomas Tobacco, Looks At the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house in the far left of the photo. To the right of the house stand two buildings; a barn to the far right and a frame house in the middle.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children. Of school age.
properties.Education_: None. Wife was in reservation boarding school and Carlisle one year.
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa 18 A. Wheat 10 A. Oats 10 A. balance in hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 teams. About 20 saddle horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.House_Comm: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit of farm and hay tools. Has an interest in binder. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Rather good
properties.Remarks: This house is a very nice new cottage, well painted, very well furnished and very well kept. A good frame barn sufficient to stable 3 or 4 teams and to store some feed. Living with them is Thomas Tobacco a young man who is a very good worker and whos wif

properties.Name: White Arm
properties.Photo_Desc: N/A
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. oats, 75 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 frame houses, frame barn, implement shed, chicken coop, toliet, fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, buckrake, stacker, plow.
properties.Remarks: His farm adjoins the town of Lodgegrass. White Arm has been a policeman for many years and devotes a part of almost everyday to that work. He is not physically able to handle the farm alone. It has been farmed on crop rental basis or leased. He is rather

properties.Name: Holeman Ceasley
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chmney, two windows, a side and front door, and an extension off the back. Three adults stand in front and inside the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children, 3 away at school -- we find out later that he has a son that lives with his grandfather and the 4 kids are hers from a previous marriage
properties.Health_Com: Rather poor. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. oats, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 16 range horses, possibly a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Old house now occupied by Cree Indian. No other buildings. Ceasely lives in a tent.
properties.House_Comm: Old house now occupied by Cree Indian. No other buildings. Ceasely lives in a tent.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, 2 buckrakes, stacker
properties.Remarks: These people live on the wife's inherited land where she lives with a former husband. Ceasely has some very good land of his own which is rented, as he is hardly able to cultivate it himself. He has a Cree Indian living in his house doing most of the wor

properties.Name: Two Leggings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door.  Two men, one likely Two Leggins, stand out front and another individual stands in the door way.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 5  children and an old lady relative
properties.Health_Com: Good for his age, but not able to work much.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Two Leggin Bridge
properties.Crop_Desc: 60 A. wild hay, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old frame house in poor condition; fair stable; root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, plow, riding plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Two leggings is one of the old men, a sort of sub-chief. He is making a very good effort considering his age. He does not do much farming, but he puts up most of his hay by himself with the help of the women and children. His house is very much in need o

properties.Name: Other Medicine
properties.House_Comm: Living in Buildings put on by Sugar Company lease. Good house and barn,. Small cabin, and root house, fair fences
properties.Implement_: Plows, harrow, mower, rake, stacker, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon, fair outfit, Has no automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water at well extra good. At his own cabin ditch water.
properties.Remarks: Other Medicine has been on the police force for a number of years, recently quite. He has a son who works with him and they farm quite well. His house is moderately furnished and moderately well kept for an old Indian. They have sewing machine, bedsteads

properties.Name: Ben Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch. Fence posts surrounding the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; mother; brother, Felix, 21 years old
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing. Put up hay elsewhere.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house and log house. Building a barn.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house and a log house. Building a barn.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This land is really very hard to plow and work. It is heavy and remains wet late in the spring. Ben does not need very much discouragement to keep him from working. He seems to have had the means, someway, to get along with the very little work, living o

properties.Name: Other Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. Another framed building, likely a shed, to the left of the house. A wagon stands on both sides of the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Reservation school. Son-in-Law went to Reservation School.
properties.School_Des: School wagon to Hardin public school.
properties.Health_Com: Poor, but son-in-law is quite well.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4.5 miles from Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. alfalfa, 6 A. wheat, 5 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle, 25 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good small frame house, log barn, tool shed, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good small frame house, log barn, tool shed, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, mower, rake, drill, buckrake.
properties.Remarks: Other Bull is not much given to work. His wife is a much better worker and his son-in-law, who has now been living with them whose name is Joe Hides, appears to be a rather industrious young man. He has done practically all of the work this past season.

properties.Name: Alexander Crane
properties.Linked_Acc: The Crane, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tent, beloning to The Crane, to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and six children, 3 in public school.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Reservation Boarding School.
properties.Health_Com: His own health is very poor at present. Family is well.
properties.Crop_Desc: 52 A. wheat, 3 A. oats, 50 A. alfalfa, 80 A. mixed hay, pasture along the creek.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 25 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable under construction. Good root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable under construction. Good root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, binder, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man is a very good farmer. He has a large family. His wife is above the average in intelligence. Her house is quite well kept, fairly well furnished. His father, The Crane, lives with him or in camp adjoining the house. He is an old man, not able to

properties.Name: Joe Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a chimney, three windows, and a porch addition. To the front of the house is a fence and to the right is a wagon.
properties.Education_: Reservation school, Wife attended Mission school
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school, where the children attend.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Practically all in hay. Small patch of wheat. Made some 25 tons of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle. I would suggest that he trade the 4 saddle horses for 2 more work horses.
properties.House_desc: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.House_Comm: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, take, buckrake, wagon, spring wagon, and automobile
properties.Water_Desc: River. It is to be regreted that he cannot get his gasoline in the same place.
properties.Remarks: Joe has had a Patent-in-Fee for his own land and has probably sold it or mortgaged it, which amounts to the same. His wife's own allotment is now under lease. The land on which they are living is inherited land, which they have about 1/2 interest in. The

properties.Name: Knows
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a three seasons porch. A log building is seen to the right of the house. A wagon stand to the right with another in the center. A dog is eating grass. The second photo shows a work team with three men and a hay baler.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, father, widowed daughter and 2 children
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, above St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. voluntary wheat, 140 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, buckracke, stacker, mower, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This family stay on their place regularly. It is a beautiful piece of land. Every acre can be cultivated and irrigated. It is mostly in wild hay, which is usually a very good crop with little expense connected with producing it. It is probably better for

properties.Name: Yellow Face
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with an adjacent log building. Two other log buildings stand to the left of the house and a fence surrounds the perimeter.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 10 range horses, 2 or 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 log houses, root cellar, stable.
properties.Implement_: Mower, plow, hay-rake.
properties.Remarks: I visited this place twice, but did not find anyone at home. They just happened to be away temporarily, they usually live in the same place and they keep their place much better than most of the Indians. It is clean and neat about the yard and the house

properties.Name: Pretty Coyote
properties.Linked_Acc: Manuel Mountain Bull, David Bull Mountain
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and door. A couple tents stand to the back right along with a log building. A man, Pretty Coyote, and his children stand infront of the house with a horse.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only, and David Bull Mountain, stepson, and wife.
properties.Location_D: On Pryor Creek, 4 miles above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 30 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa, mixed hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 race horses 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Industry: None
properties.Remarks: When I called at this house in the middle part of the day in the middle part of the summer, I found Pretty Coyote and his stepson, who lives with him, sitting in the house. Pretty Coyote made no pretense of working. He said he had his crops raised by a r

properties.Name: Gets Down
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension. An automobile and a wagon stand to the left of the house and another building is seen in the background. Two individuals stand in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child; Little Skunk and child
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 8 A. oats, 6 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 unbroke range horses, no cattle
properties.House_desc: Small frame house, fairly furnished and kept, small frame stable, root house
properties.House_Comm: Small frame house, fairly furnished and kept, small frame stable, root house
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, 2 mowers, 2 rakes, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man seems to live at home quite regularly. He does very little visiting and has very few surplus people about him. He hires some help, but mostly Cree Indians. Possibly that is because they can be employed about his farm without being fed regularly

properties.Name: Bird Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a tent standing in the distance behind. A wagon is pictured to the left of the house as well as to the right. Four individuals stand outside of the  house.
properties.Education_: He and wife have no education.
properties.School_Des: One mile to Baptist Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 6 miles above St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, little oats and a little alfalfa. Should have 100 A. wild hay, but did not irrigate it. Grasshoppers did considerable damage.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 10 range horses. All seem to be in his corral as there appeared to be about 40 up in the corral.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: plow, harrow, mower, rake, interest in binder, drill
properties.Remarks:
This land is particularly adapted to the native wild hay, but just for want of the industry to irrigate it, he had very little, I think not more than 10 ten. 

His house is a moderate log house, very indifferently furnished and kept. He had his implement

properties.Name: Leo Hugs
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, two windows, and a front door. A family stands outside the house and there is a log shed in the background.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 25 A. oats, 100 A. mixed hay land, some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 40 range horses, 50 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, bullrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Leo and his wife are regarded as among the best of our Indians. They live on their own place all the time except as it may be necessary to camp nearer the school in a little cabin through the severe part of the winter in order for their children to be in

properties.Name: Flat Mouth
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with extension and log shed to the left. A wagon in front of the house and an automobile to the left. A man, Flat Mouth, and his wife and child stand out front.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to reservation school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 14 A. alfalfa, rest in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 4 range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair cabin, new one started. No stable or tool shed.
properties.House_Comm: Fair cabin, new one started. No stable or tool shed.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, rake, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no mower. He needs a mower.
properties.Remarks: His house is just a fair log cabin. They have started another one which is not so much better. The present house is poorly furnished and indifferently kept. Of course, this time of year they stay most of the time out in the tent. There is one claim to re

properties.Name: His Rock Is Medicine
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, two chimneys, and an extension. A fence surrounds the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats, hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 or 4 saddle horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house. Root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow
properties.Remarks: I visited this man's place twice, but did not find him at home. However, I understand that he does usually live at this place. He has a fair cabin. He works a little. He is not very well.Considering his age and health, he does better than some of the abl

properties.Name: Small
properties.Linked_Acc: Big Hail, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with door. A tent stands to the left of the cabin. To the right of the house is a few implements, a wagon, and a man, likely Small, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one child. Big Hail and wife, and Campbell Big Hail and wife and children live with him.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, no alfalfa, no wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.Implement_: None at all, but borrows from his neighbors.
properties.Remarks: He admits that he likes to work and considering that he has no implements, he is doing very well. If he can irrigate as much as he claims, he certainly should have more hay. He is using the ground for pasture mostly. He was not at home when I visited his

properties.Name: Gets Down
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension. An automobile and a wagon stand to the left of the house and another building is seen in the background. Two individuals stand in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child; Little Skunk and child
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 8 A. oats, 6 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 unbroke range horses, no cattle
properties.House_desc: Small frame house, fairly furnished and kept, small frame stable, root house
properties.House_Comm: Small frame house, fairly furnished and kept, small frame stable, root house
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, 2 mowers, 2 rakes, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man seems to live at home quite regularly. He does very little visiting and has very few surplus people about him. He hires some help, but mostly Cree Indians. Possibly that is because they can be employed about his farm without being fed regularly

properties.Name: Bird Above
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch and fence surrounding the property. To the right of the house there is a windmill and a small shed. Further to the right there is a small tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son married. Son Eric works with them. -- find out in Eric's file that he's married and definitely living with them
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 wheat, 40 acres oats. 10 acres hay land and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. Some saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only
properties.Implement_: plows, mowers, rake wagons. fair outfit
properties.Water_Desc: From the creek or neighbors well. They have a well but not good.
properties.Gen_Cond: Indifferent. They have an old automobile but there is some hope in that respect because it looks like it was past repair.
properties.Remarks: Bird Above has had two grown sons living with him. One of them recently married to a Shosoni girl and is not on the Shoshoni Reservation. They are making a fair start at farming this year, and I feel hopeful that there may be an improvement. They bought

properties.Name: Barney Old Coyote
properties.Remarks: He has no separate place. He lives with Takes the Gun and very seldom works. He did make fair wages part of the time the last year as a movie actor for some pictures that were taken in this locality. He talks, well, writes well and can give good advice t

properties.Name: Joe Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a chimney, three windows, and a porch addition. To the front of the house is a fence and to the right is a wagon.
properties.Education_: Reservation school, Wife attended Mission school
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school, where the children attend.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Practically all in hay. Small patch of wheat. Made some 25 tons of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle. I would suggest that he trade the 4 saddle horses for 2 more work horses.
properties.House_desc: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.House_Comm: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, take, buckrake, wagon, spring wagon, and automobile
properties.Water_Desc: River. It is to be regreted that he cannot get his gasoline in the same place.

properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 40 range horses, 50 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, bullrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Leo and his wife are regarded as among the best of our Indians. They live on their own place all the time except as it may be necessary to camp nearer the school in a little cabin through the severe part of the winter in order for their children to be in

properties.Name: Elmer Takes Wrinkle
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife also went to reservation school
properties.Location_D: Home on wife's land, 3 miles above Agency on Little Horn.
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 A. alfalfa, 120 A. wild hay, rest in pasture. Raising grain in partnership with Howard Shane in another locality.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horese, 5 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, old barn to be torn down and rebuilt
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, old barn to be torn down and rebuilt
properties.Implement_: Rake, hay-rake, wagon, spring wagon. Rather inadequate equipment.
properties.Remarks: Elmer secured a Patent Fee for his own allotment. He immediately sold it and went into partnership with another Fee Patent Indian to build and operate a garage at Crow Agency. It was not long before their money had completely disappeared. He is now livin

properties.Name: Jacob Big Hair
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 or 5 children. Three in school.
properties.Education_: Attended mission school. Can talk English and read and write some.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public and mission day school
properties.Stock_Desc: about 40 horese on the range. Has no automobile.
properties.Implement_: Very few of his own.
properties.Remarks: Jacob has not used his own place much and I believe may be leased. He has an excellent chance here with his father-in-law if they would work harmoniously. It is a good place, convenient to the main roads, convenient to the irrigation ditch, lays well for

properties.Name: Knows
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a three seasons porch. A log building is seen to the right of the house. A wagon stand to the right with another in the center. A dog is eating grass. The second photo shows a work team with three men and a hay baler.

properties.House_desc: New frame house and root house. No barn.

properties.Remarks:

properties.Name: Thomas Tobacco
properties.Linked_Acc: The Eagle, Looks at the Ground
properties.Education_: He was educted in reservation school his wife in reservation school and Carlisle.
properties.Remarks: He is not running any farm of his own but works with Looks At The Ground. See his report. He has 4 work horses, 10 range horses. Wagon, plows, and disc. He has been living first one place then another farming with other people. His wife's land has been s

properties.Name: John Gros Ventre
properties.Linked_Acc: Dan Old Bull, Prairie Gros Ventre
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, side door, and a screened in porch addition.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife went to Reservation School and Haskell.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, near St. Ann's Mission
properties.Crop_Desc: 44 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay. Pasture 160 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 6 unbroken range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.House_Comm: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.Implement_: Plows, disc, harrow, mower, rake, stacker, binder, wagons, etc. Very fair equipment. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man we found cutting alfalfa. A very superior crop. He hardly had time to talk to us when we saw him in the field. We visited the house, but his wife was not at home. His place is better equipped and better kept than the average. His old father live

properties.Name: Takes the Gun #3
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front oor. Behind the house stands a tent and a wagon.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Mouth of Beauvais Creek west of Big Horn near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Other good land leased. Mostly alfalfa. Very limited amount of grain.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 4 saddle horses, 50 range horses. 50 cattle . No hogs.
properties.House_desc: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm equipment and hay machinery, wagons, harness, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: River where they live. Spring at their leased home.
properties.Gen_Cond: Poor. Automobile that consumes considerable of their limited means, and the boys spend the rest of their money playing pool.
properties.Remarks: Takes the Gun and his wife Mary were formerly regarded as among the most industrious and progressive Indians. They had a good place across the river somewhat isolated from the other settlements. They had a good house and other buildings, their own irriga

properties.Name: Ben Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch. Fence posts surrounding the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; mother; brother, Felix, 21 years old
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing. Put up hay elsewhere.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house and log house. Building a barn.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house and a log house. Building a barn.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This land is really very hard to plow and work. It is heavy and remains wet late in the spring. Ben does not need very much discouragement to keep him from working. He seems to have had the means, someway, to get along with the very little work, living o

properties.Name: Takes the Gun #3
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front oor. Behind the house stands a tent and a wagon.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Mouth of Beauvais Creek west of Big Horn near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Other good land leased. Mostly alfalfa. Very limited amount of grain.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 4 saddle horses, 50 range horses. 50 cattle . No hogs.
properties.House_desc: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm equipment and hay machinery, wagons, harness, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: River where they live. Spring at their leased home.
properties.Gen_Cond: Poor. Automobile that consumes considerable of their limited means, and the boys spend the rest of their money playing pool.
properties.Remarks: Takes the Gun and his wife Mary were formerly regarded as among the most industrious and progressive Indians. They had a good place across the river somewhat isolated from the other settlements. They had a good house and other buildings, their own irriga

properties.Name: Fannie Fighter
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with woman, Fannie Fighter, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: 2 sons, father-in-law, and an old woman.
properties.Education_: None. Boys went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: All in hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 8 saddle horese, 60 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 cabins, sheds, log stable
properties.House_Comm: 2 cabins, sheds, log stable
properties.Implement_: Some haying tools, but no farming tools.
properties.Remarks: Fannie is a widow. Her sons are about 18 and 20 years old, strong, able-bodied boys. They would rather ride and rattle their spurs than to rattle a plow of pitch fork. The result is that they do not do very well at farming. They are young and will probab

properties.Name: Other Blackbird
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child, and an old man, blind and dependent
properties.House_Comm: Fair cabin, no stable, no root house. Promises to build a root house this year.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, harrow, rake, spring wagon, only
properties.Remarks: Lives at home except in winter, when he must go near the creek for water. Works very wll. He and his wife were both working in the garden when we called at their house. They came in while we were there and when we left, they immediately went back to the

properties.Name: Good Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, daughter, and sometimes his mother
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 3 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 80 A. wild hay land, some 60 ton of hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 50 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house.
properties.Implement_: 2 mowers, rake, bullrake, stacker, 2 plows, harrow, drill, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man has a very good tract of land immediately under the ditch, convenient to irrigate, laying well for growing almost any crop. It is nearer to market than some, making it more profitable for raising grain than more remote land. He built a good hous

properties.Name: Fights Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with large addition to the left. Fence surrounding the house and addition.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Daniel Blackbird and wife and 3 children living with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 60 unbroken range horses, one race horse. Thinks he has a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, plow, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: It is reported that he works very well. He was not at home when I called at his place. Said to be out hunting for horses. His wife was in the garden at work. He said that he did not expect to go anywhere for the Fourth of July, except one day, as he want

properties.Name: Old Rabbit
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors and a chimney. A man, Old Rabbit, stands out front next to fence posts.
properties.Family_Des: None, but daughter and her husband, Jacob Big Hair, live with him.
properties.School_Des: Easy access to public school and Catholic day school.
properties.Location_D: St. Xavier in Big Horn Valley
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 acres alfalfa. No wheat or oats, most of other land idle.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 10 saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm implements and hay tools. Has no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Fair, but no farming is being done this spring.
properties.Remarks: Old Rabbit has no wife. His son-in-law has been living with him. They seem not to agree very well as to the crops. This year they are not putting in any grain, they have been working their teams on the road. They are building a new house and barn from th

properties.Name: Ball
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Three individuals standing to the right side of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Lives with married daugther and husband (Henry Big Day). They work on the farm. Also with their grandchild, but not from the daughter I don't think.
properties.Location_D: Central Big Horn Valley near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some land leased elsewhere.
properties.Stock_Desc: 11 saddle and range horses, combined
properties.House_Comm: Good house, well kept. Indifferent stable.
properties.Implement_: Hay tools, wagons, plow, drills, wagon. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: No well. Haul water from neighbors or from river. Stock go to river for water.
properties.Gen_Cond: Buildings, fences and farm in fair conditions. Fences need repairs.
properties.Industry: Only fair. Could work much better.
properties.Remarks: Ball says that he does not play pool. This was one merit. He and his son-in-law work together, and to some extent own the equipment together. This house is almost as well kept as that of Mr. Ties His Knees. The furniture and rugs are good. There are too

properties.Name: Robert Half
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window and door. Two men, one likely Robert Half, stand out front and one is resting on an automobile. To the left of the house is a log building. A wagon and other implements are scattered around the property.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. 17-year old son's health is good.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley at Soap Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 30 A. oats, 20 A. timothy, 12 A. alfalfa, 120 A. wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horese, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 cabins, poor stable.
properties.House_Comm: 2 cabins, poor stable
properties.Implement_: Old mower, rake, plow, harrow
properties.Remarks: In addition to his own allotment, he is using some inherited land. He is a very indifferent farmer. He has no wife. Just he and the boy live there alone and at present they are living in a poor old cabin, while a Cree Indian, who is working in the neighb

properties.Name: Henry Big Day
properties.Education_: He attended reservation boarding school and his wife the Catolic school. Both talk English well.
properties.Location_D: Central part of Big Horn Valley
properties.Remarks: See Report of "Ball". Henry Big Day is reputed to be fairly industrious. He has not a place of his own but lives with his father-in-law and works with him. I urged upon him the importance of going into their own home and starting a farm of their own.

properties.Name: Michael Bull Chief
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened porch, two windows, a door, and a chimney. Micheal stands in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Half brother John Bird Wellknown
properties.Education_: Both attended Mission school. Have common school education.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 wheat 20 alfalfa 20 pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses. 6 saddle horses. 3 cattle on range.
properties.House_desc: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Joint ownership with Bird Horse. They work together.
properties.Water_Desc: Very good spring close to the house.
properties.Industry: Above the average. Plays pool some, but not chronical. Has no automobile.
properties.Remarks: Mike is regarded as one of our best young men. He tends to his own business, works most of the time and apparently makes very legitimate use of his money. He lives near Bird Horse and they work in partnership very largely in their farm activities.

properties.Name: Gets Down
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension. An automobile and a wagon stand to the left of the house and another building is seen in the background. Two individuals stand in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child; Little Skunk and child
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 8 A. oats, 6 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 unbroke range horses, no cattle
properties.House_desc: Small frame house, fairly furnished and kept, small frame stable, root house
properties.House_Comm: Small frame house, fairly furnished and kept, small frame stable, root house
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, 2 mowers, 2 rakes, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man seems to live at home quite regularly. He does very little visiting and has very few surplus people about him. He hires some help, but mostly Cree Indians. Possibly that is because they can be employed about his farm without being fed regularly

properties.Name: Old Rabbit
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors and a chimney. A man, Old Rabbit, stands out front next to fence posts.
properties.Family_Des: None, but daughter and her husband, Jacob Big Hair, live with him.
properties.School_Des: Easy access to public school and Catholic day school.
properties.Location_D: St. Xavier in Big Horn Valley
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 acres alfalfa. No wheat or oats, most of other land idle.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 10 saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm implements and hay tools. Has no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Fair, but no farming is being done this spring.
properties.Remarks: Old Rabbit has no wife. His son-in-law has been living with him. They seem not to agree very well as to the crops. This year they are not putting in any grain, they have been working their teams on the road. They are building a new house and barn from th

properties.Name: Big Hail
properties.Family_Des: Himself, wife, son, and daughter married.
properties.Remarks: It seems his own land, including his house, is leased and he is living around with his friends, helping them with their farming for a part of the crop. He lives in the house with Small, also works with Goes Among The Enemy, a very unsatisfactory arrangem

properties.Name: Pretty Coyote
properties.Linked_Acc: Manuel Mountain Bull, David Bull Mountain
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and door. A couple tents stand to the back right along with a log building. A man, Pretty Coyote, and his children stand infront of the house with a horse.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only, and David Bull Mountain, stepson, and wife.
properties.Location_D: On Pryor Creek, 4 miles above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 30 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa, mixed hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 race horses 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Industry: None
properties.Remarks: When I called at this house in the middle part of the day in the middle part of the summer, I found Pretty Coyote and his stepson, who lives with him, sitting in the house. Pretty Coyote made no pretense of working. He said he had his crops raised by a r

properties.Name: Pretty Coyote
properties.Linked_Acc: Manuel Mountain Bull, David Bull Mountain
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and door. A couple tents stand to the back right along with a log building. A man, Pretty Coyote, and his children stand infront of the house with a horse.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only, and David Bull Mountain, stepson, and wife.
properties.Location_D: On Pryor Creek, 4 miles above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 30 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa, mixed hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 race horses 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Industry: None
properties.Remarks: When I called at this house in the middle part of the day in the middle part of the summer, I found Pretty Coyote and his stepson, who lives with him, sitting in the house. Pretty Coyote made no pretense of working. He said he had his crops raised by a r

properties.Name: Mike Blue Moccasin
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, a couple windows, a side and front door, and a chimney.
properties.Crop_Desc: 68 A. wheat, 10 A. alfalfa, 15 A. mixed hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, no saddle horses or range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, built with borrowed money. Living elsewhere.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, built with borrowed money. Living elsewhere.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man was interested with his brother in some estates, including sum very good land. Last year, we partitioned this land in order that he might have title to a good place to build himself a home. We got the partition through and loaned him the money f

properties.Name: Small
properties.Linked_Acc: Big Hail, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with door. A tent stands to the left of the cabin. To the right of the house is a few implements, a wagon, and a man, likely Small, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one child. Big Hail and wife, and Campbell Big Hail and wife and children live with him.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, no alfalfa, no wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.Implement_: None at all, but borrows from his neighbors.
properties.Remarks: He admits that he likes to work and considering that he has no implements, he is doing very well. If he can irrigate as much as he claims, he certainly should have more hay. He is using the ground for pasture mostly. He was not at home when I visited his

properties.Name: His Rock Is Medicine
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, two chimneys, and an extension. A fence surrounds the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats, hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 or 4 saddle horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house. Root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow
properties.Remarks: I visited this man's place twice, but did not find him at home. However, I understand that he does usually live at this place. He has a fair cabin. He works a little. He is not very well.Considering his age and health, he does better than some of the abl

properties.Name: Rides a Pretty Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with many trees surrounding it. Three people, likely Rides a Pretty Horse's family, outside the house.
properties.Family_Des: Himsel and wife, and foster child
properties.Health_Com: Good except he is almost blind
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 10 unbroke range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, in a beautiful grove, small stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, in a beautiful grove, small stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, plow, drill, disc, harrow, wagon, rake, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man has a very comfortable home. He takes pride in the way it is furnished and located and he has set out trees that now form a pleasant grove. He lives there all the time and harbors no loafers and star boarders. Neither does he spend much time vis

properties.Name: Greybull
properties.Photo_Desc: Two log structure with a ladder resting on one.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, son-in-law and wife and 2 children
properties.Education_: None. Son-in-law went to Mission School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 16 A. wheat, 4 A. oats, 4 A. alfalfa, 3 . Mixed hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 5 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 cabins, stable, indifferently furnished and kept
properties.House_Comm: 2 cabins, stable, indifferently furnished and kept
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
When I called at this place, Greybull was mowing oats to save what he could before the grasshoppers got them all. They had already cut off all the heads. What should have been a very good crop of oats, will make him a very small crop of hay. 

His son, I

properties.Name: Albert Lincoln
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with laundry in the front hanging to dry. Behind the cabin there is a smaller log shed.
properties.Family_Des: Self, 2 boys and 3 girls. Wife died about a year ago.
properties.Location_D: Small Pox Creek, 4 miles east of Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, Oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, fair barn, corrals.
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, rake, harrow, sulky plow, wagon
properties.Remarks:
Albert is another of the very smart advisors and counselor, and if fluent talk in council or in private, would produce potatoes, he would never go hungry. 

He has some very good dry farm land and usually has a considerable acreage of crop, but he never

properties.Name: Foolish Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with extension. A tent standing in the front with fence posting visible. A man, Foolish Man, and his wife stand out front.
properties.Education_: Short time in old Day School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 4 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, harrow, rake, 2 plows, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or distant creek. Very inconvenient.
properties.Remarks: This farm is not very promising. He can seldom get any water for irrigation. He has no convenient water for domestic use. In winter, none at all, and as to go down near the creek. He probably could do better by irrigating early before the water was in de

properties.Name: Old Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two doors and a chimney. A family, likely Old Whiteman's, stands out front. Some implements are scattered behind the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 5 A. oats, 60 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 50 unbroke range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 mowers, rake, 2 bullrakes, stacker, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This man is not famous as a hard worker and good farm member. He does stay at his own home very well, but hired most of his work done, either by shares of crops, or with money. He had a white family at the place when I was there, putting up his hay. He,

properties.Name: John Lodgepole
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two chimney's, a side door, and small additio. Four men stand to the side of the house with visible fence posting around the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 chuldren, one boy in Rapid City School.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Reservation School and Fort Shaw.
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat, 16 A. oats, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no cattle or range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, stable, granary, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, stable, granary, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: Johnny Lodgepole is a very fair farmer. His wife and he both talk English very well and their house is quite well kept; fairly well furnished for a small house.

properties.Name: Plain Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with window and chimney. A woman stands out infront of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only. Swallow Bird and wife often live with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 5 A. wheat, all the rest of land is rented and is in alfalfa and wheat
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 6 range horses. One race horse.
properties.House_desc: Poor cabin of two rooms, dirt floor, no furniture, decorated with Indian drums and regalia; no stable.
properties.House_Comm: Poor cabin of two rooms, dirt floor, no furniture, decorated with Indian drums and regalia; no stable.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, 2 buckrakes, stacker
properties.Remarks: This man apparently does very little himself. He has a few acres that he pretends to cultivate. I am not sure but what he has someone else to do that. Most of his place is leased. While he is not very well, he should be able to do a little more of his ow

properties.Name: Flat Mouth
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with extension and log shed to the left. A wagon in front of the house and an automobile to the left. A man, Flat Mouth, and his wife and child stand out front.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to reservation school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 14 A. alfalfa, rest in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 4 range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair cabin, new one started. No stable or tool shed.
properties.House_Comm: Fair cabin, new one started. No stable or tool shed.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, rake, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no mower. He needs a mower.
properties.Remarks: His house is just a fair log cabin. They have started another one which is not so much better. The present house is poorly furnished and indifferently kept. Of course, this time of year they stay most of the time out in the tent. There is one claim to re

properties.Name: Henry Dewey Lande
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with building, possibly corral, behind it. A wagon to the left of the house and other implements surrounding it.
properties.Education_: Public schools through about 7th or 8th grade
properties.Crop_Desc: Corn, oats, wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 25 range horses, 10 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small frame house, store room, shed, stable
properties.House_Comm: Small frame house, store room, shed, stable
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, Fordson tractor, automobile
properties.Remarks: Dewey Lande's father was a white man. He was a very good farmer and stockman and kept his large family together and supported them. They did not have much farming land, but gave most of their attention to the cattle. The mother was a member of the tribe,

properties.Name: George Lande
properties.Family_Des: Self and wife. Just recently married.
properties.Crop_Desc: Corn, alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 15 range ponies, 18 cattle.
properties.House_desc: House, shed, corrals
properties.House_Comm: House, shed, corrals
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, harrow, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This boy is a brother of Henry Dewey Lande, on whom report was made. He was reared by a very industrious white father and they made a very good living, mostly with their cattle, and have but a limited amount of land suitable for farming. They have some t

properties.Name: Turns Back Plenty
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tree grove surrounding it. To the left of the house is a clothing line and there is a fence surrounding the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children, 2 in public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 14 A. alfalfa, 7 A. mixed hay. Remainder in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 7 saddle horses, few range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, fairly furnished; poor stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and haying tools
properties.Remarks: Turns Back Plenty is employed by the Government as linerider and has been for some time. He devotes practically all his time to this work, through the summer, and considerable time to it through the winter. He furnished his own horse and provisions while

properties.Name: John Lodgepole
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two chimney's, a side door, and small additio. Four men stand to the side of the house with visible fence posting around the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 chuldren, one boy in Rapid City School.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Reservation School and Fort Shaw.
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat, 16 A. oats, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no cattle or range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, stable, granary, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, stable, granary, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: Johnny Lodgepole is a very fair farmer. His wife and he both talk English very well and their house is quite well kept; fairly well furnished for a small house.

properties.Name: Jacob Woodtick
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with window and chimney. Behind the house stands a large tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children, Victor Singer and family
properties.Location_D: Lost Creek Valley, southwest of Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 6 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 1 saddle horse, 3 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: One small cabin, root cellar, no stable.
properties.House_Comm: One small cabin, root cellar, no stable.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man's farm is under the Lost Creek Ditch. This is a very uncertain water supply, as the water all sinks away before it reaches this land during the season when it is most needed. It probably should not be listed as irrigable land at all, although co

properties.Name: John Gros Ventre
properties.Linked_Acc: Dan Old Bull, Prairie Gros Ventre
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, side door, and a screened in porch addition.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife went to Reservation School and Haskell.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, near St. Ann's Mission
properties.Crop_Desc: 44 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay. Pasture 160 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 6 unbroken range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.House_Comm: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.Implement_: Plows, disc, harrow, mower, rake, stacker, binder, wagons, etc. Very fair equipment. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man we found cutting alfalfa. A very superior crop. He hardly had time to talk to us when we saw him in the field. We visited the house, but his wife was not at home. His place is better equipped and better kept than the average. His old father live

properties.Name: Takes the Gun #3
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front oor. Behind the house stands a tent and a wagon.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Mouth of Beauvais Creek west of Big Horn near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Other good land leased. Mostly alfalfa. Very limited amount of grain.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 4 saddle horses, 50 range horses. 50 cattle . No hogs.
properties.House_desc: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm equipment and hay machinery, wagons, harness, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: River where they live. Spring at their leased home.
properties.Gen_Cond: Poor. Automobile that consumes considerable of their limited means, and the boys spend the rest of their money playing pool.
properties.Remarks: Takes the Gun and his wife Mary were formerly regarded as among the most industrious and progressive Indians. They had a good place across the river somewhat isolated from the other settlements. They had a good house and other buildings, their own irriga

properties.Name: Felix Bear Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: two log structures with two wagons and an arbor out front.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife attended Fort Shaw and reservation.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley near the mouth of Soap Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: 16 A. wheat, 12 A. oats, 15 A. wild hay. The hay made only a fragment of a crop because it was not irrigated in time.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 15 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Cabin and tent near the river, odd the land.
properties.House_Comm: Cabin and tent near the river, odd the land
properties.Implement_: Plow, drill, wagon, only
properties.Remarks:
Felix is using some inherited land belonging to his wife's family. There is no house on it. He lives in a cabin near the river where it is somewhat protected from the storms. 

The land is particularly adapted to wild hay, and he should have had a big cr

properties.Name: Foolish Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with extension. A tent standing in the front with fence posting visible. A man, Foolish Man, and his wife stand out front.
properties.Education_: Short time in old Day School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 4 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, harrow, rake, 2 plows, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or distant creek. Very inconvenient.
properties.Remarks: This farm is not very promising. He can seldom get any water for irrigation. He has no convenient water for domestic use. In winter, none at all, and as to go down near the creek. He probably could do better by irrigating early before the water was in de

properties.Name: Bird Above
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch and fence surrounding the property. To the right of the house there is a windmill and a small shed. Further to the right there is a small tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son married. Son Eric works with them. -- find out in Eric's file that he's married and definitely living with them
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 wheat, 40 acres oats. 10 acres hay land and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. Some saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only
properties.Implement_: plows, mowers, rake wagons. fair outfit
properties.Water_Desc: From the creek or neighbors well. They have a well but not good.
properties.Gen_Cond: Indifferent. They have an old automobile but there is some hope in that respect because it looks like it was past repair.
properties.Remarks: Bird Above has had two grown sons living with him. One of them recently married to a Shosoni girl and is not on the Shoshoni Reservation. They are making a fair start at farming this year, and I feel hopeful that there may be an improvement. They bought

properties.Name: Josh Buffalo
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with door and chimney. A man (Josh Buffalo and child) stand to the front. A ladder rests on the hosue and a clothes line is visible to the building's right.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school and mission school
properties.Location_D: St. Xavier down Big Horn River
properties.Crop_Desc: 11 acres oats. 111 alfalfa. 56 acres pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, range and saddle horses 40. No cattle. 2 pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin on inherited land. Fair frame house on his own land. Fair stable, root house, fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin on inherited land. Fair frame house on his own land. Fair stable, root house, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Fair farm outfit. Has no automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From creek. Well is not good.
properties.Industry: Very good considering his health as he has been rhuematic more or less recently. Say he does not play pool.
properties.Remarks: Josh Buffalo is a very well meaning Indian. He has not been able to work much and has been poor. He has taken these two orphan nephews to care for, but is now receiving some help from their funds. His wife's daughter is a half blood woman she is married

properties.Name: Victor Three Irons
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors and multiple windows. To the left of the house is a large fram barn with another building next to it. Fence posts surround the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: wife and six children. Two in Public School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School by School wagon
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 5 miles below Agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 A. of oats, 23 A. of alfalfa, 20 A. of beets, by tenant.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, no range horses
properties.House_desc: Good frame house and barn, root cellar, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Fair farm outfit.
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or Rriver. Tried for well but failed.
properties.Industry: Fair
properties.Remarks: This man has a very good education, knows very well how to work. He has been acting as an interpreter for the Examiner of Inheritance, so has most of his ground rented. He does a little farming. He has a nice looking house and barn, recently improved by

properties.Name: James Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Large tents and a clothing line, with no houses pictured. To the right of the tents is an automobile and a wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children attending public and mission schools
properties.Education_: Carlisle and Reservation. Wife went to reservation schools.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Mission school and public school
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley near St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 15 range horses, 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nothing. Lives in a tent.
properties.House_Comm: Nothing. Lives in a tent.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm implements. No grain drill, no harrow, 2 wagons, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: This boy was trained to farm in Carlyle school and under the outing system with some German farmers in Pennsylvania. He talks English very well. He knows how work ought to be done, but he lacks the inclination to do it. He has as good a tract of land as

properties.Name: Frank He Does It
properties.Linked_Acc: He Does It, Martin He Does It
properties.Remarks: He lives with his father He Does It. For the past two years he has been teaching? [sic] the Mission Day School for which he receives small pay, but probably all that he earns, perhaps should either get on to his own allotment or get a house of his own an

properties.Name: Round Rock
properties.Location_D: 4 miles south of Hardin in Big Horn Valley.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse, 1 saddle horse.
properties.House_desc: None
properties.House_Comm: None.
properties.Implement_: Plow, cultivator, harness
properties.Remarks: This old man is hardly deserving of a farm report, as he does not farm much. He lives alone except when he visits among his friends and relatively. When we have road work to do or other work for wages, he is one of our best men, considering his age, and

properties.Name: Takes the Gun #3
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front oor. Behind the house stands a tent and a wagon.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Mouth of Beauvais Creek west of Big Horn near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Other good land leased. Mostly alfalfa. Very limited amount of grain.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 4 saddle horses, 50 range horses. 50 cattle . No hogs.
properties.House_desc: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.

properties.Name: Kills
properties.Photo_Desc: Two story frame house with screened porch addition. Log building to the right, an outhouse in the back surrounded with implements like a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; son, Paul, and wife and 2 children
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 2 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. a;fa;fa, 15 A. wild hay, balance is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 range horses, 1 stallion, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good hourse, needs painting; no barn. House has practically no furniture; well kept.
properties.House_Comm: Good hourse, needs painting; no barn. House has practically no furniture; well kept.
properties.Implement_: Fair farming outfit except grain drill
properties.Water_Desc: Well is not good. River water used usually.
properties.Remarks: Kills has this one point of merit: he stays at home. However, he does not work. His boy is a very good worker and does what is done on the place. They have a good deal of inherited land and they are anxious to sell some of the inherited land to get funds

properties.Name: Holeman Ceasley
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chmney, two windows, a side and front door, and an extension off the back. Three adults stand in front and inside the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children, 3 away at school -- we find out later that he has a son that lives with his grandfather and the 4 kids are hers from a previous marriage
properties.Health_Com: Rather poor. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. oats, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 16 range horses, possibly a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Old house now occupied by Cree Indian. No other buildings. Ceasely lives in a tent.
properties.House_Comm: Old house now occupied by Cree Indian. No other buildings. Ceasely lives in a tent.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, 2 buckrakes, stacker
properties.Remarks: These people live on the wife's inherited land where she lives with a former husband. Ceasely has some very good land of his own which is rented, as he is hardly able to cultivate it himself. He has a Cree Indian living in his house doing most of the wor

properties.Name: Knows
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a three seasons porch. A log building is seen to the right of the house. A wagon stand to the right with another in the center. A dog is eating grass. The second photo shows a work team with three men and a hay baler.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, father, widowed daughter and 2 children
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, above St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. voluntary wheat, 140 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, buckracke, stacker, mower, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This family stay on their place regularly. It is a beautiful piece of land. Every acre can be cultivated and irrigated. It is mostly in wild hay, which is usually a very good crop with little expense connected with producing it. It is probably better for

properties.Name: Bird Above
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch and fence surrounding the property. To the right of the house there is a windmill and a small shed. Further to the right there is a small tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son married. Son Eric works with them. -- find out in Eric's file that he's married and definitely living with them
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 wheat, 40 acres oats. 10 acres hay land and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. Some saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only
properties.Implement_: plows, mowers, rake wagons. fair outfit
properties.Water_Desc: From the creek or neighbors well. They have a well but not good.
properties.Gen_Cond: Indifferent. They have an old automobile but there is some hope in that respect because it looks like it was past repair.
properties.Remarks: Bird Above has had two grown sons living with him. One of them recently married to a Shosoni girl and is not on the Shoshoni Reservation. They are making a fair start at farming this year, and I feel hopeful that there may be an improvement. They bought
