properties.Name: Mark Real Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors, two windows, and a chimney. In the back left there is a clothes line. To the back right there is a log  shed and a abuilding under construction- possibly an arbor.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 4 children; father-in-law, Frank Bethune, and wife; Edson Fire Bear, widower, with 2 children, make their home with him.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Mission Day School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School. One child attending.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4 miles above agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, 20 A.; alfalfa, 30 A.; mixed hay, 20 A. Place cut by sloughs.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 unbroken range horses, geese, pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, grain drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Very good considering quality of land.
properties.Remarks: This man is one of the best of the young farmers. He has a very good set of buildings, corrals, fences, etc. Makes very good use of his land. It is not of the best and is out by old channels and sloughs, so that it is difficult to irrigate to advantage.

properties.Name: Frank He Does It
properties.Linked_Acc: He Does It, Martin He Does It
properties.Remarks: He lives with his father He Does It. For the past two years he has been teaching? [sic] the Mission Day School for which he receives small pay, but probably all that he earns, perhaps should either get on to his own allotment or get a house of his own an

properties.Name: Medicine Rock Above
properties.Photo_Desc: There is a frame house and a log house in the photo. In between both houses is a tent. In front of the frame hosue stands a man, likely Medicine Rock Above.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, grown son and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Access to indifferent Mission School. One boy of school age.
properties.Crop_Desc: 70 A. alfalfam 30 A. hay, no wheat or oats, some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 range horses, uncertain number of cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log house used for storeroom, no root cellar, no stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log house used for storeroom, no root cellar, no stable.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit for planting and harvesting, except binder and disc, including wagon and spring wagon. Automobile belonging to some of the family.
properties.Remarks: This man claims to have had about 100 cattle a few years ago, which he kept close about his place. He raised plenty of hay for them, brought them in and fed them when necessary and they have been increasing. He alleges that a former Superintendent advise

properties.Name: Bird Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a three season porch and three people standing in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son, Paul Hill with wife and child, Father-in-Law, Snot in the Hand and a very old man.
properties.School_Des: Indifferent mission school in one of his buildings.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some land leased. Wild grass 10 acres. Alfalfa 70 A. Oats 15.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses. 6 saddle horses, 25 range horses, 25 cows.
properties.House_desc: Good house 4 rooms and large porch well kept. Fair stable, good cabins
properties.House_Comm: Good house 4 rooms and large porch well kept. Fair stable, good cabins
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit of farm implements and hay tools owned in part by Michael Bull Chief. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From creek or ditch. No well.
properties.Industry: Above the average.
properties.Remarks: Bird Horse is regarded as one of the best farmers. His place is in good order and he makes a lot of hay and does considerable farming and has some dry farm land idle. His wife is among the best housekeepers. She has four rooms all in good order and fairl

properties.Name: Robin Iron
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Soap Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: None.
properties.Stock_Desc: 30 horses, 30 cattle
properties.House_desc: Log cabin. Living in frame house on other land.
properties.House_Comm: Log cabin. Living in frame house on other land.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, disc, harrow, buggy
properties.Remarks: Robin Iron has usually worked as a cowboy either with the Reservation cattle or with other cowmen of the locality. He understands the cattle business and is regarded as a very reliable employee in that work; hence, he has not farmed on his own account to

properties.Name: Alvin Morrison
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with large shed to the left of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 8 miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheat; oats, on rented land, 30 A.; 25 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 1 race horse, 14 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor house, poor stable, root cellar, garage.
properties.Implement_: Quite a complete outfit of farming and haying tools, including an automobile
properties.Water_Desc: From the River. Should have a well.
properties.Remarks:
Alvin was not home when I called there, as he was working with his team on the irrigation ditch. He is 1/2 white, has a Patent-in-Fee for his own land, which has either been sold or mortgaged.

He lives on inherited and family land belonging to his wife'

properties.Name: Jacob Big Hair
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 or 5 children. Three in school.
properties.Education_: Attended mission school. Can talk English and read and write some.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public and mission day school
properties.Stock_Desc: about 40 horese on the range. Has no automobile.
properties.Implement_: Very few of his own.
properties.Remarks: Jacob has not used his own place much and I believe may be leased. He has an excellent chance here with his father-in-law if they would work harmoniously. It is a good place, convenient to the main roads, convenient to the irrigation ditch, lays well for

properties.Name: Edward Iron
properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 17 horses
properties.House_desc: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.House_Comm: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.Implement_: 2 wagons, buggy, mower, rake, stacker, sweeprake, plow, sulky plow, binder
properties.Remarks: This man is giving promise of doing very well. His own land seems not to be suitable for farming purposes. He is attempting to use some of his wife's land, which is better located. He is just now building a good house and with a more permanent home, he s

properties.Name: Eric Bird Above
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school and also mission school
properties.Remarks:
Living and works with his father Bird Above on some farm belonging to the family. See report of Bird Above. 

Eric has not been doing much work before this year but he has a lot of ground plowed and some of it planted and is getting his seed for planting

properties.Name: McKinley Backbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition, two windows, two doors, and a chimney. A small portion of another building is seen to the left of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children, father-in-law, wife, and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Lodgegrass Public School, 4 miles. 2 children attending
properties.Crop_Desc: 55 A. weat, 10 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, rake, plow, biner, drill, harrow, disc.
properties.Remarks: McKinley is one of the best Indians on the Reservation in the matter of industry and honesty. He was not at home when I called there but I saw him helping another Indian make hay at some distance. He has inadequate hay land on his own place and helps his

properties.Name: The Arapahoe
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 1 mile south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: None.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 9 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 3-room house, log barn.
properties.House_Comm: 3-room house, log barn
properties.Implement_: Wagon, 23 sets of harness, 2 spring wagons, stacker, buckrake
properties.Remarks: This man should do some farming for himself, but he does not. I am not able to say just how he lives. He probably has some rentals that help and the tribal income that has been distributed has helped. He works well on the road work or other work for wage

properties.Name: Robert Half
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window and door. Two men, one likely Robert Half, stand out front and one is resting on an automobile. To the left of the house is a log building. A wagon and other implements are scattered around the property.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. 17-year old son's health is good.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley at Soap Creek.

properties.House_desc: 2 cabins, poor stable.
properties.House_Comm: 2 cabins, poor stable

properties.Remarks: In addition to his own allotment, he is using some inherited land. He is a very indifferent farmer. He has no wife. Just he and the boy live there alone and at present they are living in a poor old cabin, while a Cree Indian, who is working in the neighb

properties.Name: Mrs. Francis Sucher
properties.Alt_Name: Mrs. Charles Edwards; Mrs. Frank Sucher
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. To the left of the house stands a frame barn and another building. A fence surrounds the perimeter.

properties.House_Comm: Good new house and good barn, root house, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This woman is blind. She is now the wife of Charles Edwards, a white man of rather indifferent merit. They recently got a divorce on her petition. Within a week or two, she went and hunted him up and they married again. She evidently found that he was a

properties.Name: Chester Bad Boy
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension. To the left of the house stands a barn with a fence in the foreground. A person stands in fron of the house and horse is grazing infront of them.
properties.Family_Des: One son and daughter married living away.
properties.Education_: Reservation boarding school 2 months. Soldier 4 years.
properties.School_Des: N/A (I can only assume this is because he has no children with him at home.)
properties.Crop_Desc: Doubtful. Small amount in alfalfa and wheat. Clover and the rest in weeds.
properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse. 2 saddle horses, 13 wild range horses. We have bought him 2 or 3 teams from his own funds the last four years. He has been giving them away to his friends.
properties.House_desc: Good house, barn, chicken house recently built.
properties.House_Comm: Good house, barn, chicken house recently built.
properties.Implement_: Hardly any
properties.Water_Desc: Good well about 100 ft. out down at his own expense.
properties.Gen_Cond: Poor. I think the land was recently leased but he has it ready to go to weeds.
properties.Industry: Unknown to him.
properties.Remarks: Chester is the most willing man to make promises of temperance and industry that I have seen and I actually think he means them when he makes them. He was drunk over half the time and spent considerable of his time under arrest, but I have not know of hi

properties.Name: Clifford Takes Horse
properties.Alt_Name: Cilfford Takes the Horse; Clifford T. Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension. A shed and wagon in the back right behind the house. To the left laundry is hanging to dry.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 5 children. 2 in public school.
properties.Education_: Reservation school and Haskell. Wife in same schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat With Plays on another place alfalfa and timothy about 60 acres, rest in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 head work horses, 6 saddle horses 6 head of cattle
properties.House_desc: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has converted old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has convered old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Has a fair outfit. 2 plows, mower and rake, wagons and spring wagons. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From river. Had a well but it was not good.
properties.Industry: Works very well most of the time. Has new house but it needs painting.
properties.Remarks: Clifford seems to be trying to do fairly well. His land is not well drained and he has been unable to get a stand of alfalfa on it. It is rather hard adobe land difficult to work. He is putting in some winter wheat on dry land, with a friend. His house i

properties.Name: Falls Down Old
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with man, Falls Down Old, standing out front.
properties.School_Des: Public school accessible. Boy attends public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 8 acres wheat. 6 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 10 saddle and range horses
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, poorly kept, poor stable.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, poorly kept, poor stable
properties.Implement_: One riding plow and disc., wagon and buggy
properties.Remarks: On this place there is some good land for dry farming, but only very little of it in cultivation. They are doing but little. The man has no wife and he and his two boys have lived there alone for several years. One of the boys was recently married and is

properties.Name: George Hogan
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Two individuals standing out front and an automobile to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 5 children; mother-in-law; sister-in-law and son; brother-in-law
properties.Education_: Reservation, Haskell, & Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school. 5 children in school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 12 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 100 A. wheat, 1750 bu.; 30 A. oats, no good; 4 A. corn
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, root house, outside toilet, no stable, no implement sheds
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, root house, outside toilet, no stable, no implement sheds
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit for farming and harvesting, including Ford automobile
properties.Remarks: While he has a good little house, it is very indifferently kept. The furniture is meager but of fair quality. The main trouble with this family is that they live on the road most of the time. They have a Ford automobile. They owe everybody in the country

properties.Name: Other Blackbird
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child, and an old man, blind and dependent
properties.House_Comm: Fair cabin, no stable, no root house. Promises to build a root house this year.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, harrow, rake, spring wagon, only
properties.Remarks: Lives at home except in winter, when he must go near the creek for water. Works very wll. He and his wife were both working in the garden when we called at their house. They came in while we were there and when we left, they immediately went back to the

properties.Name: Henry Reed
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tents in the background. A fence post is visable in front of the home.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley on Soap Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 17 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay, no wheat, nor oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 1 race horse, 8 or 10 cattle

properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and log stable.
properties.Implement_: Binder, 2 plows, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon, bob-sled, automobile
properties.Remarks:
House is very good and fairly well kept. It is not large enough for his large family. Two of his girls are at Rapid City School and two attend the Mission School. He had all his hay up and had been working for a neighbor in hay. 

Without any wheat or oa

properties.Name: Bird Wellknown

properties.Education_: He and wife have no education.
properties.School_Des: One mile to Baptist Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 6 miles above St. Xavier.

properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 10 range horses. All seem to be in his corral as there appeared to be about 40 up in the corral.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: plow, harrow, mower, rake, interest in binder, drill
properties.Remarks:
This land is particularly adapted to the native wild hay, but just for want of the industry to irrigate it, he had very little, I think not more than 10 ten. 

His house is a moderate log house, very indifferently furnished and kept. He had his implement

properties.Name: Little Owl
properties.Photo_Desc: Two story frame house with porch. To the left stands a shed and another, smaller building. A fence spans the perimeter.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Mission school.
properties.Health_Com: Good. One son has advanced tuberculosis
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Soap Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 15 range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good 2-story frame house, one of the best; very good stable; toilet, chicken houses, etc.

properties.Implement_: Fordson, plows, harrows, discs, etc. Very complete outfit except a binder. Wagon, no automobile.
properties.Remarks:
We regard Little Owl as one of the best among the Indians. He has a very good frame house as will be seen by the photograph. He has a comfortable stable, a well, out buildings, in fact, his place looks quite like a farm. 

His two boys had been very good

properties.Name: Joe Gun (Shows His Gun)
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with windows and two chimneys. Two men stand and sit in front of the house. Another man is standing in the far back right of the house, barely in the photo.

properties.Remarks: This party says himself that he is a good worker, but the condition of his place and his general attitude do no confirm his admission. He appears to weigh somewhere around 300 lbs. His wife, who was sitting in the shade with him, may be a little heavier.

properties.Name: John Spotted

properties.House_Comm: New frame house and new barn
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon

properties.Name: Eagle Turns
properties.School_Des: Mission school and public school convenient
properties.Crop_Desc: None. 40 A. leased, 40 A. wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 horses
properties.House_desc: Poor log house not on his land
properties.House_Comm: Poor log house not on his land

properties.Remarks: This man is now a policeman and probably put on the force because he had proven that he was not good for anything else. He has a good place, but he does not stay at home and will not work. He did put up a little hay this summer with a neighbor. He has re

properties.Name: Medicine Rock Above

properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, grown son and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Access to indifferent Mission School. One boy of school age.

properties.Name: Robert Half

properties.Name: Fights Wellknown

properties.Remarks: It is reported that he works very well. He was not at home when I called at his place. Said to be out hunting for horses. His wife was in the garden at work. He said that he did not expect to go anywhere for the Fourth of July, except one day, as he want

properties.Name: Kills
properties.Photo_Desc: Two story frame house with screened porch addition. Log building to the right, an outhouse in the back surrounded with implements like a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; son, Paul, and wife and 2 children
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 2 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. a;fa;fa, 15 A. wild hay, balance is pasture.

properties.House_Comm: Good hourse, needs painting; no barn. House has practically no furniture; well kept.
properties.Implement_: Fair farming outfit except grain drill
properties.Water_Desc: Well is not good. River water used usually.
properties.Remarks: Kills has this one point of merit: he stays at home. However, he does not work. His boy is a very good worker and does what is done on the place. They have a good deal of inherited land and they are anxious to sell some of the inherited land to get funds

properties.Name: Holds

properties.Family_Des: Wife. Sees With His Ears and wife live with them.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn River, 3 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 4 A. wheat, 4 A. poor hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 10 saddle and range horses.
properties.House_desc: New frame house, no stable, no root house. Very little furniture. House is well kept.
properties.House_Comm: New frame house, no stable, no root house. Very little furniture. House is well kept.
properties.Implement_: plow, harrow, disk, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man should farm a great deal more than he does. I am at a loss to know how he lives. He has but little land in the valley but it is not used as well as it should be. He has considerable land that could be dry farmed on the bench. Considerable of his

properties.Name: His Rock Is Medicine
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, two chimneys, and an extension. A fence surrounds the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats, hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 or 4 saddle horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house. Root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow

properties.Name: Charles Bell Rock
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with small log building to the back left. To the back right of the house stands a white tent.

properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 4 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and fair stable and root house and chicken house
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and fair stable and root house and chicken house
properties.Implement_: Practically none
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or hauled from the creek
properties.Remarks: Charles Bellrock has been somewhat regularly employed by the Agency as laborer and interpreter about the farm station. He has a good little farm, well located, and easy to irrigate. His son-in-law, Owen Smells, now lives on the place and is cultivating i

properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child, and an old man, blind and dependent

properties.Name: Greybull

properties.Family_Des: Wife, son-in-law and wife and 2 children

properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 5 unbroke range horses, no cattle.

properties.Remarks:
When I called at this place, Greybull was mowing oats to save what he could before the grasshoppers got them all. They had already cut off all the heads. What should have been a very good crop of oats, will make him a very small crop of hay. 

His son, I

properties.Name: Simon Bull Tail
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front door. A few implements are scattered around the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and three children. One married daughter.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to mission school.
properties.Health_Com: Fair, though he wants to be sick to get out of work.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 20 A. mixed hay, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.House_desc: Small log house, very poor shed for stable.

properties.Name: Turns Back Plenty

properties.Name: Bird Far Away

properties.Name: Yellowmule
properties.Photo_Desc: N/A

properties.Name: Stephen Driftwood

properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, granary, stable, root house all in very good condition.

properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from spring. Stock from spring or river.

properties.Name: Arthur Bravo
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house
properties.House_desc: Poor frame house.
properties.House_Comm: Poor frame house
properties.Remarks: I visited this man's place two or three times, but never found him at home. He seldom lives at home. He works a little with Jack Covers Up, a neighbor, and I think Jack feeds him most of the time. He makes very little use of his own land. He, so far, has

properties.Name: George Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Crop_Desc: George is not farming for himself independently. He is working with his brother, Joe Not Afraid, on whom a report has been written. They have some grain and meadow on George's place, but handle it jointly. He probably has not implements of his own.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, never occupied
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, never occupied
properties.Water_Desc: None convenient. Must be brought from neighbor's spring.
properties.Remarks: George is a young man who has not yet established for himself. He lives mostly with his brother and works with him. The fact that he wanted to build a house on his place indicated that he hopes to live there soon. He has no other  building  and he has ve

properties.Photo_Desc: Log house and frame house with wagon out front.
properties.School_Des: One mile from Lodgegrass Public school
properties.Health_Com: Not good. Able to do but little work.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, one mile from Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: Practically none. Land used for pasture. Will not rend it and not able to work it.
properties.House_Comm: Cabin used for store room and fair frame house, poorly kept. Small stable.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, rake, sled
properties.Remarks: This man is quite old and unable to do much farming. He could lease the land to good advantage, and bring him some income, but he has declined to do so. He just lives there on an allowance from his and his wife's funds, derived probably from some land sa

properties.Name: Bright Wings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch attached to the front. Individual In orcking chair sitting out on the porch. Structure to the back left of the home.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 children. One adopted son, grown, who farms with him.
properties.Education_: He and wife had no schooling.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek near St. Ann's Mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 20 unbroken range horses, 25 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house well kept, fair furniture. Good stable extra cabin, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house well kept, fair furniture. Good stable extra cabin, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: plows, harrows, mower, rake, binder, wagons, spring wagon, fair equipment. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man is not able to do a full day's hard work. His adopted son works with him and they take very good care of the farm. Their house is larger than most of them and is quite clean and just moderately furnished. They have a better stable than most of t

properties.Name: Richard Cummins
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three windows, a chimney, and a front door. A work station stands to the right of the house along with a tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 6 children and white son-in-law
properties.Education_: Went to public school and mission school. Wife went to Fort Totten School.
properties.School_Des: Have access to good public school
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 wheat. 10 oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: One work team. 2 saddle horses. 20 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Small house. No stable.
properties.House_Comm: Small house. No stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair equipment including plows, harrow, binder, hay machinery, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: No well. Water from ditch which is an overflow from the railroad water tank. Good water.
properties.Industry: Works very well but has not much to show for it.
properties.Remarks: Has no automobile. He has sold his own allotment for which he received a patent in fee. He will receive some additional land under the distribution now being made. They live on their daughter's allotment which is dry farm land and grazing land. He is on

properties.Name: Bull Weasel
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three individuals standing out front. There is a shed to the right and in the distance there is another structure.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 children, one in Public school and one at Bacon, Oklahoma. (Plus the grandfather lives with him part of the time).
properties.Education_: No education. Wife went to Mission school
properties.Location_D: 1/2 mile north of Lodgegrass on Little Horn River
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheat, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. beets by tenant, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 10 unbroken horses, (range) no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, stable, implement shed, root cellar, outside toilet, chicken house, coal house, good corral
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, stable, implement shed, root cellar, outside toilet, chicken house, coal house, good corral
properties.Implement_: All essential farming and harvesting implements, including wagons, spring wagons, etc.
properties.Industry: Above the average.
properties.Remarks: This man has been regarded as one of the best farmers in his district. He has good buildings, corrals, implements, etc., that would indicate a real interest in farming. His father-in-law, Shell on the Neck, a very old man, lives with him part of the time

properties.Name: Clifford Takes Horse
properties.Alt_Name: Cilfford Takes the Horse; Clifford T. Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension. A shed and wagon in the back right behind the house. To the left laundry is hanging to dry.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 5 children. 2 in public school.
properties.Education_: Reservation school and Haskell. Wife in same schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat With Plays on another place alfalfa and timothy about 60 acres, rest in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 head work horses, 6 saddle horses 6 head of cattle
properties.House_desc: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has converted old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Very good new house, fairly well kept but need some furniture. Has convered old house in to stable needs a new root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Has a fair outfit. 2 plows, mower and rake, wagons and spring wagons. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From river. Had a well but it was not good.
properties.Industry: Works very well most of the time. Has new house but it needs painting.
properties.Remarks: Clifford seems to be trying to do fairly well. His land is not well drained and he has been unable to get a stand of alfalfa on it. It is rather hard adobe land difficult to work. He is putting in some winter wheat on dry land, with a friend. His house i

properties.Name: Eagle
properties.Linked_Acc: Thomas Tobacco, Looks At the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house in the far left of the photo. To the right of the house stand two buildings; a barn to the far right and a frame house in the middle.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children. Of school age.
properties.Education_: None. Wife was in reservation boarding school and Carlisle one year.
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa 18 A. Wheat 10 A. Oats 10 A. balance in hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 teams. About 20 saddle horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.House_Comm: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit of farm and hay tools. Has an interest in binder. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Rather good
properties.Remarks: This house is a very nice new cottage, well painted, very well furnished and very well kept. A good frame barn sufficient to stable 3 or 4 teams and to store some feed. Living with them is Thomas Tobacco a young man who is a very good worker and whos wif

properties.Name: Tie Crooked Arm
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame home with a window, chimney, and screened in porch. Various implements are scattered throughout the yard. Two individuals, likely Tie Crooked Arm and wife, stand by the porch. Behind the house is another building anf fencing.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. 2 single brothers live with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 27 acres alfalfa. 12 A. wheat.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work teams. 10 range and saddle horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old house in indifferent condition. Poor stable and carral, root house out of repair.
properties.House_Comm: Old house in indifferent condition. Poor stable and carral, root house out of repair.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and hay making implements including hay rack, spring wagon. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: Only fair. He and his brother work a little while in the spring, but act as though they might be afraid of doing too much and getting all the work done and be at a loss as to how to pass the time away. Says he plays rummy sometimes, enough to get money e

properties.Name: Onion
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened porch addition, a chimney, and window. A man stands out front with two dogs. Behind the house stands a log building.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 20 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, shed stable, building a root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, shed stable, building a root house
properties.Implement_: 3 plows, 2 wagons, mower, rake, old harrow
properties.Remarks: This is an old man not able to work much. He does what he can and puts up his hay mostly alone. He has not cultivated any crops that amount to anything. His son, who is about 21 years of age, recently married and has been living with his wife's people. W

properties.Name: Other Blackbird
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child, and an old man, blind and dependent
properties.House_Comm: Fair cabin, no stable, no root house. Promises to build a root house this year.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, harrow, rake, spring wagon, only
properties.Remarks: Lives at home except in winter, when he must go near the creek for water. Works very wll. He and his wife were both working in the garden when we called at their house. They came in while we were there and when we left, they immediately went back to the

properties.Name: Joe Stewart
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three seasons porch, two windows, and a chimney. In the back left of the house stands other buildings/structures.
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from farm to Hardin public school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn, 2 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 3-room frame house and log barn.
properties.House_Comm: 3-room frame house and log barn.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, binder, disc, harrow, plow, cultivator, buckrake
properties.Remarks: At present, Joe Stewart is employed at the Agency as an assistant in the engineering department. He is a very good employee when working for someone else. He lives here, which gives his children a good chance to attend public school. His son, Frank, prob

properties.Name: John Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with one window, a chimney, and a covered porch.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 children. One in Public School.
properties.Education_: He went to reservation school. Wife went to mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 100 A. wild hay land, balance in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Very good small frame house, granary, poor stable. Promises to build well house.
properties.House_Comm: Very good small frame house, granary, poor stable. Promises to build well house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, disc, mower, rake, wagons etc. Limited equipment
properties.Remarks: John has a very good place, but he does not live on it regularly. He has relatives in Lodgegrass who seem to insist upon his staying about them to help them with their work. He puts in too much time going back and forth. He raises some crop, his house is

properties.Name: Other Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. Another framed building, likely a shed, to the left of the house. A wagon stands on both sides of the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Reservation school. Son-in-Law went to Reservation School.
properties.School_Des: School wagon to Hardin public school.
properties.Health_Com: Poor, but son-in-law is quite well.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4.5 miles from Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. alfalfa, 6 A. wheat, 5 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle, 25 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good small frame house, log barn, tool shed, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good small frame house, log barn, tool shed, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, mower, rake, drill, buckrake.
properties.Remarks: Other Bull is not much given to work. His wife is a much better worker and his son-in-law, who has now been living with them whose name is Joe Hides, appears to be a rather industrious young man. He has done practically all of the work this past season.

properties.Name: Thomas LaForge
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, and porch extension. There is an outhouse  standing in the back. Two young boys are pictured.
properties.Education_: Fair common school education. Mission reservation boarding schools.
properties.School_Des: Baptist mission convenient. There is a prospect of a public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 45 acres seeded to grain 155 acres to wild grass, 15 acres hay land
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle orses, 60 range  horses. No other stock.
properties.House_desc: Good new house but not quite finished. Cabin, root house, fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house but not quite finished. Cabin, root house, fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair farming and hay making tools.
properties.Water_Desc: Water from irrigation ditch. Should have well.
properties.Industry: Fair. Plays pool occasionally and tried peyote a few times but states he has quit it. Says he plays pool to kill time when he goes to town.Not habitual.
properties.Remarks: Asa has recently built a very good comfortable house from reimbursable funds and some of his own funds. He makes a fair effort to farm. Stays at home mostly and does not spend much time loafing about town or other places. The land is rather refractory. T

properties.Name: Two Leggings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door.  Two men, one likely Two Leggins, stand out front and another individual stands in the door way.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 5  children and an old lady relative
properties.Health_Com: Good for his age, but not able to work much.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Two Leggin Bridge
properties.Crop_Desc: 60 A. wild hay, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old frame house in poor condition; fair stable; root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, plow, riding plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Two leggings is one of the old men, a sort of sub-chief. He is making a very good effort considering his age. He does not do much farming, but he puts up most of his hay by himself with the help of the women and children. His house is very much in need o

properties.Name: Holeman Ceasley
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chmney, two windows, a side and front door, and an extension off the back. Three adults stand in front and inside the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children, 3 away at school -- we find out later that he has a son that lives with his grandfather and the 4 kids are hers from a previous marriage
properties.Health_Com: Rather poor. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. oats, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 16 range horses, possibly a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Old house now occupied by Cree Indian. No other buildings. Ceasely lives in a tent.
properties.House_Comm: Old house now occupied by Cree Indian. No other buildings. Ceasely lives in a tent.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, 2 buckrakes, stacker
properties.Remarks: These people live on the wife's inherited land where she lives with a former husband. Ceasely has some very good land of his own which is rented, as he is hardly able to cultivate it himself. He has a Cree Indian living in his house doing most of the wor

properties.Name: Sam Horn
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window, a chimeny, and a cutout porch. Two indivduals, a woman and girl, stand in the porch.
properties.Education_: Mission School. Wife went to Reservation and Mission School.
properties.Crop_Desc: Farms in partnership with brother, James Blaine. Acreage and equipment is reported on his report.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house.
properties.Implement_: See Jim Blaine report. Owned in partnership. One wagon and buggy.
properties.Remarks: As stated, this man works in partnership with his brother, who is one of the best farmers on the Reservation. Sam works with him and seems to do his part. He has recently built a nice cottage which is well furnished and well kept. The irrigation situatio

properties.Name: James LaForge
properties.Photo_Desc: Two frame houses with connecting porch and chimneys on each. To the front of the buildings stand a man, James LaForge, and a women, wife, with a clothing line to the right.
properties.Education_: Went to reservation school. Wife to mission school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 60 A. alfalfa. 165 wheat  10 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 30 work horses using 3 or 4 teams regularly. About 27 saddle and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Frame house and stable
properties.House_Comm: Frame house and stable.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit of farm, haying and harvesting implements including wagons, binder, etc.
properties.Gen_Cond: Above the average. Looks quite like a farm.
properties.Industry: The 3 boys live with their father and do the work. James seems to be successful in getting his boys to work, though he don't do much himself. They have a Ford automobile, make about 100 tons of hay.
properties.Remarks:
They have some land in the upper part of Lodge Grass Creek which is good pasture and some good dry farm land, but too far to haul grain. This they have rented at this time.  

His son Francis, wife and one child, Tom and his wife and one child, and Willi

properties.Name: Robert Yellowtail
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door. An outhouse stands to the left of the house. There is various implements scattered around the property.
properties.Education_: Was in reservation school and Sherman Institute. Wife reservation school.
properties.School_Des: Children are in public school. Convenient to public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 acres susceptible to irrigation. 35 Acres wheat, 20 Acres oats. Rest land broken and hilly and cut by river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 30 work horses. 15 saddle and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor little temporary house. No barn or stable.
properties.House_Comm: Poor little temporary house. No barn or stable.
properties.Implement_: Claims to have a fair supply of ordinary farm implements, but no binder.
properties.Water_Desc: From Creek. Tried to get well but failed.
properties.Remarks: Very good farmer if he can get somebody else to do the work and he ride around on horseback and boss the job. Robert disposed of his own land and mortgaged his wife's land which is fee patent land, but he still has the use of it. He does not like to put

properties.Name: White Hip
properties.Linked_Acc: Augustine Gray Bull, John a Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: The first picture shows a frame house with an extension. Behind the house is another building, likely a shed. A man is walking towards the camera and to his left there is an automobile. The second picture shows multiple tents with  agroup of individuals
properties.Education_: She went to Reservation School, and Fort Shaw. He had no schooling.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass creek, near St. Ann's Mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa, 40 A.; Mixed hay, 40 A.; 65 A. wheat; oats, 10 A.;
properties.Stock_Desc: 80 work horses, 20 saddle horses, 50 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house of 3 rooms. Old log house used for  granary. Log stable, root house, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit, including wagons, sstacker, spring wagon, etc. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: White Hip was in the field mowing when I called at his house and I could not get across the creek. He is reported to be a very good farmer, remaining at home and attending to his business better than the average. Just now he was living in camp, which is

properties.Name: Bad Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house and frame house with wagon out front.
properties.School_Des: One mile from Lodgegrass Public school
properties.Health_Com: Not good. Able to do but little work.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, one mile from Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: Practically none. Land used for pasture. Will not rend it and not able to work it.
properties.House_Comm: Cabin used for store room and fair frame house, poorly kept. Small stable.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, rake, sled
properties.Remarks: This man is quite old and unable to do much farming. He could lease the land to good advantage, and bring him some income, but he has declined to do so. He just lives there on an allowance from his and his wife's funds, derived probably from some land sa

properties.Name: Onion
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened porch addition, a chimney, and window. A man stands out front with two dogs. Behind the house stands a log building.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 20 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, shed stable, building a root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, shed stable, building a root house
properties.Implement_: 3 plows, 2 wagons, mower, rake, old harrow
properties.Remarks: This is an old man not able to work much. He does what he can and puts up his hay mostly alone. He has not cultivated any crops that amount to anything. His son, who is about 21 years of age, recently married and has been living with his wife's people. W

properties.Name: Yellowtail
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension on its side. Behind the house stands a log building, a pile of hay, and a smaller building.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn River, 3 1/2 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: See the report of his son, Carson Yellow Tail, as they work togther and their equipment is owned and used in common at present.
properties.Remarks: His son is in High School and his daughter is in Public School. His son, Carson, plans to move on to his own allotment near Wyola as soon as possible. He has a crop at present on his own land and also up at that place when I called at their farm. This pl

properties.Name: Ben Spotted Horse
properties.Crop_Desc: Mostly pasture. 20 A. wheat, 9 A. oats, 8 A. alfalfa, some mixed hay and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work orses, 8 saddle horses, 20 unbroken range horses, 10 cattle
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, frame stable indifferently kept.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, frame stable indifferently kept.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, mower, rake, drill, wagon, spring wagon, only moderate equipment
properties.Remarks: It is difficult to report where Ben lives. Most of the time he lives in a spring wagon, going from place to place. He has a very good farm which would make him a good living if he stayed home and tended to it himself. It is generally rented or else he em

properties.Name: Aegidious Gun Shows
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with two doors, a chimney, and garage. A team of horses and two wagons stand to the right of the house.
properties.Education_: He and wife attended Mission school
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. oats, no wheat, 25 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, no saddle horses, 3 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor leg house, one room; no stable; no root house; nothing else. He wants a new house.
properties.House_Comm: He wants a new house
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
This young man has apparently not gotten settled. He has a good place adjoining one of the best farms on the reservation, run by a white man. The example should be beneficial.

He can get water for a good part of his land. It would produce almost any cro

properties.Name: Blake Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with work bench to the front right.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children, one in Mission School
properties.Education_: Reservation boarding school. Wife went to Reservation Boarding School and Mission school.
properties.School_Des: Arranges for children to stay near Mission Day School with grandfather.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 8 A. oats., alfalfa 5 A. Balance is pasture and wild grass along creek.
properties.Stock_Desc: See report of Packs a Hat, with whom he farms and handles the equipment in common. 15 cattle.
properties.House_desc: On his own lnd a good small frame house and granary.
properties.House_Comm: On his own land a good small frame house and granary.
properties.Implement_: See Packs the Hat report.
properties.Remarks: This young man is regarded as one of our best Indian workers and young business men. He attends to business, handles the two farms in conjunction with his foster father. He has a good little house on his own, where he lives part of the time. Well kept an

properties.Name: Ben Gardner
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with small log building in the background
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school and mission school
properties.Location_D: Wife's inherited land in Big Horn Valley, 2 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: Few acres of wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small log house, small stable and root house.
properties.House_Comm: Smal log house, small stable and root house.
properties.Implement_: Disc, plow, drill, binder, mower, wagon, spring wagon, automobile
properties.Remarks: We believe that it would be better to have a well than to support an automobile. Ben Gardner is a mixed blood. He received a Policy Patent. He evidently disposed of the land and bought the Ford and it is not recorded just how he gets the gasoline. He is

properties.Name: Packs the Hat
properties.Photo_Desc: First picture shows a frame house with two chimney's and a window. Two men, one likely Packs the Hat, stand infront of the house. The second picture shows a frame barn, a fence, and another buidling to the right side of the barn.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son with his wife and two children.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. of alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay. Remainder is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 10 saddle horses, 100 unbroken range horses, about 23 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, corrals, cow sheds, granary, wood-house, good fences
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, corrals, cow sheds, granary, wood-house, good fences
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of haying tools.
properties.Remarks: This man lives somewhat to himself. It is not usually profitable for him to raise grain, as it is too far for him to haul it to market. There is always a good market for hay, as it is a favorite feeding locality, adjacent to the range, where there is goo

properties.Name: Ben Pease
properties.Location_D: Adjacent to Lodgegrass and on Rotten Grass Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 65 A. timothy, 10 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 frame hourses, frame barn
properties.House_Comm: 2 frame houses, frame barn
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, 3 buckrakes, stacker, rake, automobile
properties.Remarks: Ben Pease has a place just on the bench near Lodgegrass, which is all under irrigation and could be made to support a family if carefully handled. He also has some excellent hay land, well located for sale to feeders, on Rotten Grass Creek. He has a hous

properties.Name: Dexter Williams
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension.
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school. 2 children attend.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, threshed 175 bu.; 15 A. oats, very poor; 30 tons of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 7 saddle horses, 30 range horses
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log stable, root house, toilet
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log stable, root house, toilet
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, buckrake, 2 plows, harrow disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Dexter is usually working on his own place. He does not camp about very much and makes most of the living for his family. When he threshed his wheat, he exchanged enough for his winter supply of flour and stored it at his home. He is almost entirely deaf

properties.Name: Emory Pease
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension on the back. Fence is visible in the  background.
properties.Crop_Desc: Mixed hay, 80 A.; balance is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 10 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, some 20 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair framed house, carral, shed under construction
properties.House_Comm: Fair framed house, carral, shed under construction
properties.Implement_: Fair haying outfit.
properties.Remarks: This place is located well for producing hay. He usually has about 125 tons, most of which he sells. Being in the midst of the range, it is a favorite feeding place. He had quite a start of cattle recently, but owed too much on them and most them. There

properties.Name: Yellowtail
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension on its side. Behind the house stands a log building, a pile of hay, and a smaller building.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn River, 3 1/2 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: See the report of his son, Carson Yellow Tail, as they work togther and their equipment is owned and used in common at present.
properties.Remarks: His son is in High School and his daughter is in Public School. His son, Carson, plans to move on to his own allotment near Wyola as soon as possible. He has a crop at present on his own land and also up at that place when I called at their farm. This pl

properties.Name: Knows
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a three seasons porch. A log building is seen to the right of the house. A wagon stand to the right with another in the center. A dog is eating grass. The second photo shows a work team with three men and a hay baler.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, father, widowed daughter and 2 children
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, above St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. voluntary wheat, 140 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, buckracke, stacker, mower, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This family stay on their place regularly. It is a beautiful piece of land. Every acre can be cultivated and irrigated. It is mostly in wild hay, which is usually a very good crop with little expense connected with producing it. It is probably better for

properties.Name: Augustine Grey Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Two attend Mission School.
properties.Stock_Desc: This man farms in partnership with White Hip, whose report see. Their crops, stock, and implemments arehandled and owned in common, though they live in separate houses.
properties.House_desc: Good log house.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house
properties.Remarks: Augustine, the brother of White Hip, is reputed to be a very good farmer, attending closely to his business. They have some hay to sell and they have some prospect for a crop of grain. // John Grey Bull is another brother of Augustine Gray Bull, but he d

properties.Name: Bright Wings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch attached to the front. Individual In orcking chair sitting out on the porch. Structure to the back left of the home.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 children. One adopted son, grown, who farms with him.
properties.Education_: He and wife had no schooling.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek near St. Ann's Mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 20 unbroken range horses, 25 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house well kept, fair furniture. Good stable extra cabin, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house well kept, fair furniture. Good stable extra cabin, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: plows, harrows, mower, rake, binder, wagons, spring wagon, fair equipment. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man is not able to do a full day's hard work. His adopted son works with him and they take very good care of the farm. Their house is larger than most of them and is quite clean and just moderately furnished. They have a better stable than most of t

properties.Name: Francis Stewart
properties.Status: Both - wife Fee Patent, him trust
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, o saddle horse, 2 unbroke range horses
properties.House_desc: Frame house in fair condition, log stable.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house in fair condition, log stable
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This young man lives on his mother's allotment and ordinarily in the house with his father. His father, Joe Stewart, is now employed as a laborer at the Agency and Francis pretends to run the place. He has good land under irrigation. It is very much negl

properties.Name: Yellowmule
properties.Photo_Desc: N/A
properties.Location_D: Upper Little Horn Valley 8 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 12 acres oats 17 alfalfa wild hay land about 20 acres. Some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 head work horses. 8 saddle horses, 40 range horses. 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small frame house. Good log house. Fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Plows, harrow, mower, racles buck rake, stacler, disc. Fair outfit. No automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Makes about 60 tons of hay, very good.
properties.Industry: Yellow Mule and his son Levi, who lives and works with him are rather above the average in their farm activity.
properties.Remarks: In answer to the inquiry in reference to irrigation he claims that he is being charged for water maintenance on rather a large part of his land which I verified recently, and by the record. He says that so far he has no ditches that distribute that water

properties.Name: Charles Yarlott
properties.Linked_Acc: Herbert Old Bear, Ned Old Bear
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children at home. One child at Riverside school.
properties.Education_: Went to reservation boarding school a little. Wife attended reservation school.
properties.School_Des: This and oter points were reported in Herbert Old Bear's case as he lives with this family most of the time.
properties.Stock_Desc: He has 4 wor horses, some range horses.
properties.Remarks: In this group there is some very good land and with the three men there should be a great deal more accomplished.

properties.Name: Robert Yellowtail
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door. An outhouse stands to the left of the house. There is various implements scattered around the property.
properties.Education_: Was in reservation school and Sherman Institute. Wife reservation school.
properties.School_Des: Children are in public school. Convenient to public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 acres susceptible to irrigation. 35 Acres wheat, 20 Acres oats. Rest land broken and hilly and cut by river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 30 work horses. 15 saddle and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor little temporary house. No barn or stable.
properties.House_Comm: Poor little temporary house. No barn or stable.
properties.Implement_: Claims to have a fair supply of ordinary farm implements, but no binder.
properties.Water_Desc: From Creek. Tried to get well but failed.
properties.Remarks: Very good farmer if he can get somebody else to do the work and he ride around on horseback and boss the job. Robert disposed of his own land and mortgaged his wife's land which is fee patent land, but he still has the use of it. He does not like to put

properties.Name: Carson Yellow Tail
properties.Education_: Mission school. Wife went to mission school and reservation school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn 3.5 miles above Lodgegrass and also 40 A. at Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 73 A. wheat, 7 A. oats, 40 A. mixed hay, 30 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 7 saddle horses, 30 range horses, 2 race horses, 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, stable, root house, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, stable, root house, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit for farming and harvesting. 2 wagons, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This man is one of the best farmers on the Reservation. He attends to his business and stays at home. At present he lives with his father, who is an old man and they farm together. He has a brother who is in High School, and a younger sister who is in Pu

properties.Name: Yellowmule
properties.Photo_Desc: N/A
properties.Location_D: Upper Little Horn Valley 8 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 12 acres oats 17 alfalfa wild hay land about 20 acres. Some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 head work horses. 8 saddle horses, 40 range horses. 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small frame house. Good log house. Fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Plows, harrow, mower, racles buck rake, stacler, disc. Fair outfit. No automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Makes about 60 tons of hay, very good.
properties.Industry: Yellow Mule and his son Levi, who lives and works with him are rather above the average in their farm activity.
properties.Remarks: In answer to the inquiry in reference to irrigation he claims that he is being charged for water maintenance on rather a large part of his land which I verified recently, and by the record. He says that so far he has no ditches that distribute that water

properties.Name: Knows His Coups
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimney, two windows, and two doors. To the right stands a tent and an automobile. To the left is a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Son in State Asylum. Foster child.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Though he is old and was in bed sick when I visited him.
properties.Location_D: On Little Horn 5 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 80 of mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: One team of work horses. 2 saddle horses. Possibly 20 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Plow and rake. Usually puts up his hay in conjunction with his neighbors and funishes part of the implements.
properties.Water_Desc: From river and from some springs
properties.Gen_Cond: Only fair. He is an old man not able to do full time work. Does very well for his age. He seems to take some pride in the fact that he is running his own place largely with one man who works with him and they live off their to themselves which is much be
properties.Remarks: Ben Looks Back, subject of another report works with him on this place in a spry of joint community affair.

properties.Name: James LaForge
properties.Photo_Desc: Two frame houses with connecting porch and chimneys on each. To the front of the buildings stand a man, James LaForge, and a women, wife, with a clothing line to the right.
properties.Education_: Went to reservation school. Wife to mission school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 60 A. alfalfa. 165 wheat  10 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 30 work horses using 3 or 4 teams regularly. About 27 saddle and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Frame house and stable
properties.House_Comm: Frame house and stable.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit of farm, haying and harvesting implements including wagons, binder, etc.
properties.Gen_Cond: Above the average. Looks quite like a farm.
properties.Industry: The 3 boys live with their father and do the work. James seems to be successful in getting his boys to work, though he don't do much himself. They have a Ford automobile, make about 100 tons of hay.
properties.Remarks:
They have some land in the upper part of Lodge Grass Creek which is good pasture and some good dry farm land, but too far to haul grain. This they have rented at this time.  

His son Francis, wife and one child, Tom and his wife and one child, and Willi

properties.Name: Stephen Driftwood
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension and covered porch. A clothes line is standing in front of the house. Behind the house stands two log buildings and a few implements.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 children. Son in public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 5 A. wheat, 16 A. oats. 35 A. alfalfa. Some pasture. 40 A of his own land leased.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, granary, stable, root house all in very good condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, granary, stable, root house all in very good condition.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit of farm implements including wagon, spring wagon, and all necessary tools for harvesting.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from spring. Stock from spring or river.
properties.Industry: Stephen farms very well generally being at work about his place. He has generally done a little better than average in his farming. His house is fairly well furnished and fairly well kept. They have bedsteads, tables, chairs, and good range, curtains, sh
properties.Remarks: Stephen farms very well generally being at work about his place. He has generally done a little better than average in his farming. His house is fairly well furnished and fairly well kept. They have bedsteads, tables, chairs, and good range, curtains, sh

properties.Name: Thomas LaForge
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, and porch extension. There is an outhouse  standing in the back. Two young boys are pictured.
properties.Education_: Fair common school education. Mission reservation boarding schools.
properties.School_Des: Baptist mission convenient. There is a prospect of a public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 45 acres seeded to grain 155 acres to wild grass, 15 acres hay land
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle orses, 60 range  horses. No other stock.
properties.House_desc: Good new house but not quite finished. Cabin, root house, fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house but not quite finished. Cabin, root house, fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair farming and hay making tools.
properties.Water_Desc: Water from irrigation ditch. Should have well.
properties.Industry: Fair. Plays pool occasionally and tried peyote a few times but states he has quit it. Says he plays pool to kill time when he goes to town.Not habitual.
properties.Remarks: Asa has recently built a very good comfortable house from reimbursable funds and some of his own funds. He makes a fair effort to farm. Stays at home mostly and does not spend much time loafing about town or other places. The land is rather refractory. T

properties.Name: Walter Jack Rabbit
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney, multiple windows, and a porch extention. Two individuals are in coverstation behind the house.
properties.Education_: In reservation school and Haskell. Wife in reservation school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 wheat. 10 oats. Very little  hay but helps others to get hay for his own use.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 2 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house. Fair stable. Fair cabin.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit for general farm work, including wagon, spring wagon. No automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Is very good. He farms fairly well. Says he does not play pool or rummy. His house is quite well furnished and fairly well kept.
properties.Remarks: Little Nest and his wife, old people make their home with him. Hair and his wife, old people live in the cabin at his place. They do not farm separately at all. Little Nest helps Walter with his work and they live somewhat in common. Hail and his wife do

properties.Name: Bad Heart
properties.Photo_Desc: A frame house and a log house used for storage. There is also a wagon.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, north of Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 7 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice frame house, log house now used for store building
properties.House_Comm: Nice frame house, log house now used for store building
properties.Implement_: wagon, 2 plows, harrow, spring wagon, 2 buckrakes, stacker, 2 mowers
properties.Remarks: This man is not really able to farm the land himself. Howard Shane is interested with him in this property and puts in part of the crop and works with him during farming season. It is a good place, conveniently located, and if properly handled, should ma

properties.Name: Pretty Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimney, a window, and door. To the back right of the house stands another rframe building, likely a shed. Fence posts surround the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and wife's son and his wife live with them and assist in the eating.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley adjacent to Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 50 A. Oats 10 A. Very little hay land but work with some f their neighbors in putting up hay on shares. The rest of the land is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses. 30 saddle horses and range horse. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and small frame house. Small stable. Root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and small frame house. Small stable. Root house.
properties.Implement_: Has plow and harrow, rake, plow and binder, mower, wagon. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From ditch from overflow of railroad tank. Good water. Have well indifferent quality.
properties.Remarks: They seldom work when there is an excuse to quit. They attempt to do some farming, but visit too much. They have fenced considerable land and this year should have a very good crop. Say he does not play pool or rummy as a good many of the men do in that

properties.Name: Eli Blackhawk
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with frame barn to the left. Further left stand a canvas tent and wagon.
properties.Education_: Went to reservation school. Wife to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley adjacent to Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 70 A. wheat put in by renter. 60 A. alfalfa, rest in pasture. Considerable family holdings, rented for farming and grazing.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 team work horses. 3 or 4 saddle horses. 20 or 25 range horses. 3 or 4 cattle
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house fairly furnished, stable, poor root house. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house fairly furnished, stable, poor root house. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and hay tools. Has big automobile which seems to be always in running order
properties.Industry: He has a large quanitity of good land, but farms it mostly by proxy, having his crops put in on crop rental and his hay put up on shares, though he does do some work in haying, but not nearly what he should do.
properties.Remarks: His house is fairly well kept, and moderately well furnished. His wife seems quite capable. They put up some 250 tons of hay on the land that he handles and he has rented other land that would make as much or more. The prospect for crops at this time are

properties.Name: William Dust
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a couple windows, a chimney, and a porch.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheatm 5 A. oats, 30 A. hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 6 range horses, 1 race horse, 2 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New frame house and root house. No barn.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, disc, plow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks:
This manâ€™s house is rather remote from any-other Indian place. Usually Indians do not like to live by themselves and the fact that he built this new house several miles from the nearest Indian residence, promises well. 

He has not been living there ve

properties.Name: Sylvester Hardy
properties.Education_: In reservation school at Sherman Institute and in public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 80 wheat 110 alfalfa, 15 wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 35 cattle. 7 head work horses, 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair house and stable, granary, corrals.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house and stable, granary, corrals.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of haying tools, disc, harrow, plow
properties.Water_Desc: From Pass Creek and from spring.
properties.Industry: Works fairly well.
properties.Remarks: They have a Fordson tractor to use in connection with their farm work. Make about 80 tons of hay and generally raises some grain. Just the two men live together. Sylvester is a member of the tribe, and his father is a white man. The son has an Essex, fat

properties.Name: Richard Cummins
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three windows, a chimney, and a front door. A work station stands to the right of the house along with a tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 6 children and white son-in-law
properties.Education_: Went to public school and mission school. Wife went to Fort Totten School.
properties.School_Des: Have access to good public school
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 wheat. 10 oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: One work team. 2 saddle horses. 20 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Small house. No stable.
properties.House_Comm: Small house. No stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair equipment including plows, harrow, binder, hay machinery, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: No well. Water from ditch which is an overflow from the railroad water tank. Good water.
properties.Industry: Works very well but has not much to show for it.
properties.Remarks: Has no automobile. He has sold his own allotment for which he received a patent in fee. He will receive some additional land under the distribution now being made. They live on their daughter's allotment which is dry farm land and grazing land. He is on

properties.Name: Stephen Driftwood
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension and covered porch. A clothes line is standing in front of the house. Behind the house stands two log buildings and a few implements.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 children. Son in public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 5 A. wheat, 16 A. oats. 35 A. alfalfa. Some pasture. 40 A of his own land leased.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, granary, stable, root house all in very good condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, granary, stable, root house all in very good condition.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit of farm implements including wagon, spring wagon, and all necessary tools for harvesting.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from spring. Stock from spring or river.
properties.Industry: Stephen farms very well generally being at work about his place. He has generally done a little better than average in his farming. His house is fairly well furnished and fairly well kept. They have bedsteads, tables, chairs, and good range, curtains, sh
