properties.Name: Aegidious Gun Shows
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with two doors, a chimney, and garage. A team of horses and two wagons stand to the right of the house.
properties.Education_: He and wife attended Mission school
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. oats, no wheat, 25 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, no saddle horses, 3 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor leg house, one room; no stable; no root house; nothing else. He wants a new house.
properties.House_Comm: He wants a new house
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
This young man has apparently not gotten settled. He has a good place adjoining one of the best farms on the reservation, run by a white man. The example should be beneficial.

He can get water for a good part of his land. It would produce almost any cro

properties.Name: Emory Pease
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension on the back. Fence is visible in the  background.
properties.Crop_Desc: Mixed hay, 80 A.; balance is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 10 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, some 20 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair framed house, carral, shed under construction
properties.House_Comm: Fair framed house, carral, shed under construction
properties.Implement_: Fair haying outfit.
properties.Remarks: This place is located well for producing hay. He usually has about 125 tons, most of which he sells. Being in the midst of the range, it is a favorite feeding place. He had quite a start of cattle recently, but owed too much on them and most them. There

properties.Name: Barney One Goose
properties.Photo_Desc: Large frame house with screened porch. A tent on the left side of the photo.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and daughter 2 grandchildren. Son-in-law Peter Runs Plenty Lives with them.
properties.Education_: He was educated in reservation school. His wife in reservation school and Carlisle 5 years.
properties.Location_D: Upper Little Horn Valley near Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat. 7 A. oats. 12A. Alfalfa. 20A. wild hay. Rest in pasture broken by river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work teams. About 5 saddle and range horses.
properties.House_desc: Very frame cottage, good stable, root cellar, fences are in very good condition.
properties.House_Comm: Very frame cottage, good stable, root cellar, fences are in very good condition
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and hay tools. Wagon, spring wagon. No automobiles.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from a brook fed by spring. Has no well.
properties.Industry: Above the average. He usually farms very well and does road work and other labor with his team whenever he has an opportunity.
properties.Remarks: Their house is fairly well furnished and fairly well kept. At the time of this visit they were using a tent as a kitchen and dining room as the weather was pleasant. They sleep in the house and this enables them to keep the house in better order and to h

properties.Name: Joseph Martinez
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and addition. A ladder rests on the house. To the front of the house is a frame building. Behind the  home is another frame building with multiple implements around it.
properties.Status: Fee Pat. Living on inherited land to which he has Pat. in Fee
properties.Education_: Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn, 2 miles below Wyola and also up Lodgegrass Creek.
properties.Acres: He has quite a large area, mostly pasture, very little irrigated. 120 A. cultivated.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 50 A. wild hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 12 work horses, some saddle horses, and probably some range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, stable, storeroom, etc.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, stable, storeroom, etc.
properties.Implement_: Good complete outfit
properties.Remarks: I repeatedly failed to see Joe at home, although he works very well, but it seems to be just a chance that he was always away when I was by his place. Jose is one Patent in Fee Indian who has retained most of his land. I understand it is encumbered, but

properties.Name: Gros Ventre #2
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with small porch addition.
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school at Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, few range horses
properties.House_desc: Very good 2-room house and small frame stable. Limited furniture.
properties.House_Comm: Very good 2-room house and small frame stable. Limited furniture.
properties.Implement_: Apparently very few implements
properties.Remarks: I failed to meet this man so far. I went to or near his house several times and always learned that he was not at home. I went to his house and looked around the place in his absence. I know the man very well. He is no good. Very seldom stays at home. He

properties.Name: Mrs. Francis Sucher
properties.Alt_Name: Mrs. Charles Edwards; Mrs. Frank Sucher
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. To the left of the house stands a frame barn and another building. A fence surrounds the perimeter.
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat; 25 A. oats; small amount of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 1 saddle horse, few range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good new house and good barn, root house, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house and good barn, root house, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This woman is blind. She is now the wife of Charles Edwards, a white man of rather indifferent merit. They recently got a divorce on her petition. Within a week or two, she went and hunted him up and they married again. She evidently found that he was a

properties.Name: Richard Daylight
properties.Photo_Desc: Two frame houses, both with chimneys. Fence posts surround the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 children, brother and sister.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife in reservation school and Hampton.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Vlley adjacent to Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 rented. 40 A. wheat. 6 oats. 5 alfalfa. Rest pasture cut by river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 30 range horses. 35 cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 fair frame house, small stable, fair fences. No root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: 2 fair frame house, small stable, fair fences. No root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of implements. No mower. Wagon and spring wagon. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Only fair. If he should work as well as he talks about work he would be a great farmer. He is living on his wife's allotment which is cut by the river, and is only fair farming land. His own land is located on the Big Horn River and is not being handled
properties.Remarks: Only fair. If he should work as well as he talks about work he would be a great farmer. He is living on his wife's allotment which is cut by the river, and is only fair farming land. His own land is located on the Big Horn River and is not being handled

properties.Name: Whiteman Runs Him
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with door and chimeny. Two individuals, likely Whiteman Runs Him and wife, stand infront of the house. A clothes line and anotherr building are seen to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, and Reuben Spotted, who works with him.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 6 miles above Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, no oats, 6 A. alfalfa, 25 A. hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 20 range horses, 40 cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 log houses, fair log stable.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 mowers, 2 rakes, stacker, bullrake, harrow, disc, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Whiteman Runs Him is an old time Indian. He was one of the scouts with the 7th cavalry at the time of the battle of the Little Big Horn. When there is some dress parade among the Indians, he is fixed up in his Indian garb and might be taken for the remna

properties.Name: Percy Blackhair
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windowd, a chimney, and door. To the back right stands a log shed. Fence posts surround the house.
properties.Family_Des: Himself and wife. No one living with them.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley few miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 acres alfalfa 19 wheat. 16 oats. 20 A. hay land rest is pasture and road right of way river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses. 2 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.House_Comm: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, wagons, fair outfit for his farming and harvesting
properties.Water_Desc: Hauled from river. Stock water from slough. Attempted to get a well but failed after going quite deep.
properties.Industry: He knows how to work very well and does fairly well but could and should do considerably better. His land is not the best being cut by sloughs and with a tendency to become alkalois for want of drainage. They live to themselves without any of their relat

properties.Name: Robert Yellowtail
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door. An outhouse stands to the left of the house. There is various implements scattered around the property.
properties.Education_: Was in reservation school and Sherman Institute. Wife reservation school.
properties.School_Des: Children are in public school. Convenient to public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 acres susceptible to irrigation. 35 Acres wheat, 20 Acres oats. Rest land broken and hilly and cut by river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 30 work horses. 15 saddle and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor little temporary house. No barn or stable.
properties.House_Comm: Poor little temporary house. No barn or stable.
properties.Implement_: Claims to have a fair supply of ordinary farm implements, but no binder.
properties.Water_Desc: From Creek. Tried to get well but failed.
properties.Remarks: Very good farmer if he can get somebody else to do the work and he ride around on horseback and boss the job. Robert disposed of his own land and mortgaged his wife's land which is fee patent land, but he still has the use of it. He does not like to put

properties.Name: Iron Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with porch addition and chimney. To the right of the house stands a teepee.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 40 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 20 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, small stable, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, small stable, root house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man was not at home when I visited his place. He had gone to the mountains to hunt for a few days. His crops were up, however, and his place looked in very good condition. He has a good farm and now has a number of selections for new allotments adjo

properties.Name: Harry Wallace
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 2 children; mother; uncle, Lee Blue Bead
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3 miles above Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa, 30 A.. Native hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 13 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 15 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good house, poor barn
properties.House_Comm: Good house, poor barn
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, wagon, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, harrow, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
The farm is in only fair condition. I was near there on 2 or 3 occasions and they were not at home. The memorandum in this case as prepared by the Farmer, as I failed to find his party on any of my trips.

properties.Name: Matthew Good Luck
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, two windows, and a front door. A family stands out front. There is a clothes line and another building behind the home.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one child. Live alone.
properties.Crop_Desc: 7 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 8 A. alfalfa, 8 A. mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work  horses, 2 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Very good cabin, fairly well furnished and kept.
properties.House_Comm: Very good cabin, fairly well furnished and kept.
properties.Implement_: Mower, wagon, and spring wagon. Is in need of other implements
properties.Remarks: This young man knows very well how to farm. His wife seems to be reasonably competent, but they do not stay at home. He spends too much of his time visiting and camping with other families, away from his place. He has some very good land, easily irrigate

properties.Name: McKinley Backbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition, two windows, two doors, and a chimney. A small portion of another building is seen to the left of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children, father-in-law, wife, and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Lodgegrass Public School, 4 miles. 2 children attending
properties.Crop_Desc: 55 A. weat, 10 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, rake, plow, biner, drill, harrow, disc.
properties.Remarks: McKinley is one of the best Indians on the Reservation in the matter of industry and honesty. He was not at home when I called there but I saw him helping another Indian make hay at some distance. He has inadequate hay land on his own place and helps his

properties.Name: White Arm
properties.Photo_Desc: N/A
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. oats, 75 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 frame houses, frame barn, implement shed, chicken coop, toliet, fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, buckrake, stacker, plow.

properties.Name: James Carpenter
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with large chimney in the middle. To the left there is a tent with the sides pulled up. Three young children are pictured to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children; son-in-law and 2 children; father-in-law and wife
properties.Education_: Mission School. Wife went to Reservation School
properties.School_Des: 3 miles to Lodgegrass public school, 2 children attending

properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. wheat, 30 A. pats, 120 A. mixed hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 14 work horses, 10 saddle horses, 150 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, root house, chicken house, no stable. House indifferently furnished and kept.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, root house, chicken house, no stable. House indifferently furnished and kept.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, buckrae, plow, harrow, disc, binder, wagon, spring wagon. Fair outfit.

properties.Name: Sam Horn
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window, a chimeny, and a cutout porch. Two indivduals, a woman and girl, stand in the porch.
properties.Education_: Mission School. Wife went to Reservation and Mission School.
properties.Crop_Desc: Farms in partnership with brother, James Blaine. Acreage and equipment is reported on his report.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house.
properties.Implement_: See Jim Blaine report. Owned in partnership. One wagon and buggy.
properties.Remarks: As stated, this man works in partnership with his brother, who is one of the best farmers on the Reservation. Sam works with him and seems to do his part. He has recently built a nice cottage which is well furnished and well kept. The irrigation situatio

properties.Name: Three Foretops
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two chimney, a couple windows, and front door. Two individuals, likely Three Foretops and  his wife, stand out front. To the side of the house is a clothing line.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Reservation School.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 1 mile above Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheatm 10 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 7 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 1 race horse, said to be a good one.

properties.Implement_: Drill, 2 plows, mower, rake, harrow, disc, binder, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: The conditions are only fair. They live at home most of the time and have this year some very good crop. He should have enough wheat to support the family for the winter. He says that he is getting too old to work and has to go slow, but he does consider

properties.Name: One Star
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. Two women sit in front of the house with a kitchen pit in front of them. To the right of the house there is a wagon.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley above Lodge Grass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 4 A. oats, 30 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 5 saddle  horses, 15 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.

properties.Name: Eli Blackhawk
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with frame barn to the left. Further left stand a canvas tent and wagon.
properties.Education_: Went to reservation school. Wife to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley adjacent to Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 70 A. wheat put in by renter. 60 A. alfalfa, rest in pasture. Considerable family holdings, rented for farming and grazing.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 team work horses. 3 or 4 saddle horses. 20 or 25 range horses. 3 or 4 cattle
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house fairly furnished, stable, poor root house. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house fairly furnished, stable, poor root house. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and hay tools. Has big automobile which seems to be always in running order
properties.Industry: He has a large quanitity of good land, but farms it mostly by proxy, having his crops put in on crop rental and his hay put up on shares, though he does do some work in haying, but not nearly what he should do.
properties.Remarks: His house is fairly well kept, and moderately well furnished. His wife seems quite capable. They put up some 250 tons of hay on the land that he handles and he has rented other land that would make as much or more. The prospect for crops at this time are

properties.Name: Bad Heart
properties.Photo_Desc: A frame house and a log house used for storage. There is also a wagon.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, north of Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 7 range horses, no cattle.

properties.House_Comm: Nice frame house, log house now used for store building

properties.Name: Thomas LaForge

properties.Education_: Fair common school education. Mission reservation boarding schools.
properties.School_Des: Baptist mission convenient. There is a prospect of a public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 45 acres seeded to grain 155 acres to wild grass, 15 acres hay land
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle orses, 60 range  horses. No other stock.
properties.House_desc: Good new house but not quite finished. Cabin, root house, fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house but not quite finished. Cabin, root house, fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair farming and hay making tools.
properties.Water_Desc: Water from irrigation ditch. Should have well.
properties.Industry: Fair. Plays pool occasionally and tried peyote a few times but states he has quit it. Says he plays pool to kill time when he goes to town.Not habitual.
properties.Remarks: Asa has recently built a very good comfortable house from reimbursable funds and some of his own funds. He makes a fair effort to farm. Stays at home mostly and does not spend much time loafing about town or other places. The land is rather refractory. T

properties.House_desc: Fair house, root house, chicken house, no stable. House indifferently furnished and kept.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, root house, chicken house, no stable. House indifferently furnished and kept.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, buckrae, plow, harrow, disc, binder, wagon, spring wagon. Fair outfit.
properties.Remarks: James Carpenter is a member of the Business Committee is one of the active councilors and advisors of the tribe. His house is very poor and very poorly kept. It is true he has a large family and relatives often stay with him, making it hard to keep the p

properties.Name: Simon Old Crow
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three windows, two chimney, and a door. A family, likely Simon Old Crow's, stands out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children. White Woman and wife live there and part of the time Ben Hillside and wife stay there.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Mission schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 24 A. wheat, 11 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa, 8 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work  horses, 6 saddle horses, 40 unbroke range horses, 2 stallions, 10 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, fair stable, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, fair stable, root house.
properties.Implement_: Stacker, buckrake, 2 mowers, 2 rakes, 2 plows, harrow, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon, drill, binder
properties.Remarks:
Simon is reputed to be one of the best of the young farmers. He has some very good farm land and is making fair use of it. He stays at home, even when some celebration is on. 

I found one room in his house nearly full of wheat, indicating the need of a

properties.Name: Jack Covers Up
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimneys and a porch addition. Two men stand to the left of the house while another man stand by a wagon and horse.
properties.Family_Des: His son Frank and wife, daughter, and brother Two Whistles, an old man
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 7 A. oats, 30 A. alfalfa, 30 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 25 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house only.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house only
properties.Implement_: 2 mower, rake, stacker, buckrake, plow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
The house is very meagerly furnished, but fairly well kept. It shows that the woman is trying to keep the house clean and in order with what she has. They have some very good land under ditch, but some of the land is low and tends to seepage. 

I visited

properties.Name: George Hill
properties.Crop_Desc: Principally wheat and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 2 saddle horses, one pig.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house and barn located on Farm Station land.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house and barn located on Farm Station land.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, plow

properties.Name: Glen Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a couple buildings in the background.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 32 A., 345 Bu
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Very good log house, store house, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Very good log house, store house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Plow, grain drill, harrow, wagon, mower, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Glen is a very well behaved young man. I know of no bad habits or particular disposition to loaf or gamble, but he has not quite settled down to regular farming. He does his work on his little place very well, then lives a good deal of the time with his

properties.Name: George Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Crop_Desc: George is not farming for himself independently. He is working with his brother, Joe Not Afraid, on whom a report has been written. They have some grain and meadow on George's place, but handle it jointly. He probably has not implements of his own.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, never occupied
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, never occupied
properties.Water_Desc: None convenient. Must be brought from neighbor's spring.
properties.Remarks: George is a young man who has not yet established for himself. He lives mostly with his brother and works with him. The fact that he wanted to build a house on his place indicated that he hopes to live there soon. He has no other  building  and he has ve

properties.Name: Richard Cummins
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three windows, a chimney, and a front door. A work station stands to the right of the house along with a tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 6 children and white son-in-law
properties.Education_: Went to public school and mission school. Wife went to Fort Totten School.
properties.School_Des: Have access to good public school
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 wheat. 10 oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: One work team. 2 saddle horses. 20 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Small house. No stable.
properties.House_Comm: Small house. No stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair equipment including plows, harrow, binder, hay machinery, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: No well. Water from ditch which is an overflow from the railroad water tank. Good water.
properties.Industry: Works very well but has not much to show for it.
properties.Remarks: Has no automobile. He has sold his own allotment for which he received a patent in fee. He will receive some additional land under the distribution now being made. They live on their daughter's allotment which is dry farm land and grazing land. He is on

properties.Name: George Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Crop_Desc: George is not farming for himself independently. He is working with his brother, Joe Not Afraid, on whom a report has been written. They have some grain and meadow on George's place, but handle it jointly. He probably has not implements of his own.

properties.House_Comm: Good new house, never occupied

properties.Name: Bright Wings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch attached to the front. Individual In orcking chair sitting out on the porch. Structure to the back left of the home.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 children. One adopted son, grown, who farms with him.
properties.Education_: He and wife had no schooling.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek near St. Ann's Mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 20 unbroken range horses, 25 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house well kept, fair furniture. Good stable extra cabin, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house well kept, fair furniture. Good stable extra cabin, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: plows, harrows, mower, rake, binder, wagons, spring wagon, fair equipment. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man is not able to do a full day's hard work. His adopted son works with him and they take very good care of the farm. Their house is larger than most of them and is quite clean and just moderately furnished. They have a better stable than most of t

properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a couple buildings in the background.

properties.Name: Joe Not Afraid
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with one withdow, a chimney, and an extension. A man, Joe Not Afraid, and woman, wife, stand in from of the house with a dog next to them. To the left of the house is a clothing line.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children; also his father and grandmother -- also his brother George most of the time
properties.School_Des: 2 1/2 miles to Lodgegrass School, 2 children attending
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2.5 miles above Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 65 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 7 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Log house, no stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
These people live on inherited land to which they are part heirs. When we arrived his place, he was at work in the garden and was taking an interest in protecting his potatoes from the potato bugs, which are quite bad.

They live at home very regularly,

properties.Name: Henry Pretty On Top
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extensions.
properties.Education_: Reservation school and Haskell. Wife went to Mission School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 80 A. wheat, 15 A. oats, 12 A. alfalfa, 30 A. hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 16 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, used for storeroom; fair frame house. No stable.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, used for storeroom; fair frame house. No stable.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit for farming and harvesting.
properties.Remarks: Henry was not at home when we visited his place. He had gone to another district to get a cow that he has traded for. I later saw him on the road and noticed that he had acquired a very good Holstein cow, which should be very valuable to him in producing

properties.Name: Plain Face
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, a couple windows, and a chimney. In the back left stands a tent. Infront of the house stands a family, likely Plain Face's. To the right of the house is an automobile and a few horses.
properties.Family_Des: Daughter-in-law a widow, adopted daughter and her husabnd, and other relatives.
properties.Education_: Adopted daughter and husband, 5th grade local schools
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 35 A. Oats 15 A. Hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 9 work horses, no saddle horsesl few range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good. New house. Poor stable and corral, store room, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good. New house. Poor stable and corral, store room, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, drill, mower, rake, wagon, 3 sets of double harness
properties.Gen_Cond: Better than the average. Interior of house quite well kept.
properties.Industry: See remarks.
properties.Remarks: This place belongs to a very old woman who is a widow. Her son Does Everything formerly worked the place and was one of the best Indians, his wife probably the best housekeeper in that district. He died some 2 years ago, since this time the place has bee

properties.Name: Dexter Williams
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension.
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school. 2 children attend.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, threshed 175 bu.; 15 A. oats, very poor; 30 tons of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 7 saddle horses, 30 range horses
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log stable, root house, toilet
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log stable, root house, toilet
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, buckrake, 2 plows, harrow disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Dexter is usually working on his own place. He does not camp about very much and makes most of the living for his family. When he threshed his wheat, he exchanged enough for his winter supply of flour and stored it at his home. He is almost entirely deaf

properties.Name: Thomas Stewart #1
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame hoouse with multiple windows, a side door, and chiimney. There is a barn to be back left of the house and a clothing line infront of it. A wagon is parked infront of the house.
properties.Education_: Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. what, 28 A. oats, 17 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, no saddle horses, 5 range horses, 8 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, stable, root house, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, stable, root house, chicken house
properties.Implement_: binder, plow, mower, disc, drill, rake, buckrake, stacker, harrow, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These people live at home very well. They do not have many people about them regularly. The house is moderately well furnished, rather indifferently kept. They are leaders in the peyote religion, and especially the woman, who became quite earnest in her

properties.Name: Clifford White Shirt
properties.Family_Des: Wife, daughter, son and wife, and one child.
properties.Education_: None. Son went to Reservation School.
properties.Health_Com: Health broken by use of peyote
properties.Crop_Desc: 36 A. wheat, 22 A. oats, 25 A. native hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 4 range horses
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, plow, disc, rake, riding plow
properties.Remarks: Clifford White Shirt has a very good place, with enough under irrigation to make them an independent living. His son and wife live with them. They have not done well with their farming. The last 2 or 3 years they have devoted a large part of their time t

properties.Name: Walks Over Ice
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with chimney, three windows, and a front door. Six individuals, the four sitting in front of  the house likely Walks Over Ice's family, stand out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children, father-in-law, Along the Hillside, lives with him. He is an old man.
properties.Education_: Attended Mission Boarding School. Wife had no school-ing.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Lodgegrass Public School. One child attending Bacon, Oklaoma.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn River, one mile below Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 55 A. wheat, 25 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work  horses, 8 saddle horses, 20 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, root house, stable. Plans to build new house presently.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, bullrake, stacker, cultivator, drill. Fair outfit. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Very good worker. Does not play pool or use peyote.
properties.Remarks: We found this man and his wife both working in the garden, hoeing and weeding. He has a good sized garden with a good variety of stuff planted. They had arranged for a loan to build them a new house, but the funds were exhausted before the purchases were

properties.Name: Bear Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a porch.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, Addie Blanket Bull, step-daughter and three children
properties.Education_: No education. Wife went to reservation boarding school for a time.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 acres alfalfa, 20 acres wheat, 10 a oats, 20 wild hay. Some pasture and dry farm lands
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses. 13 saddle and range horses
properties.House_desc: Fair house indifferently kept. Fair stable, root house. Fence poor. Shows appearance of neglect.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house indifferently kept. Fair stable, root house. Fence poor. Shows appearance of neglect.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit of implements, including spring wagon, hay tools, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: From river. Had well, but water unfit for use.
properties.Gen_Cond: Rather run down and neglected. Place was leased until recently.
properties.Industry: Only fair.
properties.Remarks: He stays at home most of the time and farms fairly well, but does not see the jobs in the way of cleaning his ditches, repairing fences as he should. He has an automobile, fairly new and manages to raise the money to buy gasoline but reports he is very s

properties.Name: Walks Over Ice
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with chimney, three windows, and a front door. Six individuals, the four sitting in front of  the house likely Walks Over Ice's family, stand out front.

properties.Name: Hartford Blackeagle
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Education_: Self and wife went to Reservation Schools
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2.5 miles below Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. weat, 8 A. mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 3 range horses,  1 race horse.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, fairly furnished and kept. No other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, fairly furnished and kept. No other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, buckrake, wagon, buggy, no automobile
properties.Remarks: Hartford lives on some inherited land that belongs to members of his family. It is a very fair farm and probably better suited to his farm activities than his own allotment, except that he is not justified in expending his own money time [sic] in making

properties.Name: Door
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch on the back.
properties.Education_: None. Wife spent short time in reservation and mission school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 acres alfalfa. 37 acres wheat. Puts in some oats, the rest in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Good house moderately furnished. Root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good house moderately furnished. Root house.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of implements including, hay tools spring wagon and binder
properties.Water_Desc: Get water from very good well
properties.Industry: Is above average. Makes about 80 tons of hay. Has no automobile. Does not use peyote or engage in any gambling games.
properties.Remarks: Door is a sort of sub-chief, and sets a very good example to his people. He is usually at work. Could keep his farm in better condition but he does very well considering he is farming right on the very ground where the battle of the Sioux took place only

properties.Name: Ned Old Bear
properties.Alt_Name: Young Old Bear; Edward Old Bear
properties.Education_: Went to reservation boarding school for a short time.
properties.School_Des: Public school. Prospect of new school house nearby.
properties.Gen_Cond: See the report of Herbert Old Bear.
properties.Remarks: He has an automobile but evidently it is out of commission and is not consuming any gas. Ned's wife is receiving a pension of some $50.00 a month because of a relative's death in the recent war. This of course prevents very much farming as $50.00 a month

properties.Name: Hartford Comes From Above
properties.Photo_Desc: Stone house with buildings behind the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. mixed hay, rest in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good stone house, no stable
properties.House_Comm: Good stone house, no stable
properties.Implement_: Harrow, disc, plow, mower, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile. Wore out one and learned that he couldn't afford it.
properties.Remarks: Hartford received his Patent in Fee some 3 years ago. He borrowed money and bought cattle, which appeared to be a very good business deal at the time. He confronted an expensive winter and failed to make proper provision for his cattle and lost some of t

properties.Name: Bull Weasel
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three individuals standing out front. There is a shed to the right and in the distance there is another structure.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 children, one in Public school and one at Bacon, Oklahoma. (Plus the grandfather lives with him part of the time).
properties.Education_: No education. Wife went to Mission school
properties.Location_D: 1/2 mile north of Lodgegrass on Little Horn River
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheat, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. beets by tenant, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 10 unbroken horses, (range) no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, stable, implement shed, root cellar, outside toilet, chicken house, coal house, good corral
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, stable, implement shed, root cellar, outside toilet, chicken house, coal house, good corral
properties.Implement_: All essential farming and harvesting implements, including wagons, spring wagons, etc.
properties.Industry: Above the average.
properties.Remarks: This man has been regarded as one of the best farmers in his district. He has good buildings, corrals, implements, etc., that would indicate a real interest in farming. His father-in-law, Shell on the Neck, a very old man, lives with him part of the time

properties.Name: Bread
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with an extension. A wooden fence behind the house to the left. Fence posts around the home with three individuals standing out front.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 12 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 3 range horses, 1 race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, old cabins and sheds, fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, old cabins and shed, fair stable.
properties.Implement_: mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These are just 2 old people with one small foster child, about 5 years old. They live alone, they stay at their own place, and they do not entertain sundry relatives. While their house was one large room, it was neat and clean. It was really better than

properties.Name: Hartford Blackeagle
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition.
properties.Education_: Self and wife went to Reservation Schools
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2.5 miles below Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. weat, 8 A. mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 3 range horses,  1 race horse.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, fairly furnished and kept. No other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, fairly furnished and kept. No other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, buckrake, wagon, buggy, no automobile
properties.Remarks: Hartford lives on some inherited land that belongs to members of his family. It is a very fair farm and probably better suited to his farm activities than his own allotment, except that he is not justified in expending his own money time [sic] in making

properties.Name: Charles Yarlott
properties.Linked_Acc: Herbert Old Bear, Ned Old Bear
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children at home. One child at Riverside school.
properties.Education_: Went to reservation boarding school a little. Wife attended reservation school.
properties.School_Des: This and oter points were reported in Herbert Old Bear's case as he lives with this family most of the time.
properties.Stock_Desc: He has 4 wor horses, some range horses.
properties.Remarks: In this group there is some very good land and with the three men there should be a great deal more accomplished.

properties.Name: The Arapahoe
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 1 mile south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: None.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 9 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 3-room house, log barn.
properties.House_Comm: 3-room house, log barn
properties.Implement_: Wagon, 23 sets of harness, 2 spring wagons, stacker, buckrake
properties.Remarks: This man should do some farming for himself, but he does not. I am not able to say just how he lives. He probably has some rentals that help and the tribal income that has been distributed has helped. He works well on the road work or other work for wage

properties.Name: Falls Down Old
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with man, Falls Down Old, standing out front.
properties.School_Des: Public school accessible. Boy attends public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 8 acres wheat. 6 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 10 saddle and range horses
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, poorly kept, poor stable.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, poorly kept, poor stable
properties.Implement_: One riding plow and disc., wagon and buggy
properties.Remarks: On this place there is some good land for dry farming, but only very little of it in cultivation. They are doing but little. The man has no wife and he and his two boys have lived there alone for several years. One of the boys was recently married and is

properties.Name: Henry Shinbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a family, Henry Shinbone's, and a wagon out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 step children, both married and living separately mostly. Mother-in-law an old woman lives with them.
properties.Education_: Reservation school 8 years. Carlisle 5 years. Wife one year in Mission.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, near mouth of Reno Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: wheat 25 A. Oats 35 A. Hopes to increase acreage this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses. 15 range horses. One yearling heifer
properties.House_desc: Very good log house, large rooms. Poor stable. Fence, fair.
properties.House_Comm: Very good log house, large rooms. Poor stable. Fence, fair.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, mower, rake, sweep rake, grain drill, 2 wagons, buggy, 3 sets double harness
properties.Industry: Farms quite well. Considerable room for improvement.
properties.Remarks: This man lives on the allotment of his married daughter, where there is a good house, and there is more land to cultivate than on his own allotment. While he lives alone largely he does work in partnership with is son-in-law so that it is quite difficult

properties.Name: Herbert Old Bear
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house.
properties.School_Des: Public school with prospect of new school nearby
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley 9 miles above agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 acres hay land, 70 acres wheat, 10 or 12 acres in oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses and 4 saddle horses
properties.House_desc: One rather indifferent frame house of one room. Live in tents mostly.
properties.House_Comm: One rather indifferent frame house of one room. Live in tents mostly.
properties.Implement_: Together with brother and brother-in-law, they have a fair outfit of implements, plows, mower, harrow, wagon, buckrake, spring wagon, etc.
properties.Remarks: They cannot see the work that is to be done in the way of improvement and are disposed to never clean a ditch or repair fences or buildings until it is actually necessary. They put up some 20 ton of hay, generally have some grain to thresh. At this same

properties.Name: Bull Weasel
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three individuals standing out front. There is a shed to the right and in the distance there is another structure.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 children, one in Public school and one at Bacon, Oklahoma. (Plus the grandfather lives with him part of the time).
properties.Education_: No education. Wife went to Mission school
properties.Location_D: 1/2 mile north of Lodgegrass on Little Horn River
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheat, 10 A. alfalfa, 10 A. beets by tenant, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 10 unbroken horses, (range) no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, stable, implement shed, root cellar, outside toilet, chicken house, coal house, good corral
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, stable, implement shed, root cellar, outside toilet, chicken house, coal house, good corral
properties.Implement_: All essential farming and harvesting implements, including wagons, spring wagons, etc.
properties.Industry: Above the average.
properties.Remarks: This man has been regarded as one of the best farmers in his district. He has good buildings, corrals, implements, etc., that would indicate a real interest in farming. His father-in-law, Shell on the Neck, a very old man, lives with him part of the time

properties.Name: Deer Nose
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Three individuals standing outside of the porch.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 8 children, from infant up to 24 years old.
properties.Health_Com: Daughter 24 deaf and dumb, otherwise good health
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley near mouth of Reno Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: Winter wheat 20 A. Spring weat 20 A. Oats 20 A Alfalfa 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: Horses, 6 work, 5 saddle, 10 range, 4 pigs, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Very good house, good cellar, fair stable, shed and corral. Fence good.
properties.House_Comm: Very good house, good cellar, fair stable, shed and corral. Fence good.
properties.Implement_: 2 riding plows, one walking plow, harrow, mower, binder, rake, disc. In need of a drill.
properties.Gen_Cond: Very good. Fences are well kept up, house is fairly kept. Good corral and general appearance of thrft.
properties.Industry: Father and son both farm, women help with garden. Above the average.
properties.Remarks: Deer Nose is one of the best Indians on the reservation. He attends to his own business. Always has considerable crop. Keeps his home and grounds in fair condition. Active in church work. Just when I was there he had gone visiting a neighbor who was a cr

properties.Name: Plays
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, two windows, and a chimney. To the back left stands a tent.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 15 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat; threshed about 500 bu. Of wheat; some oats, poor; 10 A. hay. Partly rented land with others.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, well kept; small stable; root house
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, binder, disc, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Plays does very well in farming. He probably visits too much, as I was at his place 2 or 3 times and did not find him at home. However, he does considerable farming and is not among the worst, industrially, by considerable. 

His little girl attend publi

properties.Name: Elmer Takes Wrinkle
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife also went to reservation school
properties.Location_D: Home on wife's land, 3 miles above Agency on Little Horn.
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 A. alfalfa, 120 A. wild hay, rest in pasture. Raising grain in partnership with Howard Shane in another locality.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horese, 5 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, old barn to be torn down and rebuilt
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, old barn to be torn down and rebuilt
properties.Implement_: Rake, hay-rake, wagon, spring wagon. Rather inadequate equipment.
properties.Remarks: Elmer secured a Patent Fee for his own allotment. He immediately sold it and went into partnership with another Fee Patent Indian to build and operate a garage at Crow Agency. It was not long before their money had completely disappeared. He is now livin

properties.Name: George Hogan
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Two individuals standing out front and an automobile to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 5 children; mother-in-law; sister-in-law and son; brother-in-law
properties.Education_: Reservation, Haskell, & Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school. 5 children in school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 12 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 100 A. wheat, 1750 bu.; 30 A. oats, no good; 4 A. corn
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, root house, outside toilet, no stable, no implement sheds
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, root house, outside toilet, no stable, no implement sheds
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit for farming and harvesting, including Ford automobile
properties.Remarks: While he has a good little house, it is very indifferently kept. The furniture is meager but of fair quality. The main trouble with this family is that they live on the road most of the time. They have a Ford automobile. They owe everybody in the country

properties.Name: James Big Shoulder
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife attended Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A, wheat, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 7 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 15 range horses, one race house, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, log stable, cellar and storeroom
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, log stable, cellar and storeroom
properties.Implement_: Disc, plow, mower, stacker, wagon
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch and well. Pump broken at present, but the well is fair.
properties.Remarks: This young man does considerable farming. He has some land of his own and some of his mother's land. He also has worked with a relative on his farm. He has some land suitable for dry farming which has not been farmed. Part of his land is suitable only fo

properties.Name: Austin Lion Shows
properties.Education_: Mission School. Wife went to Fort Shaw and Public School.
properties.School_Des: Son at Rapid City. Others in Public Schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 4 saddle horses, no range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small, indifferent cabin, not used, on inherited land.
properties.House_Comm: Small, indifferent cabin, not used, on inherited land
properties.Implement_: One plow only
properties.Remarks: Austin has not been attempting to farm for several years past. He and his wife separated for a time and he went out and worked for wages, a good part of the time at the Agency. He is a very good worker when working under a boss. It is doubtful whether he

properties.Name: William Bends
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, and a porch extension. To the right of the house there is a building under construction.
properties.Family_Des: wife, 4 children, and his mother. Children in public school.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife went to Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 2 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. alfalfa, 15 A. mixed hay, pasture on some inherited allotments not included in farm.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, no range horses, 26 cattle, 2 pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, no stable, but plans to build one. Root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, buckrake, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile.
properties.Remarks: The new house is only moderately furnished. It is fairly well kept. He has just built a root cellar and we believe before winter will build a stable. He had his hay in the stack, which was ahead of most Indians of his locality. One 30-acre tract of alfal

properties.Name: Max Big Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a chimney, window, and porch extensions. A man stands to the side of the house and other implements can be seen behind him.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children, and mother-in-law Yellow All Over.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Haskell 3 months. Wife in Mission School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. oats, 13 A. alfalfa. 6 A. wild hay Rest pasture land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 teams of work horses. 7 saddle and range horses. 2 or 3 cattle.
properties.House_desc: A little frame house. New barn under construction, root cellar and carral.
properties.House_Comm: A little frame house. New barn under construction, root cellar and carral.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, mower, biner, disc, limited outfit
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from well said to be very good.
properties.Industry: Good. Fair worker but could do more on his farm. Have automobile consuming gas the cost of which should probably be used for buying food. Has good string of relay race horses but does not gamble otherwise.
properties.Remarks: His irrigated land is of not much value it is stubborn land to work. His dry farm land is only of moderate value. He has 40 acres down the Little Horn River 10 miles below the agency which is very good irrigated land, but is rented this year. It is reall

properties.Name: Plain Face
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, a couple windows, and a chimney. In the back left stands a tent. Infront of the house stands a family, likely Plain Face's. To the right of the house is an automobile and a few horses.
properties.Family_Des: Daughter-in-law a widow, adopted daughter and her husabnd, and other relatives.
properties.Education_: Adopted daughter and husband, 5th grade local schools
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 35 A. Oats 15 A. Hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 9 work horses, no saddle horsesl few range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good. New house. Poor stable and corral, store room, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good. New house. Poor stable and corral, store room, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, drill, mower, rake, wagon, 3 sets of double harness
properties.Gen_Cond: Better than the average. Interior of house quite well kept.
properties.Industry: See remarks.
properties.Remarks: This place belongs to a very old woman who is a widow. Her son Does Everything formerly worked the place and was one of the best Indians, his wife probably the best housekeeper in that district. He died some 2 years ago, since this time the place has bee

properties.Name: Other Medicine
properties.House_Comm: Living in Buildings put on by Sugar Company lease. Good house and barn,. Small cabin, and root house, fair fences
properties.Implement_: Plows, harrow, mower, rake, stacker, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon, fair outfit, Has no automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water at well extra good. At his own cabin ditch water.
properties.Remarks: Other Medicine has been on the police force for a number of years, recently quite. He has a son who works with him and they farm quite well. His house is moderately furnished and moderately well kept for an old Indian. They have sewing machine, bedsteads

properties.Name: Stops
properties.Photo_Desc: This house is half a frame house and half a log house. Behind the house is a clothing line and another frame building. A man, likely Stops, stands out front and two children are in the doorway.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, two sons, grown daughter married, daughter 13.
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa 50 A. wheat 40 A. Oats 15 A. Plan more this year, also plan more alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 9 work horses, 8 range horses, no cattle or other stock.
properties.House_desc: House is old, no stable, started to rebuild one. Root house.
properties.House_Comm: House is old, no stable, started to rebuild one. Root house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, 2 wagons, spring wagon, harness for 4 teams
properties.Water_Desc: Spring and river. Needs a well.
properties.Industry: Fair
properties.Remarks: In this family is a father, usually able-bodied, just now crippled temporarily, 2 grown sons, one of them married. They have some very excellent river bottom land under irrigation, also some good land on the first bench. They have no stable for their hor

properties.Name: Peter Paul
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house that is elevated with crawl space. A man, likely Peter Paul, stands out front. There is also an outhouse behind the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: about 40 acres wheat, 15 acres oats. Alfalfa 10 acres, rest pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 range horses and saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Good new frame house, cellar under it, Fair stable. House is fairly well furnished and kept.
properties.House_Comm: Good new frame house, cellar under it, Fair stable. House is fairly well furnished and kept.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, cultivator, wagons. Has automobile that runs sometimes.
properties.Water_Desc: From a well and from the river
properties.Industry: Quite good. This man's real name is Charles Strong but known locally as Peter Paul. He is rather a bright young man. Knows very well how to work, has a very good house, and his wife is quite capable. Their little girl about 10 years old is very bright, h
properties.Remarks: Quite good. This man's real name is Charles Strong but known locally as Peter Paul. He is rather a bright young man. Knows very well how to work, has a very good house, and his wife is quite capable. Their little girl about 10 years old is very bright, h

properties.Name: William Dust
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a couple windows, a chimney, and a porch.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheatm 5 A. oats, 30 A. hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 6 range horses, 1 race horse, 2 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New frame house and root house. No barn.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, disc, plow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks:
This manâ€™s house is rather remote from any-other Indian place. Usually Indians do not like to live by themselves and the fact that he built this new house several miles from the nearest Indian residence, promises well. 

He has not been living there ve

properties.Name: Mark Real Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors, two windows, and a chimney. In the back left there is a clothes line. To the back right there is a log  shed and a abuilding under construction- possibly an arbor.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 4 children; father-in-law, Frank Bethune, and wife; Edson Fire Bear, widower, with 2 children, make their home with him.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Mission Day School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School. One child attending.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4 miles above agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, 20 A.; alfalfa, 30 A.; mixed hay, 20 A. Place cut by sloughs.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 unbroken range horses, geese, pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, grain drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Very good considering quality of land.
properties.Remarks: This man is one of the best of the young farmers. He has a very good set of buildings, corrals, fences, etc. Makes very good use of his land. It is not of the best and is out by old channels and sloughs, so that it is difficult to irrigate to advantage.

properties.Name: Edward Big Medicine
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. alfalfa, 42 wheat, 20 A. wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses
properties.House_desc: Good 3-room log haouse, fair log stable, chicken house, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Good 3-room log haouse, fair log stable, chicken house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, mower, rake, spring wagon, wagon
properties.Remarks: This boy lives with his father, Big Medicine, who has been Chief of Police at the Agency for many years. His home seems to be a sort of stopping place and harbor for everybody who comes this way, and they feed a great many visitors, as is always the case

properties.Name: Mary Humphrey
properties.Photo_Desc: Multiple buildings shown in the photo.There are two log buildings, the one to the left most likely the house with a porch addition. Two frame buildings are alos pictured to the  right of the house. A fence surrounds the perimeter and some other implement
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Half-way House.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 70 A. alfalfa, 80 A. rented hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 10 range horses, 56 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Indifferent frame house, stable, storeroom, granary, all cheap frame construction.
properties.House_Comm: Indifferent frame house, stable, storeroom, granary, all cheap frame construction.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farming and haying implements.
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch. No well. Sometimes has to be hauled from river, 3 miles away.
properties.Remarks: This family should hardly be reported as among Indian families. Mr. Humphrey is a white man; Mrs. Humphrey had a white father. Her children are whiter than the average white child. They farm considerably and are now trying to get a start in cattle. They

properties.Name: Ned Old Bear
properties.Alt_Name: Young Old Bear; Edward Old Bear
properties.Education_: Went to reservation boarding school for a short time.
properties.School_Des: Public school. Prospect of new school house nearby.
properties.Gen_Cond: See the report of Herbert Old Bear.
properties.Remarks: He has an automobile but evidently it is out of commission and is not consuming any gas. Ned's wife is receiving a pension of some $50.00 a month because of a relative's death in the recent war. This of course prevents very much farming as $50.00 a month

properties.Name: Jack Stewart #1
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with chimney and porch addition. To the right of the house stands another structure.
properties.Crop_Desc: 16 A. wheat, 16 A. oats, rest in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 4 saddle horses, few range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, fairly helpt and a fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, fairly kept and a fair stable
properties.Implement_: Plows, harrow, disc. Has no haying tools or binder. Wagon, spring wagon, and automobile for sale.
properties.Remarks: Jack has not been famous for farm work. He had a Patent in Fee to his own land and disposed of it and soon used up the money. He now seems to realize that if he is going to eat, he will have to work some, and I found him helping make hay several miles fr

properties.Family_Des: Wife, Addie Blanket Bull, step-daughter and three children
properties.Education_: No education. Wife went to reservation boarding school for a time.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 acres alfalfa, 20 acres wheat, 10 a oats, 20 wild hay. Some pasture and dry farm lands
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses. 13 saddle and range horses
properties.House_desc: Fair house indifferently kept. Fair stable, root house. Fence poor. Shows appearance of neglect.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house indifferently kept. Fair stable, root house. Fence poor. Shows appearance of neglect.
properties.Implement_: Fairly complete outfit of implements, including spring wagon, hay tools, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: From river. Had well, but water unfit for use.
properties.Gen_Cond: Rather run down and neglected. Place was leased until recently.
properties.Industry: Only fair.
properties.Remarks: He stays at home most of the time and farms fairly well, but does not see the jobs in the way of cleaning his ditches, repairing fences as he should. He has an automobile, fairly new and manages to raise the money to buy gasoline but reports he is very s

properties.Name: Joe Mountain Pocket
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with one window and fence posts to its left.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, Mountain Pocket Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat; 6 A. oats; 40 A. hay, estimated at 40 tons
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 5 range horses, 5 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.House_Comm: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, mower, rake, harrow, stacker, 2 bullrakes, wagon, spring wagon

properties.Name: Thomas Stewart #2
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, a couple windows, and a chimney. A women sits on the porch holding a baby while another child looks through the screen door.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and three children. Mother-in-law and her husband live and work with them.
properties.Education_: Some education in reservation and mission schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat about 30 A. Oats 7 A. wild hay and pasture nearly 40 some being taken up by the railroad right of way.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses. 8 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: A fair house. No stable.
properties.House_Comm: A fair house. No stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit. Plow, harrow, rake and interest in a binder.
properties.Water_Desc: From the ditch or river. No well.
properties.Industry: One of the best. He often stays at home and works when others are attending some sport event. Has no automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man farms his land and stays at home and works better than the most of them. He has 20 acres of land leased from another Indian to increase his farm activities. When I was there he had two teams working the field, one being driven by his old father-

properties.Name: Henry Shinbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a family, Henry Shinbone's, and a wagon out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 2 step children, both married and living separately mostly. Mother-in-law an old woman lives with them.
properties.Education_: Reservation school 8 years. Carlisle 5 years. Wife one year in Mission.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, near mouth of Reno Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: wheat 25 A. Oats 35 A. Hopes to increase acreage this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses. 15 range horses. One yearling heifer

properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windowd, a chimney, and door. To the back right stands a log shed. Fence posts surround the house.
properties.Family_Des: Himself and wife. No one living with them.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley few miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 acres alfalfa 19 wheat. 16 oats. 20 A. hay land rest is pasture and road right of way river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses. 2 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.House_Comm: Fair small frame house fairly well furnished and kept. Poor stable. Says he wants to build a better one soon. Fences in fair condition. Wants to build a cellar before winter.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, wagons, fair outfit for his farming and harvesting
properties.Water_Desc: Hauled from river. Stock water from slough. Attempted to get a well but failed after going quite deep.
properties.Industry: He knows how to work very well and does fairly well but could and should do considerably better. His land is not the best being cut by sloughs and with a tendency to become alkalois for want of drainage. They live to themselves without any of their relat
properties.Remarks: He knows how to work very well and does fairly well but could and should do considerably better. His land is not the best being cut by sloughs and with a tendency to become alkalois for want of drainage. They live to themselves without any of their relat

properties.Name: White Fox
properties.Linked_Acc: Fred Dawes, Herbert White Fox, Isaac Plenty Hoops
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimney, two windows, and a side door. Fence posts surround the house.
properties.School_Des: School wagon to Hardin public school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3 miles from hardin.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. alfalfa, 10 A. oats and corn
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 2 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 3-room frame ouse, frame stable, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, mower, rake.
properties.Remarks: For his age, this man does very well. He has a big crowd around him and about 4 families of them work together. Among them they could do very much more. They put up some ay and do some farming, but one of the principal needs of that family, is to get the

properties.Name: The Arapahoe
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 1 mile south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: None.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 9 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 3-room house, log barn.
properties.House_Comm: 3-room house, log barn
properties.Implement_: Wagon, 23 sets of harness, 2 spring wagons, stacker, buckrake
properties.Remarks: This man should do some farming for himself, but he does not. I am not able to say just how he lives. He probably has some rentals that help and the tribal income that has been distributed has helped. He works well on the road work or other work for wage

properties.Linked_Acc: Fred Dawes, Herbert White Fox, Isaac Plenty Hoops

properties.School_Des: School wagon to Hardin public school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3 miles from hardin.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. alfalfa, 10 A. oats and corn
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 2 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 3-room frame ouse, frame stable, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, mower, rake.
properties.Remarks: For his age, this man does very well. He has a big crowd around him and about 4 families of them work together. Among them they could do very much more. They put up some ay and do some farming, but one of the principal needs of that family, is to get the

properties.Name: Other Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch. Another framed building, likely a shed, to the left of the house. A wagon stands on both sides of the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Reservation school. Son-in-Law went to Reservation School.
properties.School_Des: School wagon to Hardin public school.
properties.Health_Com: Poor, but son-in-law is quite well.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4.5 miles from Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. alfalfa, 6 A. wheat, 5 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle, 25 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good small frame house, log barn, tool shed, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good small frame house, log barn, tool shed, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, mower, rake, drill, buckrake.
properties.Remarks: Other Bull is not much given to work. His wife is a much better worker and his son-in-law, who has now been living with them whose name is Joe Hides, appears to be a rather industrious young man. He has done practically all of the work this past season.

properties.Name: Old Horn
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney. To the left of the house stands a tent. To the right is a log building and some implements scattered.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Mission school. Sons went to Reservation and public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. alfalfa, 10 A. oats, 20 A. wheat.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 25 range horses.
properties.House_desc: fair log house, poor log barn.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, poor log barn
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, riding plow, harrow, disc, binder
properties.Remarks:
Old Horn himself is a very good worker for his age. He has a very able-bodied son who should farm rather extensively, and if he did fair as well as he can talk and tell you about it, he could soon have a position lecturing to farmers' conventions. 

They

properties.Name: Fred Dawes
properties.School_Des: School wagon to public school at Hardin
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 3.5 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 23 A. alfalfa, 6 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 10 range horses, 11 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small granary
properties.House_Comm: Small granary
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, riding plow, harrow, farm wagon, spring wagon, harness
properties.Remarks: Fred Dawes really has no home of his own. He lives about the White Fox family, who, I believe, is his father-in-law. They work more or less together. Fred seems to be fairly industrious. He does not stay away from any particular race meet or fandangos of

properties.Name: Isaac Plenty Hoops
properties.School_Des: School wagon to Hardin Public School
properties.Location_D: Little Horn, 3 miles south of Hardin
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: None.
properties.House_Comm: None
properties.Implement_: Plow, drill, disc, wagon, spring wagon, harness
properties.Remarks: Isaac really has no home of his own. He lives in a tent, usually about the White Fox family. He did have some land rented this year and had a share in the wheat. He helped the White Fox family put up hay. He works fairly well, but so far, has not succeed

properties.Name: Austin Straycalf
properties.Photo_Desc: frame house with side attachment
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Mission School. Very limited education.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 6 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. alfalfa, 30 A. wild hay, 20 A. wheat, 10 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 1 saddle horse, 10 unbroke range horses, 4 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, fiar stable, old cabins.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, fair stable, old cabins
properties.Implement_: Plow, disc, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, drill, cultivator, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
This man says that he is a good worker. It seems that he does fairly well on his place. However, the weeds around the buildings were very large. There may be a few more buildings that were not reported and could not be found for the weeds.

He has good l

properties.Name: Fred Froze
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife reservation school and Haskell for 3 years
properties.Location_D: At present camping 4 miles below agency where he is farming his wife's allotments.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat. 7 A. oats. Little wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 3 saddle horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: No buildings on his wife's land. On his own land fair buildings. Land leased.
properties.House_Comm: No buildings on his wife's land. On his own land fair buildings. Land leased.
properties.Implement_: plow, disc, rake, binder, wagon and moderate equipment for farming.
properties.Gen_Cond: Says used to play cards and pool but quit.
properties.Industry: Fred is fairly industrious, usually farming somewhere and working just with his father without camping in other communities.
properties.Remarks: His father Froze, and his wife are old people with practically no farm equipment and their land was leased. He lives with Fred and helps him some with his work. The lease on Fred's land expires with this year and he expresses his desire to take possessio
