properties.Name: Otto Bear Cloud
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a screened in porch, two windows, and a chimney. Two individuals stand out front, likely Otto  Bear Cloud and his wife. A wagon stands to the left of the house and an automobile is in the front.
properties.Education_: Sherman Institute. Wife went to Haskell.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school by conveyance.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some wheat on rented land, in partnership. Very little else.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, no saddle horese, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair 3-room house, no stable. House is very poorly kept.
properties.House_Comm: Fair 3-room house, no stable. House is very poorly kept.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, rake, wagon. No mower, no stacker, no disc or drill or binder, but has one Ford.
properties.Remarks: Otto seems to have had a fair reputation as a laborer when he worked for someone else. He certainly shows no evidence of industry in connection with his own farm. They have managed to live with the help of tribal income and some work. The place where he

properties.Name: Comes Up Red
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with log building behind to the right. Family standing outside the front door of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one foster child, daughter of Tom Stewart
properties.Crop_Desc: Farm land is all leased to Sugar Company. He does no farming himself. He works with Tom Stewart in making hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work teams. About 30 range horses, mostly wild. No other stock.
properties.House_desc: Good new house and fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house and fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit, but not complete. At present he does not need it.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from the river. No well.
properties.Remarks: Very poor. He promises to make a little garden, and he sometimes works with a neighbor in putting up hay, but generally he is doing nothing, unless it be on the road going to town and back. He has no automobile, and if he had it would not take him long t

properties.Name: Thomas Big Lake
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window, chimney, and door. Behind the house stands a few buildings and a fence.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife in Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, south of Hardin.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 7 A. alfalfa, 50 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 30 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good 2-room house, log barn.
properties.House_Comm: Good 2-room house, log barn.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, buckrake, spring wagon, outfit of harness
properties.Remarks: Thomas is one of our more industrious farming Indians. Though he lives rather near the town, he is usually at home. He puts up considerable hay and farms quite well. He usually has some hay to sell; also some wheat, and he produces a good deal of food fo

properties.Name: Pretty Coyote
properties.Linked_Acc: Manuel Mountain Bull, David Bull Mountain
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and door. A couple tents stand to the back right along with a log building. A man, Pretty Coyote, and his children stand infront of the house with a horse.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only, and David Bull Mountain, stepson, and wife.
properties.Location_D: On Pryor Creek, 4 miles above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 30 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa, mixed hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 race horses 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Industry: None
properties.Remarks: When I called at this house in the middle part of the day in the middle part of the summer, I found Pretty Coyote and his stepson, who lives with him, sitting in the house. Pretty Coyote made no pretense of working. He said he had his crops raised by a r

properties.House_desc: Good new house and fair stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house and fair stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit, but not complete. At present he does not need it.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water from the river. No well.

properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife in Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, south of Hardin.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 7 A. alfalfa, 50 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 30 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good 2-room house, log barn.
properties.House_Comm: Good 2-room house, log barn.
properties.Implement_: Riding plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, buckrake, spring wagon, outfit of harness
properties.Remarks: Thomas is one of our more industrious farming Indians. Though he lives rather near the town, he is usually at home. He puts up considerable hay and farms quite well. He usually has some hay to sell; also some wheat, and he produces a good deal of food fo

properties.Name: Other Medicine
properties.House_Comm: Living in Buildings put on by Sugar Company lease. Good house and barn,. Small cabin, and root house, fair fences
properties.Implement_: Plows, harrow, mower, rake, stacker, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon, fair outfit, Has no automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: Gets water at well extra good. At his own cabin ditch water.
properties.Remarks: Other Medicine has been on the police force for a number of years, recently quite. He has a son who works with him and they farm quite well. His house is moderately furnished and moderately well kept for an old Indian. They have sewing machine, bedsteads

properties.Name: Fred Froze
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife reservation school and Haskell for 3 years
properties.Location_D: At present camping 4 miles below agency where he is farming his wife's allotments.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat. 7 A. oats. Little wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 3 saddle horses. No cattle.

properties.Name: Eagle
properties.Linked_Acc: Thomas Tobacco, Looks At the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house in the far left of the photo. To the right of the house stand two buildings; a barn to the far right and a frame house in the middle.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children. Of school age.
properties.Education_: None. Wife was in reservation boarding school and Carlisle one year.
properties.Crop_Desc: Alfalfa 18 A. Wheat 10 A. Oats 10 A. balance in hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 teams. About 20 saddle horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.House_Comm: Good house and barn and root cellar. House among the best kept on the reservation.
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit of farm and hay tools. Has an interest in binder. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Rather good
properties.Remarks: This house is a very nice new cottage, well painted, very well furnished and very well kept. A good frame barn sufficient to stable 3 or 4 teams and to store some feed. Living with them is Thomas Tobacco a young man who is a very good worker and whos wif

properties.Name: Two Leggings
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with chimney and door.  Two men, one likely Two Leggins, stand out front and another individual stands in the door way.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 5  children and an old lady relative
properties.Health_Com: Good for his age, but not able to work much.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Two Leggin Bridge
properties.Crop_Desc: 60 A. wild hay, rest is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Old frame house in poor condition; fair stable; root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, plow, riding plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Two leggings is one of the old men, a sort of sub-chief. He is making a very good effort considering his age. He does not do much farming, but he puts up most of his hay by himself with the help of the women and children. His house is very much in need o

properties.Name: Old Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two doors and a chimney. A family, likely Old Whiteman's, stands out front. Some implements are scattered behind the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 5 A. oats, 60 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 50 unbroke range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 mowers, rake, 2 bullrakes, stacker, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This man is not famous as a hard worker and good farm member. He does stay at his own home very well, but hired most of his work done, either by shares of crops, or with money. He had a white family at the place when I was there, putting up his hay. He,

properties.Name: Mary Humphrey
properties.Photo_Desc: Multiple buildings shown in the photo.There are two log buildings, the one to the left most likely the house with a porch addition. Two frame buildings are alos pictured to the  right of the house. A fence surrounds the perimeter and some other implement
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Half-way House.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 70 A. alfalfa, 80 A. rented hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 10 range horses, 56 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Indifferent frame house, stable, storeroom, granary, all cheap frame construction.
properties.House_Comm: Indifferent frame house, stable, storeroom, granary, all cheap frame construction.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farming and haying implements.
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch. No well. Sometimes has to be hauled from river, 3 miles away.
properties.Remarks: This family should hardly be reported as among Indian families. Mr. Humphrey is a white man; Mrs. Humphrey had a white father. Her children are whiter than the average white child. They farm considerably and are now trying to get a start in cattle. They

properties.Photo_Desc: frame house with side attachment
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Mission School. Very limited education.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 6 miles south of Hardin
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. alfalfa, 30 A. wild hay, 20 A. wheat, 10 A. oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 1 saddle horse, 10 unbroke range horses, 4 cattle.

properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, fair stable, old cabins

This man says that he is a good worker. It seems that he does fairly well on his place. However, the weeds around the buildings were very large. There may be a few more buildings that were not reported and could not be found for the weeds.

He has good l

properties.Name: John Adams
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a window, chimney, and extension. To the back right of the house stands a shed or stable with an automobile to its right.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and three children, Girl 17, boys 9 and 2
properties.Education_: Self and wife attended reservation school up to about 6th grade
properties.School_Des: Live convenient to public school where their son attends.
properties.Health_Com: Daughter subject to fits, appears strong. Other members of family quite healthy.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat 10 A. Oats 30 A. alfalfa 20 S. additional wheat to be sown in the spring
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 2 saddle horses; 3 or 4 range horses. No cattle. No hogs.
properties.House_desc: Fair home, being repared. Poor stable and tool shed. Root cellar in bad condition.
properties.House_Comm: Fair home, being repared. Poor stable and tool shed. Root cellar in bad condition.
properties.Implement_: Harness, 4 horses, spring wagon, mower, rake, buckrake, grain drill, binder, partnership, plow, gange.
properties.Water_Desc: Hauled from river for domestic use, sock and cleaning from slough. Needs a well.
properties.Gen_Cond: Fair for a young man with some education
properties.Industry: Does some farming but not with the application that should be given
properties.Remarks: This man and his wife are both rather above the average of intelligence. They have land better than many with some pasture along the sloughs and old river channel where it would cost nothing to keep one or two cows. They have an automobile which doubtles

properties.Name: Mark Real Bird
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors, two windows, and a chimney. In the back left there is a clothes line. To the back right there is a log  shed and a abuilding under construction- possibly an arbor.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 4 children; father-in-law, Frank Bethune, and wife; Edson Fire Bear, widower, with 2 children, make their home with him.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Mission Day School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School. One child attending.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 4 miles above agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, 20 A.; alfalfa, 30 A.; mixed hay, 20 A. Place cut by sloughs.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 15 unbroken range horses, geese, pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house and stable, root house, chicken house, sheds and corral. Sundry out buildings.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, grain drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Very good considering quality of land.
properties.Remarks: This man is one of the best of the young farmers. He has a very good set of buildings, corrals, fences, etc. Makes very good use of his land. It is not of the best and is out by old channels and sloughs, so that it is difficult to irrigate to advantage.

properties.Name: McKinley Backbone
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition, two windows, two doors, and a chimney. A small portion of another building is seen to the left of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 4 children, father-in-law, wife, and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Lodgegrass Public School, 4 miles. 2 children attending
properties.Crop_Desc: 55 A. weat, 10 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Nice frame house, good stable, root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, rake, plow, biner, drill, harrow, disc.
properties.Remarks: McKinley is one of the best Indians on the Reservation in the matter of industry and honesty. He was not at home when I called there but I saw him helping another Indian make hay at some distance. He has inadequate hay land on his own place and helps his

properties.Name: Edward Iron
properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 17 horses
properties.House_desc: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.House_Comm: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.Implement_: 2 wagons, buggy, mower, rake, stacker, sweeprake, plow, sulky plow, binder
properties.Remarks: This man is giving promise of doing very well. His own land seems not to be suitable for farming purposes. He is attempting to use some of his wife's land, which is better located. He is just now building a good house and with a more permanent home, he s

properties.Name: Fannie Fighter
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with woman, Fannie Fighter, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: 2 sons, father-in-law, and an old woman.
properties.Education_: None. Boys went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: All in hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 8 saddle horese, 60 range horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 cabins, sheds, log stable
properties.House_Comm: 2 cabins, sheds, log stable
properties.Implement_: Some haying tools, but no farming tools.
properties.Remarks: Fannie is a widow. Her sons are about 18 and 20 years old, strong, able-bodied boys. They would rather ride and rattle their spurs than to rattle a plow of pitch fork. The result is that they do not do very well at farming. They are young and will probab

properties.Name: John Lodgepole
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two chimney's, a side door, and small additio. Four men stand to the side of the house with visible fence posting around the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 chuldren, one boy in Rapid City School.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife went to Reservation School and Fort Shaw.
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat, 16 A. oats, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, no cattle or range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, stable, granary, chicken house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, stable, granary, chicken house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: Johnny Lodgepole is a very fair farmer. His wife and he both talk English very well and their house is quite well kept; fairly well furnished for a small house.

properties.Name: Charles Bell Rock
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with small log building to the back left. To the back right of the house stands a white tent.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 32 A. wheat, 50 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 4 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and fair stable and root house and chicken house
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and fair stable and root house and chicken house
properties.Implement_: Practically none
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or hauled from the creek
properties.Remarks: Charles Bellrock has been somewhat regularly employed by the Agency as laborer and interpreter about the farm station. He has a good little farm, well located, and easy to irrigate. His son-in-law, Owen Smells, now lives on the place and is cultivating i

properties.Name: Daniel L. Frost
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with gathering area to the right. Poor quality photo due to vegetation.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wild hay, potatoes
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses
properties.House_desc: Small house
properties.House_Comm: Small house
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow
properties.Remarks: Daniel attended school at Haskell Institute. His father lived right at Pryor village and worked about the store. He was not running any farm of his own; hence, the boys did not have a regular place to get work when they came back from school. Daniel has

properties.Name: Little Fire
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house surrounded by trees. To the left is an automobile.
properties.Family_Des: Himself; Otter bull, his son, and his wife
properties.School_Des: 10 or 12 miles to the nearest school.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wild hay, pasture, and limited amount of grain
properties.Stock_Desc: Few range ponies, 2 work horses, few saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: Very good house, fair log stable, corrals.
properties.House_Comm: Very good house, fair log stable, carrals.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, buckrake, wagon
properties.Remarks: This place is quite isolated from the general Indian settlements and several miles from the nearest Indian camp. However, this old man and his sone usually stay at home. They do not farm very much. They have but little land that is well suited for farmin

properties.Name: Old Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two doors and a chimney. A family, likely Old Whiteman's, stands out front. Some implements are scattered behind the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 5 A. oats, 60 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 50 unbroke range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house, fairly well furnished and kept, no stable, but promises to build one, root house.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 mowers, rake, 2 bullrakes, stacker, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This man is not famous as a hard worker and good farm member. He does stay at his own home very well, but hired most of his work done, either by shares of crops, or with money. He had a white family at the place when I was there, putting up his hay. He,

properties.Name: Yellow Face
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with an adjacent log building. Two other log buildings stand to the left of the house and a fence surrounds the perimeter.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 10 range horses, 2 or 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 log houses, root cellar, stable.
properties.Implement_: Mower, plow, hay-rake.
properties.Remarks: I visited this place twice, but did not find anyone at home. They just happened to be away temporarily, they usually live in the same place and they keep their place much better than most of the Indians. It is clean and neat about the yard and the house

properties.Name: William Big Day
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension. Two individuals, likely William Big Day and wife, are pictured on the porch. Behind the house  is a log building.
properties.Crop_Desc: 9 A. wheat, 8 A. oats, 8 A. alfalfa, 5 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 2 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice new house, well furnished amd well kept; old house in fair condition. Occupied by brothre-in-law; logs for stable.
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit for farming and harvesting, including binder, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Industry: Above average
properties.Remarks: This man reports that he had an automobile, but found it too expensive, so traded it for 2 mares, which could be used for farming purposes, also for raising good colts. This man and wife are young people who both talk good English. There is one that almo

properties.Name: Joe Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a chimney, three windows, and a porch addition. To the front of the house is a fence and to the right is a wagon.
properties.Education_: Reservation school, Wife attended Mission school
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school, where the children attend.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Practically all in hay. Small patch of wheat. Made some 25 tons of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle. I would suggest that he trade the 4 saddle horses for 2 more work horses.
properties.House_desc: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.House_Comm: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, take, buckrake, wagon, spring wagon, and automobile
properties.Water_Desc: River. It is to be regreted that he cannot get his gasoline in the same place.
properties.Remarks: Joe has had a Patent-in-Fee for his own land and has probably sold it or mortgaged it, which amounts to the same. His wife's own allotment is now under lease. The land on which they are living is inherited land, which they have about 1/2 interest in. The

properties.Name: Alexander Crane
properties.Linked_Acc: The Crane, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tent, beloning to The Crane, to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and six children, 3 in public school.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Reservation Boarding School.
properties.Health_Com: His own health is very poor at present. Family is well.
properties.Crop_Desc: 52 A. wheat, 3 A. oats, 50 A. alfalfa, 80 A. mixed hay, pasture along the creek.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 25 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable under construction. Good root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable under construction. Good root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, binder, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man is a very good farmer. He has a large family. His wife is above the average in intelligence. Her house is quite well kept, fairly well furnished. His father, The Crane, lives with him or in camp adjoining the house. He is an old man, not able to

properties.Name: Small
properties.Linked_Acc: Big Hail, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with door. A tent stands to the left of the cabin. To the right of the house is a few implements, a wagon, and a man, likely Small, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one child. Big Hail and wife, and Campbell Big Hail and wife and children live with him.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, no alfalfa, no wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.Implement_: None at all, but borrows from his neighbors.
properties.Remarks: He admits that he likes to work and considering that he has no implements, he is doing very well. If he can irrigate as much as he claims, he certainly should have more hay. He is using the ground for pasture mostly. He was not at home when I visited his

properties.Name: Bird Hat
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with trees along the right side.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; father, Bell Rock, an old man; son, Sampson, and wife.
properties.Health_Com: Not able to work much. Son, Sampson, all right.
properties.Crop_Desc: 32 A. wheat, 30 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 4 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle, but says he has 2 race horses.
properties.House_desc: fair log house, stable. No root house but promises to build one.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, stable. No root house but promises to build one.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: He and his son, Sampson, work together as one firm, Sampson doing most of the work. Bird Hat claims that he is not able to work since he had the Flu, a few years ago. However, he can ride in a spring wagon in the hot sun, over rough roads, many miles to

properties.Name: Old Dwarf
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney and side door. Out front stands a tent with two people inside. Another individual stands in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son. Adopted son in public school.
properties.Education_: He and wife have no education.
properties.Crop_Desc: wheat, none; oats, 12 A.; alfalfa 40 A.; mixed hay, 5 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, no stable, no cellar
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, no stable, no cellar
properties.Implement_: Disc, mower, harrow, rake, plow, binder, all standing outside
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or hauled from creek one mile.
properties.Remarks: This land is under the Lost Creek ditch, and the supply of water is not dependable. If there was adequate water he could irrigate practically all of his land. I found him at home, sitting in the shade of the tent. His alfalfa needed cutting, his fences n

properties.Name: Little Fire
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house surrounded by trees. To the left is an automobile.
properties.Family_Des: Himself; Otter bull, his son, and his wife
properties.School_Des: 10 or 12 miles to the nearest school.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wild hay, pasture, and limited amount of grain
properties.Stock_Desc: Few range ponies, 2 work horses, few saddle horses.

properties.House_Comm: Very good house, fair log stable, carrals.

properties.Name: James Bear Below
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimneys and a porch addition. A woman, wife, stands to the front of  the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child and grown stepson, mother, and sundry relatives
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, on other land; 6 A. oats, 15 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, one saddle horse, 9 unbroke range horses.
properties.House_desc: Nice frame house, fairly well kept; chicken house, no chickens; no stable
properties.House_Comm: Nice frame house, fairly well kept; chicken house, no chickens; no stable
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, 2 harrows, mower, rake, bullrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man is now on the Police force and seems to be a very reliable employee. His stepson, who is grown, does most of the farming and seems to be a very good worker. The land belongs to his wife and other members of her family. His own allotment is elsew

properties.Name: Old Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two doors and a chimney. A family, likely Old Whiteman's, stands out front. Some implements are scattered behind the house.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.

properties.Remarks: This man is not famous as a hard worker and good farm member. He does stay at his own home very well, but hired most of his work done, either by shares of crops, or with money. He had a white family at the place when I was there, putting up his hay. He,

properties.Name: Simon Bull Tail
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front door. A few implements are scattered around the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and three children. One married daughter.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to mission school.
properties.Health_Com: Fair, though he wants to be sick to get out of work.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 20 A. mixed hay, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.House_desc: Small log house, very poor shed for stable.
properties.House_Comm: Small log house, very poor shed for stable
properties.Implement_: Plow and mower only. Wagon and spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Son-in-law, Campbell Big Hail, makes his home with him a part of the time and may work for him occasionally. Simon was not at home when I visited his place and indications about the house were that he was very seldom at home. The grass and weeds were gro

properties.Name: Foolish Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with extension. A tent standing in the front with fence posting visible. A man, Foolish Man, and his wife stand out front.
properties.Education_: Short time in old Day School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 4 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.House_Comm: Log house very good. Fair furniture and fairly well kept. Poor shed stable, no root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, harrow, rake, 2 plows, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or distant creek. Very inconvenient.
properties.Remarks: This farm is not very promising. He can seldom get any water for irrigation. He has no convenient water for domestic use. In winter, none at all, and as to go down near the creek. He probably could do better by irrigating early before the water was in de

properties.Name: Albert Lincoln
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with laundry in the front hanging to dry. Behind the cabin there is a smaller log shed.
properties.Family_Des: Self, 2 boys and 3 girls. Wife died about a year ago.
properties.Location_D: Small Pox Creek, 4 miles east of Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, Oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, fair barn, corrals.
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, rake, harrow, sulky plow, wagon
properties.Remarks:
Albert is another of the very smart advisors and counselor, and if fluent talk in council or in private, would produce potatoes, he would never go hungry. 

He has some very good dry farm land and usually has a considerable acreage of crop, but he never

properties.Name: Knows
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a three seasons porch. A log building is seen to the right of the house. A wagon stand to the right with another in the center. A dog is eating grass. The second photo shows a work team with three men and a hay baler.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, father, widowed daughter and 2 children
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, above St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. voluntary wheat, 140 A. hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log stable. Fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, buckracke, stacker, mower, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: This family stay on their place regularly. It is a beautiful piece of land. Every acre can be cultivated and irrigated. It is mostly in wild hay, which is usually a very good crop with little expense connected with producing it. It is probably better for

properties.Name: Arnold Costa
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with log shed or barn
properties.Education_: He and wife educated in Mission School
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats, and alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, several saddle horses, 30 range horses.
properties.House_desc: House, granary, small stable.
properties.House_Comm: House, granary, small stable
properties.Implement_: binder, mower, hay-rake, harrow, plow, sulky plow
properties.Remarks: Arnold Costa is one of the smart variety. He knows more about how the Government should be run than the President or Secretary. He talks very good English and a good deal of it. I visited his place 2 or 3 times and never found him at home. After some del

properties.Name: Holds
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, a chimney, and a side door.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Sees With His Ears and wife live with them.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn River, 3 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 4 A. wheat, 4 A. poor hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 10 saddle and range horses.
properties.House_desc: New frame house, no stable, no root house. Very little furniture. House is well kept.
properties.House_Comm: New frame house, no stable, no root house. Very little furniture. House is well kept.
properties.Implement_: plow, harrow, disk, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man should farm a great deal more than he does. I am at a loss to know how he lives. He has but little land in the valley but it is not used as well as it should be. He has considerable land that could be dry farmed on the bench. Considerable of his

properties.Name: Henry Reed
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tents in the background. A fence post is visable in front of the home.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley on Soap Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 17 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay, no wheat, nor oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 1 race horse, 8 or 10 cattle
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and log stable
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and log stable.
properties.Implement_: Binder, 2 plows, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon, bob-sled, automobile
properties.Remarks:
House is very good and fairly well kept. It is not large enough for his large family. Two of his girls are at Rapid City School and two attend the Mission School. He had all his hay up and had been working for a neighbor in hay. 

Without any wheat or oa

properties.Name: Harry Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: XX
properties.Status: Both - wife Fee Patent, him trust
properties.Education_: Reservation School and Sherman Institute. Wife went to Reservation School.
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat, 14 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa, 20 A. wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 30 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new house; no stable; implement shed; no root house; house moderately furnished, and indifferently kept
properties.House_Comm: Good new house; no stable; implement shed; no root house; house moderately furnished, and indifferently kept
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, mower, rake, binder, grain drill, 2 wagons, automobile
properties.Remarks: Harry is a very bright young man. He has a fair education and reads and thinks better than most Indians. He had been doing fairly well with his farming. He laid off all of last season to agitate oil leases and in collusion with several variety of crooks

properties.Name: Old Coyote
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with two chimney, a window, and a door.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 ponies
properties.House_desc: 1 log house.
properties.House_Comm: 1 log house.
properties.Implement_: Seems to have a plow and harrow.
properties.Remarks: His real activity is confined mostly to driving to the Farm Station to get his monthly allowance check, or to inquire if it has come. So far as the records show, he has never been detected in doing any work and at his age, it is doubtful if he will ever

properties.Name: Bad Man
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house and frame house with wagon out front.
properties.School_Des: One mile from Lodgegrass Public school
properties.Health_Com: Not good. Able to do but little work.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, one mile from Lodgegrass
properties.Crop_Desc: Practically none. Land used for pasture. Will not rend it and not able to work it.
properties.House_Comm: Cabin used for store room and fair frame house, poorly kept. Small stable.
properties.Implement_: Wagon, spring wagon, mower, rake, sled
properties.Remarks: This man is quite old and unable to do much farming. He could lease the land to good advantage, and bring him some income, but he has declined to do so. He just lives there on an allowance from his and his wife's funds, derived probably from some land sa

properties.Name: Takes the Gun #3
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front oor. Behind the house stands a tent and a wagon.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Able to do some work.
properties.Location_D: Mouth of Beauvais Creek west of Big Horn near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Other good land leased. Mostly alfalfa. Very limited amount of grain.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 4 saddle horses, 50 range horses. 50 cattle . No hogs.
properties.House_desc: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.House_Comm: They live in poor cabin on land. The land leased has a good house and other buildings.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm equipment and hay machinery, wagons, harness, etc.
properties.Water_Desc: River where they live. Spring at their leased home.
properties.Gen_Cond: Poor. Automobile that consumes considerable of their limited means, and the boys spend the rest of their money playing pool.
properties.Remarks: Takes the Gun and his wife Mary were formerly regarded as among the most industrious and progressive Indians. They had a good place across the river somewhat isolated from the other settlements. They had a good house and other buildings, their own irriga

properties.Name: George Hogan
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Two individuals standing out front and an automobile to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; 5 children; mother-in-law; sister-in-law and son; brother-in-law
properties.Education_: Reservation, Haskell, & Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.School_Des: Access to public school. 5 children in school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 12 miles above Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 100 A. wheat, 1750 bu.; 30 A. oats, no good; 4 A. corn
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house, root house, outside toilet, no stable, no implement sheds
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house, root house, outside toilet, no stable, no implement sheds
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit for farming and harvesting, including Ford automobile
properties.Remarks: While he has a good little house, it is very indifferently kept. The furniture is meager but of fair quality. The main trouble with this family is that they live on the road most of the time. They have a Ford automobile. They owe everybody in the country

properties.Name: Josh Buffalo
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with door and chimney. A man (Josh Buffalo and child) stand to the front. A ladder rests on the hosue and a clothes line is visible to the building's right.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school and mission school
properties.Location_D: St. Xavier down Big Horn River
properties.Crop_Desc: 11 acres oats. 111 alfalfa. 56 acres pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, range and saddle horses 40. No cattle. 2 pigs.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin on inherited land. Fair frame house on his own land. Fair stable, root house, fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin on inherited land. Fair frame house on his own land. Fair stable, root house, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Fair farm outfit. Has no automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From creek. Well is not good.
properties.Industry: Very good considering his health as he has been rhuematic more or less recently. Say he does not play pool.
properties.Remarks: Josh Buffalo is a very well meaning Indian. He has not been able to work much and has been poor. He has taken these two orphan nephews to care for, but is now receiving some help from their funds. His wife's daughter is a half blood woman she is married

properties.Name: Chester Bad Boy
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension. To the left of the house stands a barn with a fence in the foreground. A person stands in fron of the house and horse is grazing infront of them.
properties.Family_Des: One son and daughter married living away.
properties.Education_: Reservation boarding school 2 months. Soldier 4 years.
properties.School_Des: N/A (I can only assume this is because he has no children with him at home.)
properties.Crop_Desc: Doubtful. Small amount in alfalfa and wheat. Clover and the rest in weeds.
properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse. 2 saddle horses, 13 wild range horses. We have bought him 2 or 3 teams from his own funds the last four years. He has been giving them away to his friends.
properties.House_desc: Good house, barn, chicken house recently built.
properties.House_Comm: Good house, barn, chicken house recently built.
properties.Implement_: Hardly any
properties.Water_Desc: Good well about 100 ft. out down at his own expense.
properties.Gen_Cond: Poor. I think the land was recently leased but he has it ready to go to weeds.
properties.Industry: Unknown to him.
properties.Remarks: Chester is the most willing man to make promises of temperance and industry that I have seen and I actually think he means them when he makes them. He was drunk over half the time and spent considerable of his time under arrest, but I have not know of hi

properties.Name: Frank He Does It
properties.Linked_Acc: He Does It, Martin He Does It
properties.Remarks: He lives with his father He Does It. For the past two years he has been teaching? [sic] the Mission Day School for which he receives small pay, but probably all that he earns, perhaps should either get on to his own allotment or get a house of his own an

properties.Name: Old Rabbit
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors and a chimney. A man, Old Rabbit, stands out front next to fence posts.
properties.Family_Des: None, but daughter and her husband, Jacob Big Hair, live with him.
properties.School_Des: Easy access to public school and Catholic day school.
properties.Location_D: St. Xavier in Big Horn Valley
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 acres alfalfa. No wheat or oats, most of other land idle.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 10 saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house being enlarged. Poor barn, but new one being planned from own funds. No root house.
properties.Implement_: Fair supply of farm implements and hay tools. Has no automobile.
properties.Gen_Cond: Fair, but no farming is being done this spring.
properties.Remarks: Old Rabbit has no wife. His son-in-law has been living with him. They seem not to agree very well as to the crops. This year they are not putting in any grain, they have been working their teams on the road. They are building a new house and barn from th

properties.Name: Little Owl
properties.Photo_Desc: Two story frame house with porch. To the left stands a shed and another, smaller building. A fence spans the perimeter.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Mission school.
properties.Health_Com: Good. One son has advanced tuberculosis
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Soap Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 15 range horses, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good 2-story frame house, one of the best; very good stable; toilet, chicken houses, etc.
properties.House_Comm: Good 2-story frame house, one of the best; very good stable; toilet, chicken houses, etc.
properties.Implement_: Fordson, plows, harrows, discs, etc. Very complete outfit except a binder. Wagon, no automobile.
properties.Remarks:
We regard Little Owl as one of the best among the Indians. He has a very good frame house as will be seen by the photograph. He has a comfortable stable, a well, out buildings, in fact, his place looks quite like a farm. 

His two boys had been very good

properties.Name: Ball
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch addition. Three individuals standing to the right side of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Lives with married daugther and husband (Henry Big Day). They work on the farm. Also with their grandchild, but not from the daughter I don't think.
properties.Location_D: Central Big Horn Valley near St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some land leased elsewhere.
properties.Stock_Desc: 11 saddle and range horses, combined
properties.House_Comm: Good house, well kept. Indifferent stable.
properties.Implement_: Hay tools, wagons, plow, drills, wagon. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: No well. Haul water from neighbors or from river. Stock go to river for water.
properties.Gen_Cond: Buildings, fences and farm in fair conditions. Fences need repairs.
properties.Industry: Only fair. Could work much better.
properties.Remarks: Ball says that he does not play pool. This was one merit. He and his son-in-law work together, and to some extent own the equipment together. This house is almost as well kept as that of Mr. Ties His Knees. The furniture and rugs are good. There are too

properties.Name: Amos Spotted
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three wagons
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 5 children, and an old man friend
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Mission School
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school or Mission school
properties.Location_D: 1 mile south of St. Xavier, in Big Horn Valley
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, no oats, 35 A. alfalfa, 30 A. hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 15 range horses, 1 race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Moderate frame house, indeifferently furnished and kept. Good stable and root house.
properties.House_Comm: Moderate frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Good stable and root house.
properties.Implement_: Full outfit except a binder; wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: He was threshing when I was there. They have a very good crop of wheat which had been stacked. There are not many of the Indians whom we have been able to induce to stack their wheat as an additional protection and to lessen the number of teams and peopl

properties.Name: Michael Bull Chief
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened porch, two windows, a door, and a chimney. Micheal stands in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Half brother John Bird Wellknown
properties.Education_: Both attended Mission school. Have common school education.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 wheat 20 alfalfa 20 pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses. 6 saddle horses. 3 cattle on range.
properties.House_desc: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Joint ownership with Bird Horse. They work together.
properties.Water_Desc: Very good spring close to the house.
properties.Industry: Above the average. Plays pool some, but not chronical. Has no automobile.
properties.Remarks: Mike is regarded as one of our best young men. He tends to his own business, works most of the time and apparently makes very legitimate use of his money. He lives near Bird Horse and they work in partnership very largely in their farm activities.

properties.Name: Edward Iron
properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing this year
properties.Stock_Desc: 17 horses
properties.House_desc: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.House_Comm: Just building a new frame house and has the logs for a barn
properties.Implement_: 2 wagons, buggy, mower, rake, stacker, sweeprake, plow, sulky plow, binder
properties.Remarks: This man is giving promise of doing very well. His own land seems not to be suitable for farming purposes. He is attempting to use some of his wife's land, which is better located. He is just now building a good house and with a more permanent home, he s

properties.Name: Old Elk
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows log cabin with two individuals, likely Old Elk and wife, standing out front. The second photo shows a new frame house with a screen porch addition. Fence posts stand around the perimeter.
properties.Location_D: Uppr Big Horn Valley near Headgate
properties.Crop_Desc: wild grass.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses and 5 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: One cabin and small stable in fair condition, no root house.
properties.House_Comm: One cabin and small stable in fair condition, no root house.
properties.Implement_: Farm wagon and spring wagon, but needs no plow because he does not farm.
properties.Remarks: Poor. Lives on monthly allowance. It is not know whether he can work or not. It is not recorded that he ever tried. He always gets drunk when he can get liquor. His wife gets drunk with him. The only thing I can recommend is that they live alone in his c

properties.Name: William Big Day
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension. Two individuals, likely William Big Day and wife, are pictured on the porch. Behind the house  is a log building.
properties.Crop_Desc: 9 A. wheat, 8 A. oats, 8 A. alfalfa, 5 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 2 range horses, 2 race horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Nice new house, well furnished amd well kept; old house in fair condition. Occupied by brothre-in-law; logs for stable.
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit for farming and harvesting, including binder, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Industry: Above average
properties.Remarks: This man reports that he had an automobile, but found it too expensive, so traded it for 2 mares, which could be used for farming purposes, also for raising good colts. This man and wife are young people who both talk good English. There is one that almo

properties.Name: John Spotted
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, a chimney, and front door. This frame house has a second floor porch as well. Next to the house stands a barn with fencing around the property.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public and mission schools
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley 1 mile southof St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 A. hay. 'Hoppers took his oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 5 range horses, 10 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New frame house and new barn.
properties.House_Comm: New frame house and new barn
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: John is the son of Amos Spotted, who warranted a very good report. John has not done so well as his father. He used to get drunk when he got the chance and still occasionally gets the chance. He would let his hay crop be put up on shares for half while h

properties.Name: Chester Bad Boy
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with extension. To the left of the house stands a barn with a fence in the foreground. A person stands in fron of the house and horse is grazing infront of them.
properties.Family_Des: One son and daughter married living away.
properties.Education_: Reservation boarding school 2 months. Soldier 4 years.
properties.School_Des: N/A (I can only assume this is because he has no children with him at home.)
properties.Crop_Desc: Doubtful. Small amount in alfalfa and wheat. Clover and the rest in weeds.
properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse. 2 saddle horses, 13 wild range horses. We have bought him 2 or 3 teams from his own funds the last four years. He has been giving them away to his friends.
properties.House_desc: Good house, barn, chicken house recently built.
properties.House_Comm: Good house, barn, chicken house recently built.
properties.Implement_: Hardly any
properties.Water_Desc: Good well about 100 ft. out down at his own expense.
properties.Gen_Cond: Poor. I think the land was recently leased but he has it ready to go to weeds.
properties.Industry: Unknown to him.
properties.Remarks: Chester is the most willing man to make promises of temperance and industry that I have seen and I actually think he means them when he makes them. He was drunk over half the time and spent considerable of his time under arrest, but I have not know of hi

properties.Name: Kills
properties.Photo_Desc: Two story frame house with screened porch addition. Log building to the right, an outhouse in the back surrounded with implements like a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife; son, Paul, and wife and 2 children
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 2 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. a;fa;fa, 15 A. wild hay, balance is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 range horses, 1 stallion, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good hourse, needs painting; no barn. House has practically no furniture; well kept.
properties.House_Comm: Good hourse, needs painting; no barn. House has practically no furniture; well kept.
properties.Implement_: Fair farming outfit except grain drill
properties.Water_Desc: Well is not good. River water used usually.
properties.Remarks: Kills has this one point of merit: he stays at home. However, he does not work. His boy is a very good worker and does what is done on the place. They have a good deal of inherited land and they are anxious to sell some of the inherited land to get funds

properties.Name: Amos Spotted
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with three wagons
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 5 children, and an old man friend
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to Mission School
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school or Mission school
properties.Location_D: 1 mile south of St. Xavier, in Big Horn Valley
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, no oats, 35 A. alfalfa, 30 A. hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 15 range horses, 1 race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Moderate frame house, indeifferently furnished and kept. Good stable and root house.

properties.Name: Knows His Coups
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two chimney, two windows, and two doors. To the right stands a tent and an automobile. To the left is a covered wagon.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Son in State Asylum. Foster child.
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Though he is old and was in bed sick when I visited him.
properties.Location_D: On Little Horn 5 miles above Wyola.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 acres wheat. 80 of mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: One team of work horses. 2 saddle horses. Possibly 20 range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Frame house, indifferently furnished and kept. Fair stable and corral. No root cellar. Fences in fair condition.
properties.Implement_: Plow and rake. Usually puts up his hay in conjunction with his neighbors and funishes part of the implements.
properties.Water_Desc: From river and from some springs
properties.Gen_Cond: Only fair. He is an old man not able to do full time work. Does very well for his age. He seems to take some pride in the fact that he is running his own place largely with one man who works with him and they live off their to themselves which is much be
properties.Remarks: Ben Looks Back, subject of another report works with him on this place in a spry of joint community affair.

properties.Name: Blake Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with work bench to the front right.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children, one in Mission School
properties.Education_: Reservation boarding school. Wife went to Reservation Boarding School and Mission school.
properties.School_Des: Arranges for children to stay near Mission Day School with grandfather.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 8 A. oats., alfalfa 5 A. Balance is pasture and wild grass along creek.
properties.Stock_Desc: See report of Packs a Hat, with whom he farms and handles the equipment in common. 15 cattle.
properties.House_desc: On his own lnd a good small frame house and granary.
properties.House_Comm: On his own land a good small frame house and granary.
properties.Implement_: See Packs the Hat report.
properties.Remarks: This young man is regarded as one of our best Indian workers and young business men. He attends to business, handles the two farms in conjunction with his foster father. He has a good little house on his own, where he lives part of the time. Well kept an

properties.Name: Thomas Long Tail
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, a chimney, and door.
properties.Family_Des: Thomas, wife and child; brother Jasper and mother.
properties.Education_: Thomas & wife went to Mission School; Jasper to Haskell.
properties.School_Des: None. Child goes to distant mission school.
properties.Location_D: Rotten Grass Creek, 12 miles from St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wild hay, pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 30 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair frame house and barn, built by themselves. Fair fences, chicken house, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Fair frame house and barn, built by themselves. Fair fences, chicken house, root house.
properties.Implement_: Plow, rake, stacker, drill mower, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: These brothers live together and work in partnership. Jasper has never been married and makes his home with his mother and brother. One of the striking merits of this family is that they went on to their allotments at considerable distance from any other

properties.Name: Richard Wallace
properties.Photo_Desc: First picture shows a log house with multiple windows and a chimeny. Behind the house is a tent and a couple more buildings with a surrounding fence. The second picture shows two frame houses, both with porch extensions. Farming equipment is standing to
properties.Education_: Carlisle and reservation. Wife had no education.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to Catholic Mission Day School.
properties.Location_D: One on Lodgegrass Creek and one on East Soap Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. wild hay. Remainder is grazing land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 work horses, 8 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 100 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good new houses on each place. Good barns, granary, chicken houses, root houses, implement sheds, etc.
properties.House_Comm: Good new houses on each place. Good barns, granary, chicken houses, root houses, implement sheds, etc.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit of farming and harvesting implements including Dodge car.
properties.Water_Desc: Well on one place and good spring at other.
properties.Remarks: Wallace is regarded as one of the best business Indians on the Reservation. He has two very good places, well improved. He has had a nice number of cattle, ranging from 100 to 200 head, which are well taken care of. I do not know just how much he may own

properties.Name: Richard Wallace

properties.Name: Robin Iron
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, near Soap Creek.
properties.Crop_Desc: None.
properties.Stock_Desc: 30 horses, 30 cattle
properties.House_desc: Log cabin. Living in frame house on other land.
properties.House_Comm: Log cabin. Living in frame house on other land.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, disc, harrow, buggy
properties.Remarks: Robin Iron has usually worked as a cowboy either with the Reservation cattle or with other cowmen of the locality. He understands the cattle business and is regarded as a very reliable employee in that work; hence, he has not farmed on his own account to

properties.Name: Mortimer Plenty Hawk
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with three windows, two chimney's, and a door. There is a family standing out in front of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 5 miles south of Lodgegrass.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 25 A. native hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 10 range horses, 30 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and log barn.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and log barn.
properties.Implement_: 2 wagons, 2 riding plows, binder, 2 mowers, rake, buckrake, stacker, drill disc
properties.Remarks: This man and his brother should do considerably more work than they do. They live on their mother's allotment. Mortimer should have a house of his own and on his own land, and he desires such house when he can afford it. They do better than many of the y

properties.Name: Eagle Turns
properties.School_Des: Mission school and public school convenient
properties.Crop_Desc: None. 40 A. leased, 40 A. wild hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 10 horses
properties.House_desc: Poor log house not on his land
properties.House_Comm: Poor log house not on his land
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, wagon, buggy
properties.Remarks: This man is now a policeman and probably put on the force because he had proven that he was not good for anything else. He has a good place, but he does not stay at home and will not work. He did put up a little hay this summer with a neighbor. He has re

properties.Name: Bird Above
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch and fence surrounding the property. To the right of the house there is a windmill and a small shed. Further to the right there is a small tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son married. Son Eric works with them. -- find out in Eric's file that he's married and definitely living with them
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 wheat, 40 acres oats. 10 acres hay land and pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. Some saddle horses and range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, fair stable, root house, fences fair only
properties.Implement_: plows, mowers, rake wagons. fair outfit
properties.Water_Desc: From the creek or neighbors well. They have a well but not good.
properties.Gen_Cond: Indifferent. They have an old automobile but there is some hope in that respect because it looks like it was past repair.
properties.Remarks: Bird Above has had two grown sons living with him. One of them recently married to a Shosoni girl and is not on the Shoshoni Reservation. They are making a fair start at farming this year, and I feel hopeful that there may be an improvement. They bought

properties.Name: Eric Bird Above
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school and also mission school
properties.Remarks:
Living and works with his father Bird Above on some farm belonging to the family. See report of Bird Above. 

Eric has not been doing much work before this year but he has a lot of ground plowed and some of it planted and is getting his seed for planting

properties.Name: Augustine Grey Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Two attend Mission School.
properties.Stock_Desc: This man farms in partnership with White Hip, whose report see. Their crops, stock, and implemments arehandled and owned in common, though they live in separate houses.
properties.House_desc: Good log house.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house
properties.Remarks: Augustine, the brother of White Hip, is reputed to be a very good farmer, attending closely to his business. They have some hay to sell and they have some prospect for a crop of grain. // John Grey Bull is another brother of Augustine Gray Bull, but he d

properties.Name: Yellow Face
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with an adjacent log building. Two other log buildings stand to the left of the house and a fence surrounds the perimeter.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 10 range horses, 2 or 3 saddle horses.
properties.House_desc: 2 log houses, root cellar, stable.
properties.Implement_: Mower, plow, hay-rake.
properties.Remarks: I visited this place twice, but did not find anyone at home. They just happened to be away temporarily, they usually live in the same place and they keep their place much better than most of the Indians. It is clean and neat about the yard and the house

properties.Name: Ties His Knees
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with porch extension and chimney. The house is surrounded by a tree grove. Two individuals, likely Ties His Knees and wife, stand out front.
properties.Location_D: Central part of Big Horn Valley
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 acres alfalfa. 70 acres idle. No grain this year.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses. 50 saddle horses. Range  horses. Possibly a few cattle on the rane has not seen them recently. No other stock.
properties.House_desc: Good house, 4 rooms. Root house, implement shed, poor stable, fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good house, 4 rooms. Root house, implement shed, poor stable, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Plows, mower, rake, sweep rake, stacker, wagon, disc. Quite complete farm equipment.
properties.Water_Desc: Cement cistern filled from irrigation ditches in the fall.
properties.Gen_Cond: House good. Around the farm generally only fair.
properties.Remarks:
Wife among the best on the reservation. Man puts in most of his time playing pool, and has been doing but very little farming. He has no automobile, but uses his money for pool instead of gasoline. 

This woman is very superior along domestic lines. She

properties.Name: Henry Reed
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tents in the background. A fence post is visable in front of the home.
properties.Education_: None. Wife went to mission school.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley on Soap Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 17 A. alfalfa, 10 A. mixed hay, no wheat, nor oats
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 60 range horses, 1 race horse, 8 or 10 cattle
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and log stable
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and log stable.
properties.Implement_: Binder, 2 plows, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, buckrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon, bob-sled, automobile
properties.Remarks:
House is very good and fairly well kept. It is not large enough for his large family. Two of his girls are at Rapid City School and two attend the Mission School. He had all his hay up and had been working for a neighbor in hay. 

Without any wheat or oa

properties.Name: Bird Horse
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a three season porch and three people standing in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son, Paul Hill with wife and child, Father-in-Law, Snot in the Hand and a very old man.
properties.School_Des: Indifferent mission school in one of his buildings.
properties.Crop_Desc: Some land leased. Wild grass 10 acres. Alfalfa 70 A. Oats 15.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses. 6 saddle horses, 25 range horses, 25 cows.
properties.House_desc: Good house 4 rooms and large porch well kept. Fair stable, good cabins
properties.House_Comm: Good house 4 rooms and large porch well kept. Fair stable, good cabins
properties.Implement_: Quite complete outfit of farm implements and hay tools owned in part by Michael Bull Chief. No automobile.
properties.Water_Desc: From creek or ditch. No well.
properties.Industry: Above the average.
properties.Remarks: Bird Horse is regarded as one of the best farmers. His place is in good order and he makes a lot of hay and does considerable farming and has some dry farm land idle. His wife is among the best housekeepers. She has four rooms all in good order and fairl

properties.Name: Michael Bull Chief
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened porch, two windows, a door, and a chimney. Micheal stands in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Half brother John Bird Wellknown
properties.Education_: Both attended Mission school. Have common school education.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 wheat 20 alfalfa 20 pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses. 6 saddle horses. 3 cattle on range.
properties.House_desc: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Joint ownership with Bird Horse. They work together.
properties.Water_Desc: Very good spring close to the house.
properties.Industry: Above the average. Plays pool some, but not chronical. Has no automobile.
properties.Remarks: Mike is regarded as one of our best young men. He tends to his own business, works most of the time and apparently makes very legitimate use of his money. He lives near Bird Horse and they work in partnership very largely in their farm activities.

properties.Crop_Desc: Nothing this year
