properties.Name: Joe Mountain Pocket
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with one window and fence posts to its left.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, Mountain Pocket Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: 18 A. wheat; 6 A. oats; 40 A. hay, estimated at 40 tons
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 5 range horses, 5 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.House_Comm: New cabin, old cabin, stable
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, mower, rake, harrow, stacker, 2 bullrakes, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: Joe has the one merit that he usually stays at his own home., Outside of that, there is nothing much to say. He does very little work. He has kept a Mexican around him, giving him about half the crop for doing the work. He has a very good place and a hou

properties.Name: Knows the Ground
properties.Photo_Desc: First photo shows a frame house with a screened in proch and side door. The second photo shows two men and a child in front of the house. The child is climbing up on the horse and there is part of a wagon shown to the left.
properties.Location_D: Fort Smith Bench, near Lime Kiln Creek
properties.Crop_Desc: Found none.
properties.Stock_Desc: 23 horses, 16 cattle
properties.House_desc: 1 good frame house
properties.House_Comm: 1 good frame house
properties.Implement_: Wagon, mower, rake, plow, harrow
properties.Remarks: This man is said to be unable to work very much. He was not at home when I visited his place, but I have been there before. He lives a long distance from any Indian neighbors, has a little spring along the foot of the mountains. He has a good little hous

properties.Name: Bird Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a tent standing in the distance behind. A wagon is pictured to the left of the house as well as to the right. Four individuals stand outside of the  house.
properties.Education_: He and wife have no education.
properties.School_Des: One mile to Baptist Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 6 miles above St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, little oats and a little alfalfa. Should have 100 A. wild hay, but did not irrigate it. Grasshoppers did considerable damage.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 10 range horses. All seem to be in his corral as there appeared to be about 40 up in the corral.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, an old log stable, root cellar
properties.Implement_: plow, harrow, mower, rake, interest in binder, drill
properties.Remarks:
This land is particularly adapted to the native wild hay, but just for want of the industry to irrigate it, he had very little, I think not more than 10 ten. 

His house is a moderate log house, very indifferently furnished and kept. He had his implement

properties.Name: Leo Hugs
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, two windows, and a front door. A family stands outside the house and there is a log shed in the background.
properties.Crop_Desc: 30 A. wheat, 25 A. oats, 100 A. mixed hay land, some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 40 range horses, 50 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, no stable, root house, corral.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, bullrake, stacker, 2 wagons, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Leo and his wife are regarded as among the best of our Indians. They live on their own place all the time except as it may be necessary to camp nearer the school in a little cabin through the severe part of the winter in order for their children to be in

properties.Name: Plenty Buffalo
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame cabin with a chimney and window. A log shed stands to its left.
properties.School_Des: 3 miles from public school. Camp near Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Big Hrn Valley, 3 miles south of St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Cultivated practically no land. Put up some 20 A. of wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 40 range horses, few cattle on the range. Number not known.
properties.House_desc: Very poor old house and a small cabin, corral.
properties.House_Comm: Very poor old house and a small cabin, corral.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, drill, disc, mower, rake, wagon
properties.Remarks: Plenty Buffalo has shown no disposition to really work. With the help of some neighbors, he did put up some 20 ton of hay. I happened to be in his field in the summer when they were stacking. He has an excellent field, with good crops growing all around

properties.Name: Alvin Morrison
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with large shed to the left of the house.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 8 miles below Agency
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 A. wheat; oats, on rented land, 30 A.; 25 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 1 race horse, 14 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Poor house, poor stable, root cellar, garage.
properties.Implement_: Quite a complete outfit of farming and haying tools, including an automobile
properties.Water_Desc: From the River. Should have a well.
properties.Remarks:
Alvin was not home when I called there, as he was working with his team on the irrigation ditch. He is 1/2 white, has a Patent-in-Fee for his own land, which has either been sold or mortgaged.

He lives on inherited and family land belonging to his wife'

properties.Name: Michael Bull Chief
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened porch, two windows, a door, and a chimney. Micheal stands in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Half brother John Bird Wellknown
properties.Education_: Both attended Mission school. Have common school education.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 wheat 20 alfalfa 20 pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses. 6 saddle horses. 3 cattle on range.
properties.House_desc: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.House_Comm: Good little frame house, poor barn, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Joint ownership with Bird Horse. They work together.
properties.Water_Desc: Very good spring close to the house.
properties.Industry: Above the average. Plays pool some, but not chronical. Has no automobile.
properties.Remarks: Mike is regarded as one of our best young men. He tends to his own business, works most of the time and apparently makes very legitimate use of his money. He lives near Bird Horse and they work in partnership very largely in their farm activities.

properties.Name: Blake Whiteman
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with work bench to the front right.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and two children, one in Mission School
properties.Education_: Reservation boarding school. Wife went to Reservation Boarding School and Mission school.
properties.School_Des: Arranges for children to stay near Mission Day School with grandfather.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 8 A. oats., alfalfa 5 A. Balance is pasture and wild grass along creek.
properties.Stock_Desc: See report of Packs a Hat, with whom he farms and handles the equipment in common. 15 cattle.
properties.House_desc: On his own lnd a good small frame house and granary.
properties.House_Comm: On his own land a good small frame house and granary.
properties.Implement_: See Packs the Hat report.
properties.Remarks: This young man is regarded as one of our best Indian workers and young business men. He attends to business, handles the two farms in conjunction with his foster father. He has a good little house on his own, where he lives part of the time. Well kept an

properties.Name: Ben Gardner
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with small log building in the background
properties.School_Des: 2 miles from public school and mission school
properties.Location_D: Wife's inherited land in Big Horn Valley, 2 miles below St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: Few acres of wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 2 saddle horses, no range horses or cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small log house, small stable and root house.
properties.House_Comm: Smal log house, small stable and root house.
properties.Implement_: Disc, plow, drill, binder, mower, wagon, spring wagon, automobile
properties.Remarks: We believe that it would be better to have a well than to support an automobile. Ben Gardner is a mixed blood. He received a Policy Patent. He evidently disposed of the land and bought the Ford and it is not recorded just how he gets the gasoline. He is

properties.Name: His Rock Is Medicine
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, two chimneys, and an extension. A fence surrounds the house.
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, oats, hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 or 4 saddle horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house. Root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow
properties.Remarks: I visited this man's place twice, but did not find him at home. However, I understand that he does usually live at this place. He has a fair cabin. He works a little. He is not very well.Considering his age and health, he does better than some of the abl

properties.Name: Jacob Stands Over Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with plarge porch addition. To the left is a tractor and fence posts surround the property. Other indistinguishable implements are scattered around the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children. Both in public school.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, near Pryor, on wife's allotment
properties.Crop_Desc: 32 A. wheat, 8 A. oats, 10 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 20 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, on wife's allotment; house, stable, etc. on his own land
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, on wife's allotment; house, stable, etc. on his own land
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, bullrake, wagon, spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: This man has not been really settled down to a regular home. He has been doing some farming on his relative's land and with his relatives. His wife's allotment, which is an excellent tract, all under ditch, has been leased, but as the lease is away and m

properties.Name: John Gros Ventre
properties.Linked_Acc: Dan Old Bull, Prairie Gros Ventre
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with multiple windows, a chimney, side door, and a screened in porch addition.
properties.Education_: Reservation School. Wife went to Reservation School and Haskell.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek, near St. Ann's Mission
properties.Crop_Desc: 44 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay. Pasture 160 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 5 saddle horses, 6 unbroken range horses. No cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.House_Comm: Good 4-room house well kept. Very good barn, tool shed, old house suitable for storage.
properties.Implement_: Plows, disc, harrow, mower, rake, stacker, binder, wagons, etc. Very fair equipment. No automobile.
properties.Remarks: This man we found cutting alfalfa. A very superior crop. He hardly had time to talk to us when we saw him in the field. We visited the house, but his wife was not at home. His place is better equipped and better kept than the average. His old father live

properties.Name: Joe Gun (Shows His Gun)
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with windows and two chimneys. Two men stand and sit in front of the house. Another man is standing in the far back right of the house, barely in the photo.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and foster dauther, who is in Public School -- doesnâ€™t mention Austin Shows Lion until later and he is a 7 people
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, near School, on wife's inherited
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 5 A. oats, 6 A. alfalfa, 20 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 7 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Cabin in medium condition, no barn, root cellar
properties.House_Comm: Cabin in medium condition, no barn, root cellar
properties.Implement_: Drill, plow, binder, bullrake, stacker, mower, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This party says himself that he is a good worker, but the condition of his place and his general attitude do no confirm his admission. He appears to weigh somewhere around 300 lbs. His wife, who was sitting in the shade with him, may be a little heavier.

properties.Name: Charles Brown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with shack to the left. A wagon to the right of the home with a horse.
properties.Education_: Fort Shaw. Wife in Mission School.
properties.Health_Com: Poor. Bad enough to furnish any excuse for not working.
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 20 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 5 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: cabin poorly furnished
properties.House_Comm: Cabin poorly furnished. ----- BUT I think that they are not counting some of the outbuildings that are pictured in the pictures.
properties.Implement_: Plow, bullrake, mower, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Charles Brown got his Fee Patent under the former policy of the Office and disposed of his land. He has also had certain inherited interests sold and has disposed of that. I could not learn that he ever did work. 

He has a Cree Indian working on his pla

properties.Name: John Spotted
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two windows, a chimney, and front door. This frame house has a second floor porch as well. Next to the house stands a barn with fencing around the property.
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public and mission schools
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley 1 mile southof St. Xavier
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 A. hay. 'Hoppers took his oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 5 range horses, 10 cattle.
properties.House_desc: New frame house and new barn.
properties.House_Comm: New frame house and new barn
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: John is the son of Amos Spotted, who warranted a very good report. John has not done so well as his father. He used to get drunk when he got the chance and still occasionally gets the chance. He would let his hay crop be put up on shares for half while h

properties.Name: Plain Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with window and chimney. A woman stands out infront of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only. Swallow Bird and wife often live with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 5 A. wheat, all the rest of land is rented and is in alfalfa and wheat
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 6 range horses. One race horse.
properties.House_desc: Poor cabin of two rooms, dirt floor, no furniture, decorated with Indian drums and regalia; no stable.
properties.House_Comm: Poor cabin of two rooms, dirt floor, no furniture, decorated with Indian drums and regalia; no stable.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, 2 buckrakes, stacker
properties.Remarks: This man apparently does very little himself. He has a few acres that he pretends to cultivate. I am not sure but what he has someone else to do that. Most of his place is leased. While he is not very well, he should be able to do a little more of his ow

properties.Name: Austin Lion Shows
properties.Education_: Mission School. Wife went to Fort Shaw and Public School.
properties.School_Des: Son at Rapid City. Others in Public Schools.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 4 saddle horses, no range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small, indifferent cabin, not used, on inherited land.
properties.House_Comm: Small, indifferent cabin, not used, on inherited land
properties.Implement_: One plow only
properties.Remarks: Austin has not been attempting to farm for several years past. He and his wife separated for a time and he went out and worked for wages, a good part of the time at the Agency. He is a very good worker when working under a boss. It is doubtful whether he

properties.Name: Turns Back Plenty
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tree grove surrounding it. To the left of the house is a clothing line and there is a fence surrounding the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children, 2 in public school.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 14 A. alfalfa, 7 A. mixed hay. Remainder in pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 7 saddle horses, few range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, fairly furnished; poor stable.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of farm and haying tools
properties.Remarks: Turns Back Plenty is employed by the Government as linerider and has been for some time. He devotes practically all his time to this work, through the summer, and considerable time to it through the winter. He furnished his own horse and provisions while

properties.Name: Pretty Coyote
properties.Linked_Acc: Manuel Mountain Bull, David Bull Mountain
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and door. A couple tents stand to the back right along with a log building. A man, Pretty Coyote, and his children stand infront of the house with a horse.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only, and David Bull Mountain, stepson, and wife.
properties.Location_D: On Pryor Creek, 4 miles above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. wheat, 30 A. oats, 20 A. alfalfa, mixed hay 10 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 2 race horses 10 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, little furniture. Stable, store room, root house.
properties.Implement_: Binder, plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Industry: None
properties.Remarks: When I called at this house in the middle part of the day in the middle part of the summer, I found Pretty Coyote and his stepson, who lives with him, sitting in the house. Pretty Coyote made no pretense of working. He said he had his crops raised by a r

properties.Name: Mike Blue Moccasin
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with screened in porch, a couple windows, a side and front door, and a chimney.
properties.Crop_Desc: 68 A. wheat, 10 A. alfalfa, 15 A. mixed hay
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, no saddle horses or range horses.
properties.House_desc: Good new house, built with borrowed money. Living elsewhere.
properties.House_Comm: Good new house, built with borrowed money. Living elsewhere.
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, harrow, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man was interested with his brother in some estates, including sum very good land. Last year, we partitioned this land in order that he might have title to a good place to build himself a home. We got the partition through and loaned him the money f

properties.Name: Alexander Crane
properties.Linked_Acc: The Crane, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with tent, beloning to The Crane, to the right of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and six children, 3 in public school.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Reservation Boarding School.
properties.Health_Com: His own health is very poor at present. Family is well.
properties.Crop_Desc: 52 A. wheat, 3 A. oats, 50 A. alfalfa, 80 A. mixed hay, pasture along the creek.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 25 range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable under construction. Good root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable under construction. Good root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, disc, drill, mower, rake, bullrake, binder, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man is a very good farmer. He has a large family. His wife is above the average in intelligence. Her house is quite well kept, fairly well furnished. His father, The Crane, lives with him or in camp adjoining the house. He is an old man, not able to

properties.Name: Big Hail
properties.Family_Des: Himself, wife, son, and daughter married.
properties.Remarks: It seems his own land, including his house, is leased and he is living around with his friends, helping them with their farming for a part of the crop. He lives in the house with Small, also works with Goes Among The Enemy, a very unsatisfactory arrangem

properties.Name: Plain Bull
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with window and chimney. A woman stands out infront of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, only. Swallow Bird and wife often live with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 5 A. wheat, all the rest of land is rented and is in alfalfa and wheat
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 6 range horses. One race horse.
properties.House_desc: Poor cabin of two rooms, dirt floor, no furniture, decorated with Indian drums and regalia; no stable.
properties.House_Comm: Poor cabin of two rooms, dirt floor, no furniture, decorated with Indian drums and regalia; no stable.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon, 2 buckrakes, stacker
properties.Remarks: This man apparently does very little himself. He has a few acres that he pretends to cultivate. I am not sure but what he has someone else to do that. Most of his place is leased. While he is not very well, he should be able to do a little more of his ow

properties.Name: Small
properties.Linked_Acc: Big Hail, Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with door. A tent stands to the left of the cabin. To the right of the house is a few implements, a wagon, and a man, likely Small, standing out front.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and one child. Big Hail and wife, and Campbell Big Hail and wife and children live with him.
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. oats, no alfalfa, no wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 5 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 8 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.House_Comm: Good cabin, fairly well kept; nothing else.
properties.Implement_: None at all, but borrows from his neighbors.
properties.Remarks: He admits that he likes to work and considering that he has no implements, he is doing very well. If he can irrigate as much as he claims, he certainly should have more hay. He is using the ground for pasture mostly. He was not at home when I visited his

properties.Name: Isaac McAllister
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with window and chimney. Another log building behind the house with implements, a ladder, resting on the building. Two adults are walking into the log house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child; father-in-law, and wife; widowed daughter
properties.Health_Com: Fair. Think he could work if he would try.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile below Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 25 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa, 6 A. mixed hay, pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, one saddle horse, one race horse, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 poor cabins, poorly kept, one poor log stable, no root house.
properties.House_Comm: 2 poor cabins, poorly kept, one poor log stable, no root house
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, rake, bullrake, stacker, wagon, spring wagon, old binder
properties.Remarks:
Isaac makes a very poor effort at farming. I told him I could not see what was going to keep him from starving to death. He has not ample crop to feed his family. 

He is indolent and indifferent. Perhaps if he gets good and hungry for one winter and sur

properties.Name: Goes Among the Enemy
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with another building in the background. To the right of the house there is a wagon against a post.
properties.Crop_Desc: 15 A. alfalfa, 16 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, balance in pasture
properties.Stock_Desc: 1 work horse, 1 saddle horse, 10 unbroken range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log cabin, stable, implement shed, corral, fair fences
properties.House_Comm: Fair log cabin, stable, implement shed, corral, fair fences
properties.Implement_: Has limited equipment of implements
properties.Water_Desc: Creek, which is good at this place.
properties.Remarks: This party lives around with other Indians a good deal of the time. Big Hail works with him some on his farm, but does not live with him. He lives mostly with Alex The Crane. He was not at home when I was at his camp, but I met him on the road. I think h

properties.Name: Fights Wellknown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with large addition to the left. Fence surrounding the house and addition.
properties.Family_Des: Wife. Daniel Blackbird and wife and 3 children living with them.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 5 A. alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 60 unbroken range horses, one race horse. Thinks he has a few cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition.
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, shed, corral, all in fair condition
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, harrow, plow, drill, binder, wagon, spring wagon, no automobile
properties.Remarks: It is reported that he works very well. He was not at home when I called at his place. Said to be out hunting for horses. His wife was in the garden at work. He said that he did not expect to go anywhere for the Fourth of July, except one day, as he want

properties.Name: Albert Lincoln
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with laundry in the front hanging to dry. Behind the cabin there is a smaller log shed.
properties.Family_Des: Self, 2 boys and 3 girls. Wife died about a year ago.
properties.Location_D: Small Pox Creek, 4 miles east of Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: Wheat, Oats.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, fair barn, corrals.
properties.Implement_: Binder, mower, rake, harrow, sulky plow, wagon
properties.Remarks:
Albert is another of the very smart advisors and counselor, and if fluent talk in council or in private, would produce potatoes, he would never go hungry. 

He has some very good dry farm land and usually has a considerable acreage of crop, but he never

properties.Name: Charles Bell Rock
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with small log building to the back left. To the back right of the house stands a white tent.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to Mission School.
properties.Location_D: Pryor Creek, one mile above Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 32 A. wheat, 50 A. alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 3 saddle horses, 4 unbroken range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house and fair stable and root house and chicken house
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house and fair stable and root house and chicken house
properties.Implement_: Practically none
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or hauled from the creek
properties.Remarks: Charles Bellrock has been somewhat regularly employed by the Agency as laborer and interpreter about the farm station. He has a good little farm, well located, and easy to irrigate. His son-in-law, Owen Smells, now lives on the place and is cultivating i

properties.Name: Other Blackbird
properties.Family_Des: Wife, one child, and an old man, blind and dependent
properties.House_Comm: Fair cabin, no stable, no root house. Promises to build a root house this year.
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, harrow, rake, spring wagon, only
properties.Remarks: Lives at home except in winter, when he must go near the creek for water. Works very wll. He and his wife were both working in the garden when we called at their house. They came in while we were there and when we left, they immediately went back to the

properties.Name: George Lande
properties.Family_Des: Self and wife. Just recently married.
properties.Crop_Desc: Corn, alfalfa
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 15 range ponies, 18 cattle.
properties.House_desc: House, shed, corrals
properties.House_Comm: House, shed, corrals
properties.Implement_: Plow, mower, rake, harrow, disc, 2 wagons, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This boy is a brother of Henry Dewey Lande, on whom report was made. He was reared by a very industrious white father and they made a very good living, mostly with their cattle, and have but a limited amount of land suitable for farming. They have some t

properties.Name: Old Coyote
properties.Photo_Desc: Log cabin with two chimney, a window, and a door.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 ponies
properties.House_desc: 1 log house.
properties.House_Comm: 1 log house.
properties.Implement_: Seems to have a plow and harrow.
properties.Remarks: His real activity is confined mostly to driving to the Farm Station to get his monthly allowance check, or to inquire if it has come. So far as the records show, he has never been detected in doing any work and at his age, it is doubtful if he will ever

properties.Name: Jacob Woodtick
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with window and chimney. Behind the house stands a large tent.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 2 children, Victor Singer and family
properties.Location_D: Lost Creek Valley, southwest of Pryor
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. wheat, 10 A. oats, 6 A. alfalfa.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 1 saddle horse, 3 unbroke range horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: One small cabin, root cellar, no stable.
properties.House_Comm: One small cabin, root cellar, no stable.
properties.Implement_: 2 plows, harrow, mower, rake, wagon, spring wagon
properties.Remarks: This man's farm is under the Lost Creek Ditch. This is a very uncertain water supply, as the water all sinks away before it reaches this land during the season when it is most needed. It probably should not be listed as irrigable land at all, although co

properties.Name: Old Dwarf
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney and side door. Out front stands a tent with two people inside. Another individual stands in front of the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son. Adopted son in public school.
properties.Education_: He and wife have no education.
properties.Crop_Desc: wheat, none; oats, 12 A.; alfalfa 40 A.; mixed hay, 5 A.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 10 range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair log house, no stable, no cellar
properties.House_Comm: Fair log house, no stable, no cellar
properties.Implement_: Disc, mower, harrow, rake, plow, binder, all standing outside
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or hauled from creek one mile.
properties.Remarks: This land is under the Lost Creek ditch, and the supply of water is not dependable. If there was adequate water he could irrigate practically all of his land. I found him at home, sitting in the shade of the tent. His alfalfa needed cutting, his fences n

properties.Name: Joseph Martinez
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with a chimney, window, and addition. A ladder rests on the house. To the front of the house is a frame building. Behind the  home is another frame building with multiple implements around it.
properties.Status: Fee Pat. Living on inherited land to which he has Pat. in Fee
properties.Education_: Carlisle. Wife went to Reservation school.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn, 2 miles below Wyola and also up Lodgegrass Creek.
properties.Acres: He has quite a large area, mostly pasture, very little irrigated. 120 A. cultivated.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 50 A. wild hay land.
properties.Stock_Desc: 12 work horses, some saddle horses, and probably some range horses.
properties.House_desc: Fair house, stable, storeroom, etc.
properties.House_Comm: Fair house, stable, storeroom, etc.
properties.Implement_: Good complete outfit
properties.Remarks: I repeatedly failed to see Joe at home, although he works very well, but it seems to be just a chance that he was always away when I was by his place. Jose is one Patent in Fee Indian who has retained most of his land. I understand it is encumbered, but

properties.Name: Bear Claw
properties.Crop_Desc: 20 A. wheat, 20 A. alfalfa, 20 A. wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 8 work horses, 2 saddle horses, 50 range horses, 6 cattle.
properties.House_desc: House, barn, both fair frame buildings.
properties.House_Comm: House, barn, both fair frame buildings
properties.Implement_: wagon, plow, mower, rake, stacker, buckrake, spring wagon
properties.Remarks:
Bear Claw himself lives in Lodgegrass, where he owns a fair cottage. He has not been able to work his land himself for some time. It has been rented out on a crop rental basis, under his general direction. 

He is an exception among the Indians in that h

properties.Name: Charles Brown
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with shack to the left. A wagon to the right of the home with a horse.
properties.Education_: Fort Shaw. Wife in Mission School.
properties.Health_Com: Poor. Bad enough to furnish any excuse for not working.
properties.Crop_Desc: 12 A. wheat, 6 A. oats, 10 A. alfalfa, 20 A. mixed hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 3 work horses, 5 saddle horses, no cattle.
properties.House_desc: cabin poorly furnished
properties.House_Comm: Cabin poorly furnished. ----- BUT I think that they are not counting some of the outbuildings that are pictured in the pictures.

Charles Brown got his Fee Patent under the former policy of the Office and disposed of his land. He has also had certain inherited interests sold and has disposed of that. I could not learn that he ever did work. 

He has a Cree Indian working on his pla

properties.Name: Joe Hill
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with a chimney, three windows, and a porch addition. To the front of the house is a fence and to the right is a wagon.
properties.Education_: Reservation school, Wife attended Mission school
properties.School_Des: Convenient to public school, where the children attend.
properties.Location_D: Big Horn Valley, 4 miles below St. Xavier.
properties.Crop_Desc: Practically all in hay. Small patch of wheat. Made some 25 tons of hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 2 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 6 range horses, no cattle. I would suggest that he trade the 4 saddle horses for 2 more work horses.
properties.House_desc: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.House_Comm: One fair frame house, log stable, meager furniture, outside toilet
properties.Implement_: Plow, harrow, mower, take, buckrake, wagon, spring wagon, and automobile
properties.Water_Desc: River. It is to be regreted that he cannot get his gasoline in the same place.
properties.Remarks: Joe has had a Patent-in-Fee for his own land and has probably sold it or mortgaged it, which amounts to the same. His wife's own allotment is now under lease. The land on which they are living is inherited land, which they have about 1/2 interest in. The

properties.Name: Dan Old Bull
properties.Linked_Acc: John Gros Ventre, Prairie Gros Ventre
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house surrounded by farmland.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 3 children. Married daughter and child live with him.
properties.Education_: Mission School. Wife went to Reservation Boarding School.
properties.Location_D: Lodgegrass Creek near St. Ann's Mission.
properties.Crop_Desc: Land is rented.
properties.Stock_Desc: Has limited number of work stock used partly by the renter.
properties.House_desc: very fair frame house, inadequately furnished.
properties.House_Comm: Very fair frame house, inadequately furnished.
properties.Implement_: Limited equipment used by tenant
properties.Remarks: This party really does nothing at all himself. He has been in poor health for some time. His land is rented on crop rental basis, under which he was to furnish part of the stock and equipment. He has done only fairly well with this. He really does not li

properties.Name: Victor Three Irons
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with two doors and multiple windows. To the left of the house is a large fram barn with another building next to it. Fence posts surround the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: wife and six children. Two in Public School.
properties.School_Des: Access to Public School by School wagon
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Valley, 5 miles below Agency.
properties.Crop_Desc: 35 A. of oats, 23 A. of alfalfa, 20 A. of beets, by tenant.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, no range horses
properties.House_desc: Good frame house and barn, root cellar, fair fences.
properties.Implement_: Fair farm outfit.
properties.Water_Desc: Ditch or Rriver. Tried for well but failed.
properties.Industry: Fair
properties.Remarks: This man has a very good education, knows very well how to work. He has been acting as an interpreter for the Examiner of Inheritance, so has most of his ground rented. He does a little farming. He has a nice looking house and barn, recently improved by

properties.Name: Medicine Rock Above
properties.Photo_Desc: There is a frame house and a log house in the photo. In between both houses is a tent. In front of the frame hosue stands a man, likely Medicine Rock Above.
properties.Family_Des: Wife, 3 children, grown son and daughter.
properties.School_Des: Access to indifferent Mission School. One boy of school age.
properties.Crop_Desc: 70 A. alfalfam 30 A. hay, no wheat or oats, some pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 6 saddle horses, 20 range horses, uncertain number of cattle on the range.
properties.House_desc: Good frame house, log house used for storeroom, no root cellar, no stable.
properties.House_Comm: Good frame house, log house used for storeroom, no root cellar, no stable.
properties.Implement_: Complete outfit for planting and harvesting, except binder and disc, including wagon and spring wagon. Automobile belonging to some of the family.
properties.Remarks: This man claims to have had about 100 cattle a few years ago, which he kept close about his place. He raised plenty of hay for them, brought them in and fed them when necessary and they have been increasing. He alleges that a former Superintendent advise

properties.Name: Simon Bull Tail
properties.Photo_Desc: Log house with two windows and front door. A few implements are scattered around the house.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and three children. One married daughter.
properties.Education_: He and wife went to mission school.
properties.Health_Com: Fair, though he wants to be sick to get out of work.
properties.Crop_Desc: 10 A. wheat, 20 A. mixed hay, 20 A. alfalfa.
properties.House_desc: Small log house, very poor shed for stable.
properties.House_Comm: Small log house, very poor shed for stable
properties.Implement_: Plow and mower only. Wagon and spring wagon.
properties.Remarks: Son-in-law, Campbell Big Hail, makes his home with him a part of the time and may work for him occasionally. Simon was not at home when I visited his place and indications about the house were that he was very seldom at home. The grass and weeds were gro

properties.Name: Henry Dewey Lande
properties.Photo_Desc: Frame house with building, possibly corral, behind it. A wagon to the left of the house and other implements surrounding it.
properties.Education_: Public schools through about 7th or 8th grade
properties.Crop_Desc: Corn, oats, wild hay.
properties.Stock_Desc: 4 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 25 range horses, 10 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Small frame house, store room, shed, stable
properties.House_Comm: Small frame house, store room, shed, stable
properties.Implement_: Mower, rake, plow, Fordson tractor, automobile
properties.Remarks: Dewey Lande's father was a white man. He was a very good farmer and stockman and kept his large family together and supported them. They did not have much farming land, but gave most of their attention to the cattle. The mother was a member of the tribe,

properties.Name: Packs the Hat
properties.Photo_Desc: First picture shows a frame house with two chimney's and a window. Two men, one likely Packs the Hat, stand infront of the house. The second picture shows a frame barn, a fence, and another buidling to the right side of the barn.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and adopted son with his wife and two children.
properties.Crop_Desc: 40 A. of alfalfa, 40 A. mixed hay. Remainder is pasture.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 10 saddle horses, 100 unbroken range horses, about 23 cattle.
properties.House_desc: Good log house, stable, corrals, cow sheds, granary, wood-house, good fences
properties.House_Comm: Good log house, stable, corrals, cow sheds, granary, wood-house, good fences
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of haying tools.
properties.Remarks: This man lives somewhat to himself. It is not usually profitable for him to raise grain, as it is too far for him to haul it to market. There is always a good market for hay, as it is a favorite feeding locality, adjacent to the range, where there is goo

properties.Name: Richard Daylight
properties.Photo_Desc: Two frame houses, both with chimneys. Fence posts surround the perimeter.
properties.Family_Des: Wife and 4 children, brother and sister.
properties.Education_: Reservation school. Wife in reservation school and Hampton.
properties.Location_D: Little Horn Vlley adjacent to Wyola
properties.Crop_Desc: 50 rented. 40 A. wheat. 6 oats. 5 alfalfa. Rest pasture cut by river.
properties.Stock_Desc: 6 work horses, 4 saddle horses, 30 range horses. 35 cattle.
properties.House_desc: 2 fair frame house, small stable, fair fences. No root cellar.
properties.House_Comm: 2 fair frame house, small stable, fair fences. No root cellar.
properties.Implement_: Fair outfit of implements. No mower. Wagon and spring wagon. No automobile.
properties.Industry: Only fair. If he should work as well as he talks about work he would be a great farmer. He is living on his wife's allotment which is cut by the river, and is only fair farming land. His own land is located on the Big Horn River and is not being handled
